description:
nice drinks but pricey. if you're willing to blow $$$ for really nice drinks, this is the place. 

maybe $12~$15 is fair for cocktails. maybe only in sf. that's why this place gets an extra star.
author: Sang P.

description:
I REALLY liked this place for one solid reason: its soundtrack. I'm not sure who had the "aux cord," per say, but they played some of my favorite songs and as my friends and I sat at a cozy corner, I remember feeling really in tune with the place. 

The drinks were good, and as it was still early, it was easy to be served and find a place to sit. They also had a Bacardi rep there who came up to us and gave us free shirts!!

I will surely be returning.
author: Jenna M.

description:
This review is for 3.5 stars. 

Really good drinks to start. Priced fairly at about $12-13 for fresh crafted cocktails that are made in front of you with precision. Interesting concoctions with a bunch of whiskey and bourbon based as well as more softer and mintier options as well. Beer game is week but they do have a few of each type of wines if cocktails aren't your game. 

The bad part came with the bouncer. First off, not sure it's necessary to have an outright bouncer at a low key cocktail bar - it's a bar not a club. Second, he was very pushy on kicking us all out at 2am with drinks in hand. We ordered our last cocktail at last call around 1:45am. So obviously we still had a few sips at least at 2am. Instead of letting us finish as would be normal courtesy he told us to either chug our cocktails or leave them and go. Apparently he wanted to go home at exactly 2 and he had better places to be. Seems strange and rude to be served a pricy well crafted drink only to have to chug it. Either push last call up 10 more minutes or have some type of window on the strict close policy. There were multiple groups there all still with drinks in hand so wasn't a singular problem. Very poor representation on the bars part as a result of this bouncer. 

Servers were great beyond that and very reactive to our needs. But this rubbed us the wrong way. Only reason we came here was that the bar next door closed early. Not worth a late night cap unless you're ready to chug.
author: Zachary A.

description: Rye is my first stop of the night and since it is fall I tried the Pumpkin Rumpkin.  Because I am there so early I can the entire place.  There are plenty of seats at the bar and away from the bar, and a smoking section right outside.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is soothing.
author: Darylynn D.

description: Cool little bar that came recommended from a bartender @ The Douglass Room - apparently his cousin runs this place. We managed to get seats at a little table by the bar, and someone dropped off a menu. I got Masterstroke ($13), which has rum, umeshu plum liqueur, celery shrub, and gold leaf. I was excited about the gold leaf but it was more like tiny gold dust on the surface of the cocktail lol. Anyways, it was good nonetheless. I like the intimate vibe but I can see how it could easily become overcrowded during prime times.
author: Jen L.

description: Yummy cocktails, awesome ambiance, and great staff make for a perfect after work/weekend spot to grab a drink. The bartender was so sweet when I was having trouble deciding which cocktail to get - she asked me what flavors I was wanting and then just made up a drink with those kinds of flavors. It was amazingly tasty! Will definitely be back!
author: Kelsey E.

description:
This is a super cute bar, great atmosphere for a date or to chill with friends. They have an amazing selection of whiskey and other liquors but their old fashioneds and Manhattans are supurb!! They also have a cocktail special of the day or week that are definitely worth checking out! The bar area is pretty open and they have a good amount of tables and seating at the bar.  

The bartenders are super friendly and know how to mix up a fantastic cocktail. They have dim lighting and candles, the little outside patio area is covered and provides just enough privacy from the outside sidewalk since it is covered and has ivy growing around it. 

The area that Rye is in is a little sketch but definitely worth the visit and trip for cocktails and night caps alike. You will not be disappointed!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Nice place with plenty of bartenders and a good collection of whiskeys. However, when we were there, it was so loud that we couldn't hear one another across the table. So, if you're looking for a place to chill and have a conversation, this may not be the best place unless you're sitting next to each other at the bar or on one of the benches. 

There is a "smoking cage," which is a patio with a glass wall. Unfortunately, the seal between that and the rest of the bar is kind of weak and smoke blew into the place whenever the door was opened. I don't know if it bothered anyone else, but I was sitting right near the door.

I started with the "cure all," which had a nice spiced flavor, but did lose any personality of the whiskey. A good sipper, though. Next, for something different, I tried the Coco Bitter, which had whiskey, creme de cacao and coconut milk, with a sprig of mint. This is probably a good one for those who don't like whiskey at all: it tasted really sweet and minty, like a peppermint patty. I'm not a fan of drinks like that, but it was executed well and I'm sure it has its audience.

For the final choice, I went to the completely opposite end of the spectrum with the "gin ne sais quoi," which was a gin-forward cocktail on their feature board. It is worth checking that board when you arrive to see what they're working on that day. I like gin. Maybe not as much as I once did, but my complaint about the other two drinks did not apply here: I could definitely taste the gin. Probably not the best one to end the night on, but I'm glad I tried it.

Cocktails on their menu are $12-13 at this time, with a few offered for $2 less during happy hour. If you're looking for whiskey shots, they have an extensive collection in all kinds of price ranges. For example, I saw an impressive collection of Japanese whisky from Suntory: wide coverage of both the single malt and blended offerings across several age ranges.
author: Doug B.

description:
OMG. One of my favorite bars we visited but was ruined by a rude desperate girl at the bar. 
I got the old fashion and it was delicious. My friend also enjoyed his Pimm's Cup. 
We got here around 9pm for a party of 4. Three of us sat at the bar and I put my jacket down to save a seat for our last person. A rude girl ordered her drink at the gap and sat on the chair. Without even asking. She brushed my jacket off as if I was using it to only put my jacket somewhere. When the fourth person came to join us...we had to just stand at the bar instead of sit because this rude girl. 
Would definitely come back for another old fashioned. Hopefully the desperate rude girl isn't there anymore.
author: Teresa L.

description: I found a gem! This place is super nice. The bartender knows what he's doing. Fantastic drink menu. Awesome atmosphere. Will definitely come back!!
author: Glorimar A.

description: I'm coming here for the second time. It's the 5th stop tonight and trust me, it's been the best so far. Unassuming, simple and great! Good service, great drinks and nice music at reasonable rates! Super place to have a nice catch up with your friends! Will come again!
author: Riya S.

description: Great cocktails of all sorts!  Somewhat dim inside and not too loud.  They have a outdoor patio that fits maybe 15 at most.  I got to try a number of cocktails and love the variety of flavor profiles.  Inside seating, we were able to to fit 8-10 people.
author: Bobby L.

description: Rye Lounge Bar is a really nice place. Great service, I enjoyed the atmosphere. They like to make it feel like you are part of a certain culture.
author: Rachael W.

description: Interesting little spot. Got a cool vibe and the bartenders seem to know what they are doing with the cocktails so I'll come back. Great place to shoot the shit with a friend, maybe impress a tinder date or a spot to take out of towners when showing SF.
author: Nicholas W.

description: Great find in Lower Nob Hill. We popped in randomly on a Saturday night for nightcaps and we were so impressed! These bartenders are top notch.  The drink menu is very creative. As a gin lover, I had the Ethereal Pause and it was fantastic. If I lived here, this would be my bar.
author: Megan L.

description: Cool layout bar with plenty of open space.  I like the selection of whiskey and bourbon that they carry.  I see a few rare selections.  I tried their old fashion without looking at what they use as their base. The drink was just a bit sweet for me, but would be perfect for my friend.
author: Charlie T.

description:
We had come one night after dinner since I had seen some great reviews and it seemed like an interesting place to stop off at for an after dinner drink. 

We got some interesting drinks (to be honest I dont remember what exactly we got). It's a pretty large space with lots of tables so easy to grab one with your friends. The drinks were good, creative, but a bit too strong for me. Like they were just being too creative, but it didn't taste that great.  Overall, good experience though!
author: Nina Y.

description: Good place for a night out  with your girlfriends or even with a date. Music isn't too loud which is good for conversation. Bar tenders were nice as well. Tried the Basil Gimlet with gin and I'm hooked. Will definitely go back for it again. Prices on a high side.
author: Kath S.

description:
Rye has pretty much been my home bar for my myriad visits to SF over the past 8 years for work. It hits the sweet spot for me - excellent cocktails, chill vibe, unpretentious and friendly bartenders, diverse liquor, wine and beer offerings, and mostly decent crowd. Granted I only ever visit on weeknights. But that works perfect for me. 

My homie Ruggerford introduced me to this haunt many moons ago and I've never looked back. I've consumed libations in many of this city's iconic craft bars, and Rye easily holds its own. There's a nice mix of spirit-forward drinks and creative shaken concoctions as well. The prices track average cocktail prices for this caliber of drinks. And I rarely taste anything I don't like. There are plenty of dark corners to cozy into with friends, or you can sit at the bar watch the bartenders in action. 

It's as simple and straightforward as that. Good drinks, good service, good space, and no bullshit. What every bar should be.
author: Don B.

description:
This place is a casual, upscale, whiskey inspired bar with an array of cocktails set at somewhat decent prices but can be a bit steep (full menu not displayed on Yelp menu). Perhaps the beer menu could be better for those in our party that don't like liquor. The bartenders could be more attentive and are decently skilled at their craft. 

The atmosphere is youthful yet mature. Typically, it's in the upper 20s- 40s crowd.

The music is not tailored to one specific style and is enjoyable -- aside from it being TOO loud; I like to not shout at people or hover too close just for them to hear me and vice versa. Honestly, this style of unbearable loudness is overrated and trying too hard to be young.

This place is smaller than I remember it to be, so it can get a little cozy but it's not too bad --- we hopped over here from another lounge on Halloween.  

Overall, this place is decent and it fulfilled our enjoyment of the party we attended, but it was not incredibly amazing to revisit a third time.
author: Roze T.

description:
A diverse, unique and well structured cocktail menu. The ambiance is on the dark side, not my preference, but for those that dig it-check it out. A lounge type atmosphere that had plenty of room for everyone. 

Went with a group and all the different drinks ordered were enjoyed. 

This is a great place to stop in to enjoy a cocktail.
author: Kayla B.

description: Came here for a late night drink. Bartenders were friendly and the drinks were carefully crafted. They have small tables, booths, and an outdoor smoking/patio area. If you like whiskey this spot is a must visit. Makes for a great date spot as well!
author: Rucha B.

description: Stopped by for a cocktail. Very crowded and after tasting the cocktails I can see why. Wish it had more seating but there was plenty of room to stand by the bar. I had a "Jack and the giant peach" which was the special and it was a taste of summer. Pretty to look at and sweet too. A good place for having a nice drink. Friendly bouncer and bartenders.
author: Caroline K.

description:
Rye, I love you!  I love you for not just for your rye but for your awesome knowledgeable staff,  the patrons you attract, the ambiance you provide.  We're here for more than just drinks but really, I must say, I love your cocktails and also educating us on the different ryes you carry.

We must... come... back... 

:)
author: Sandra L.

description: Loved this place ! A secret hideaway love the Decor. Bartender was attentive even though we didn't go up to bar they still came to us that was very nice
author: Amy L.

description: Love love RYE! The ambiance is everything and more. We stumbled upon this place while staying at a nearby hotel. We couldn't resist walking in after seeing the chic stylish decor. The customer service is a 10 out of 10. If you're nearby, this is must try.
author: Loren A.

description: Cute, unassuming bar flanked on either side by Mensho Tokyo and Osha Thai. I dropped by on a Saturday night after grabbing dinner at Osha Thai and loved the ambiance inside. We were able to grab a table and get our drinks within 10 minutes of getting inside which was great! The drinks themselves were really good and the noise level was just right, meaning that there was a dull roar but nothing too ridiculous where you had to scream at the top of your lungs to be heard. Definitely drop by if you are in the area!
author: Lakshmi M.

description: A great place to relax and friends for drinks. There is a fabulous covered patio for smoking, which is quaint. Drinks were great, and barmen nice / cool.
author: Nathaniel T.

description: After having drinks at a nearby establishment that were less than stellar, came here as Dan can definitely make some very tasty and legit old fashions, martinis and other cocktails.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Was able to find a seat on a Saturday evening relatively easily for 4 people. Lots of people here, though not OVERLY crowed. Night seemed to skew heavily asian (i'm asian too, but it was like an odd congregation). 

Drinks were pretty, and relatively tasty. Gin Rye mule was great, overall vibe of the place is nice - modern, hipster. Love that there's a little outdoorsy part as well. 

TLDR: Chill place, good drinks, right amount of people.
author: Kristie C.

description:
It was beautiful weather wise yesterday, so a group of us wanted to go to a bar with a patio. When we found out said bar was closed, we decided to walk down the street to Rye. It was Wednesday, April 6th around 6pm. We easily found a table for our group of five as it wasn't very busy at that time. It was still happy hour, so we got $2 off all cocktails. I believe their HH ends at 7:30pm. Enough time to take advantage with two drinks!

Prices below are the prices on their regular menu. Not their HH prices.

*Nikka Presbyterian: Japanese Whisky, spiced ginger syrup, and seltzer, with a lemon twist ($14)
*Rye Old Fashioned Cure-All: House made Rock & Rye, Tempus Fugit Creme de Cacao, and bitters; with an orange peel ($10)

I had the nikka presbyterian first. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was a nice refreshing drink. Spicy and bubbly, but it still packed an alcoholic punch. Turned out to be a nice drink to start off the night. The old fashioned wasn't really my style. It was rather sweet and the creme de cacao gave it an odd flavor. I like a more straight forward old fashioned.

I liked the vibe of Rye. I seriously haven't been here in 8+ years, but I remembered it having a dark boozy atmosphere. Yesterday, it was light and fun. I liked their leather ottomans / chairs and tables. It was a comfy place to just chill and have a couple drinks.

Great place to hang out and catch up with friends. Make sure to get here before 7:30pm so you can take advantage of their HH special!
author: Elena N.

description: Good atmosphere and great for groups! They could use some improvement by installing speakers for music. The lighting is very dim but overall great experience and delicious drinks.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Rye is a nice bar, great choice of drinks and a chill atmosphere. Service is friendly and there is quite some space so theres a big chance you will find seating. As the name implies it is not so much a bar for beers, but it has a great choice of whiskeys including Japanese ones. Would definitely go back, it is a shame we've found it on the last evening.
author: Giliam G.

description: A great place to relax and friends for drinks. The drinks were gorgeous, and the barmen are nice / cool. We are always happy to come here and have a couple of cocktails.
author: Aniyah G.

description:
I've frequented Rye off and on for years(many years) and over this time period, I can honestly say I now have a new found appreciation of this lounge spot in the Tenderloin. The layout and decor looks mostly the same. How can you miss the smokers cage facing Geary St?

The Basil Gimlet is the staple drink I've come to expect to not let me down and it did not on my most recent visit this month. We visited during New Year's weekend so it felt like the crowd was abnormally thin, which worked out because ordering was a breeze.

Although service has never been an issue, I can imagine it being difficult on a normal Friday/Sat evening to get your order in. If you do get frustrated there are plenty of other watering holes within walking distance. For my buck, Rye is a solid option.
author: Dennis W.

description: Go with the modern cocktail! Changes all the time but the taste is always amazing! Nice low key low lit spot with friendly staff and good music
author: Beta T.

description: It's called "Rye," but don't sell them short on their amazing brown liquor selection, including ryes, bourbons, scotches, and Japanese browns.  Dan is the man - super knowledgeable and made great cocktails. If you want a Miller Lite or a glass of wine, don't come here. But if you want to try a wide range of browns and cocktails utilizing such browns, come here and see what's up.
author: Peter K.

description:
Okay this has got to be one of my favorite bars in the city now! Super cute. Fantastic bartenders. Classy cocktails. There's tons of great restaurants around the area that will make Rye the most natural choice for post-dinner aperitifs. I walked in to meet a few friends and was in awe of the pretty lights and sexy mood. There is a variety of seating at the bar and not. There's even an outdoor patio section. 

My friends and I sat at the bar to enjoy a spicy basil gimlet then migrated to one of the longer tables in the back. Both cocktails I ordered were amazing. They were expertly crafted in a timely manner. This place is simple and sexy (can't say that enough) so come check out their impressive selection of cocktails, bring a date, and enjoy the experience!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
It's pretty cool that you can get a $4 Modelo or a really blown-out cocktail. Diff'rent strokes for diff'rent folks. 

It's a big space, although there's deceptively little seating. I guess it's probably more of a standing-up joint when it's really busy. 

There's a little cage outside that you can smoke in if you want to smoke outside while continuing to drink your drink. Because of course you do. 

The '80s post-punk / new wave soundtrack really owned.
author: Jim M.

description: We came here on Fourth of July and were surprised to find that it wasn't too crowded and the drinks were on point
author: Massiel S.

description:
I visited Rye in 2011 and I remember having great drinks and a fun time... My impression was so good, that I confirmed it was still open so that I could return on this recent trip. 

Our experience was as great as it was a few years ago. Cocktails are amazing. Bartenders here are experts and will not serve you a bad drink. The basil gimlet is still a winner, however the birds of a feather is a solid choice for bourbon/rye drinkers. If you love an old fashioned or a Manhattan, then this cocktail will leave you going nuts.

Fridays and Saturdays it gets busy, so plan accordingly. Seating is available indoor and outdoor. Music was great and the vibe was fun. I would certainly return on future trips.
author: Arturo B.

description:
Great cocktail spot in the TenderNob. This place is very nondescript and you will almost miss it walking down Geary street, but once you walk in it is a great spot to spend time for some drinks. 

ATMOSPHERE:
The place is quite big, the actual bar area only has a few seats but there is a whole other side room with booths, tables, and even a small little patio in the front.  The patio is perfect for people watching and nice to cozy up on a date. 

DRINKS:
The drinks here are solid.  Prices are about what you would expect ($9-$13) with a large selection of any spirit you could think of. 

SERVICE:
I had great service here. The bartender greeted me immediately, got me water (always a plus) and helped my indecisive self pick out the best drink. 

One tip- they use an iPad for the credit card payment system, great that credit cards are accepted, but i noticed when you go to sign it automatically sets to a 20%tip, I have a feeling this could throw you off sometimes (with the possibility that three drinks will warrant a $8 tip with the prices?) 
Otherwise, great place to stop and have a nice drink if you're in the area.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Amazing cocktail bar, if you are looking for a great craft cocktail and a great selection of whiskey it's a great spot, the bartenders were great. Creative cocktails and good execution
author: Rodrigo M.

description: I loved this place. We went here on a saturday night, luckily got a booth so everyone had a place to sit and chat as we were tired from strolling around the city the entire day. That said, this place has a great vibe, the music and the drinks were good too.I would recommend this place to anyone who likes a nice place to hang out and have a few drinks with friends. If you go a little late, say around 11:30 pm, you will find enough space to sit and if you do not care to get seats, go any time you feel like. This place is too good to be missed.
author: Ramyata M.

description: Greg Greg and only Gregory the bartender. He's easily the coolest bartender I've met. Had the delicious commonwealth tonic and my husband just had a whisky coke. It was such a good cocktail and it was fascinating to watch Greg whip up cocktails in the most artistic way. Amazing vibe !! Must must visit
author: Ashmita V.

description:
This was a great place to get a nice cocktail. The lighting was very dim and the atmosphere was very dark/romantic. I like that it was in walking distance from my hotel that was located in Union Square. 

The price was reasonable for San Francisco pricing. It Also felt very large inside compared to a lot of the places in the surrounding area. It was recommended by a friend and I would pass on the recommendation to anyone in the area.
author: Chelsea B.

description: If I indulged more on drinks I would probably really appreciate this joint. It's neat, chill, darkly lit, and has really mellow vibes. It's definitely great for getting a few drinks with company to chit chat. I honestly think their bartenders are great and the drinks are great, but if you prefer a place with more upbeat music, and more "lit" place, this might be a bore for you. I would definitely start my night here and go somewhere else.
author: Grace K.

description: I really like the space. We came here last weekend for some late night hang out. Cool space, decent drinks, and not too crowded. The reason why I am giving it one star is the shady behavior from the bartender. She automatically picked 20% tip for our order and asked me to sign. I don't mind tipping 20% for drinks but no one like being treat like a fool. I can imagine they do this a lot to their tipsy patrons. This is a unacceptable predator behavior that clearly take advantage of the customer condition. If you go here, be mindful of your bill when signing!!!
author: Sam H.

description: Araya made an amazing negroni and a really good war bonnet. This place is serious about their whiskies! Will be back!
author: Priya V.

description:
When my best friend showed up on my doorstep from Hawaii, I needed to figure out a quick weekend extravaganza. Amongst all the touristy things, I decided to think of a few places to start the evening right. After searching Yelp, I came across Rye. The ratings were good and in a place where Yelpers can get pretty brutal, I was excited to try a place that actually did well. 

Walking in, it reminded me of a cool hipster speakeasy take of a bar. Exposed brick, dim lighting, dark features, high tops, booth seats and bar seating, this place looked legit! 

Our mixologists weren't much of talkers but they sure were efficient. For my drink I got the Pimm's Cup #5 as it was told to be one of the most popular. For $10, you'll get their house-made creation of a Pimm's number 5 with a rye whiskey base, lemon, English cucumbers, mint, ginger syrup and seltzer, garnished with a mint sprig. Definitely a GREAT DRINK. The mint and ginger flavors married well and the seltzer gave it a little kick. Definitely my drink of choice there from now out. 

This is one of the reasons I love the Tenderloin. Great spots that show San Francisco's best culture. Don't be scared of the neighborhood. Put on your big boy/girl pants and get down to this place!
author: Rockne H.

description: Came here for happy hour on a weeknight. It was really busy, but luckily our friends snagged a table and the 7 of us squeezed in. The drinks were good, but what I really enjoyed was the atmosphere and decor. The bar tenders were also very friendly, even when just asking for a glass of water. Definitely recommend for others to check it out.
author: Susan G.

description: Hip cocktail bar.  This place has great decor and art.  Dark lighting makes it perfect for a date.  I highly recommend their mule.
author: Rob S.

description: Nice place but there is no pool table at Rye, even though it comes up in Yelp search. Service was great!
author: Dave H.

description:
Love the atmosphere! Met a friend who lives in SF at Rye. She recommended this place over Bourbon and Branch. We didn't sample many drinks; just got the Basil Gimlet (multiple). The drink is very delicious and potent! 

Service was great; it was surprisingly empty. I'm guessing it may have been because of Comicon. We were told the place is usually very packed. We enjoyed our time there!
author: Supriya M.

description:
To call the guys behind the bar a bartender would be an insult.  

These guys are chemists.
These guys are artists.
These guys are....amazing.

Get yourself a mule, a gimlet, or a beer, and join me in the cage.  You'll find me there with a nice cigar just chillin.  Give the homeless guys a couple bucks for a meal, it's karma.
author: Ron L.

description: Rye is a nice bar. It kind of blends in with the other businesses on either side of it so you might miss it when looking for it, but I think that's part of the charm. After trying to go to a very crowded Redford's, we came here instead where we were easily able to get a spot at the bar. I didn't check out the back lounge area, but I love the ambiance of Rye. They have a nice cocktail menu and I went with the La Lambada, a refreshing mezcal cocktail. We only stayed for one drink, but I was certainly curious to try a different one.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
TL;DR - Post-ramen drinks, yes.

-FEELS-
Dark and mysterious, industrial but cozy. Its a good date place ya'll.

-DRINKS-
La lambada: I've kinda been on a mezcal kick lately and the mezcal cocktail they make here is stupendous. Its spicy and sweet and smokey and delicious. 
Pimm's Cup: Refreshing but still strong!

Price-wise, yeah, its a little more costly than other bars. But the space and the drinks definitely make up for it!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Was bar hopping around the area. This was our last stop. Grabbed some quick drinks here before dinner. 

Loud and noisy. Very crowded. Took a while to get our drinks. Cocktails were pretty tasty though.
author: Jennifer L.

description: An extensive list of whiskeys backed by knowledgeable bartenders.  If you are a fan of excellent drams properly served,  this is a place you should visit
author: David D.

description:
I like Rye. It's dark, sexy, and classy. I probably should've tried their signature drinks but you know how much I love my Moscow Mules. I had to put down some collateral for the copper mug and while I don't like that practice, I totally get it.

The other patrons were interesting and we had a nice conversation with a political geologist who has lived all over the world.
author: Yi Z.

description:
This has become a spot I have been enjoying more and more, friendly bar keeps and prompt service. They have a outdoor area that's they don't mind if you smoke in, large steel gate to keep the crazies out lol.
The decor is awesome, black leather couches in the lounge area, wine racks up the walls and large steel doors, hardwood flooring on the ceiling.
My only complaint about this place is the door to the bathroom does not close on its own and I find myself constantly having to get up and close the damn door. The door to the smoking area outside also doesn't close on its own, hardly an issue for me I am more concerned with the bathroom door.

So you are sitting on this nice leather couch talking with your date and either you tolerate the smell of the smoke and the blinding fluorescent light emanating from the bathroom... or you get up every 6 minutes to close doors.
I generally make sure to close doors behind me as it is how I was raised. I understand you have a couple of drinks and forget to do things of this nature but it does get a little frustrating at times hah
Rye is doing a great job all in all! I will continue to close the doors for everyone because I like the place so much! Lol
author: Nathan B.

description:
Rye is a pretty freaking awesome bar of you ask me. This place has one of those modern, yet trendy vibes to it that makes it a fantastic ambiance to get your drink on. The drinks here are very eclectic and flavorful and the bartenders are fairly skilled on their craft. Naturally this place has a huge whiskey selection, primarily bourbon but some hard to find bottles as well. They can also make fantastic gin concoctions and they fabricate a delicious Moscow Mule. Overall, Rye is a fantastic bar with an awesome ambiance that'll keep you coming back. 

Pros-
Drinks
Service 
Whiskey selection
Bartenders 
Ambiance 
Decor 
Bar layout 

Cons-
Small 
Pricey per drink
author: Jeremy S.

description: I love Rye!  Was in the city from LA and wanted to go out for a great drink in a new place.  This was the ticket! I heard they have amazing craft cocktails and the bartenders were really nice and since I was travelling alone that was important.  My Rye ambassador was Dan, and not only was he adorable but he made a great cocktail and kept checking in with me since I was alone.  I met some really fun people, it gets really loud in there so there were times it was hard to hear but I can't wait to go back next time I'm in town.  Dan thank you so much for everything I'll see you in October!
author: Pamela F.

description:
Other Yelpers here talk about the great bartenders, but when my husband and I went in this past Thursday night, I found them to be cold and arrogant. We were the only ones in the bar, and we were walking to the bar, and there was no acknowledgement from either of the two bartenders, until I broke the silence with a "hi". More people started coming in, and the bartenders were much friendlier to those folks. And when I closed my tab, there was absolutely no form of goodbye or thank you or see ya, he just took the ipad from my hands and walked away. Made me wish I didn't give any tip.

I'm giving 2 stars instead of just 1 for bad personalities because the drinks are really good.
author: Kitty H.

description: Drinks were a little on the expensive size. I got a whiskey coke but not gonna complain because bartender made it pretty strong. Service was quick as there was not a large crowd.
author: Amanda A.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and my bartender was great! I like to ask for custom drinks so I ordered 2 cocktails. My request = something light, fruity, no dark liquor, not too strong... The cocktails were both good but one of them was AMAZING! Watching her mix the drink was true art, she tasted it several times adding different ingredients and even brought out the electronic whisk to foam up the egg whites! The drink tasted like a sherbert, yum! 

Service is a bit slow, but it's because the bartenders are taking their time to make good drinks. Which they should, given the cocktails are about $15 (including tip). So it's a bit pricey at $30 for 2 cocktails but what do you expect in downtown San Francisco... 

This place has a bougie, laid back vibe. No ratchet drunkness going on. Everyone was sipping on cocktails and the place was full but not overly crowded. Our group of 6 all had seats at a table in the back. The bathrooms could use some cleaning but it's not the establishment's fault if people are throwing up in there... Nasty! 

Definitely recommend checking this place out for some classy, unique drinks!
author: Allison L.

description: A staple in San Francisco cocktail bars. The Rye constantly pops up on San Francisco's must visit cocktail bars and I see why. The mixology skills here are great. This is a nice dark intimate spot with beautiful cocktails. The neighborhood is not ideal, but it is worth the drinks. They are especially known for their darks. Come here for the vibe and a drink.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Lol, watch me as I try to recall my night here:

So we walked in around 10pm on a Friday night and the crowd was so-so. My friend and I just wanted a "chill" night so we ordered two drinks each. I wish I remember what they were called! I'll post a picture later. Anyway, they were pretty good. They took their time making the drinks, which a lot of bars don't usually do. So I'll commend them on that. 

I do remember ordering two spicy watermelon margaritas. They were so good, a bit peppery and more on the spicy side though! I am a lover of watermelon and delicious fruity cocktails, so this was pretty good. It was only $6! I am not sure if they have this as a weekly promotion, but if you go - do try the margaritas. It isn't all too crowded, so it was easy to find a seat. I would say this is definitely a more "pre-game let's chill here before we go hard" kind of bar. Don't get too trashy, now.
author: Ana L.

description:
I always seem to end up at Rye at least once during each of my trips to San Francisco. The bar is just a little off the beaten path from the busy shopping area, and the scene is dark and chill. 

Cocktails are inventive and reasonably priced, and I've never experienced any hint of snobbishness from the bartenders when I've asked for drinks off the menu. Finally, they have bar snacks. And who doesn't love some bar snacks?
author: Michelle C.

description:
Rye has that kind of warm, welcoming atmosphere that is such a rarity in modern cocktail bars, and bars in San Francisco in particular. I've been here three times now and each experience is positive and unique. It goes without saying that they also mix a damn fine cocktail. 

Rye doesn't seem to feel the need to impress you with a comically massive wall of every liquor imaginable and bartenders with bow ties. So many cocktail establishments feel cold and intimidating in this sense. Rye's bar area is relatively small with a laid back feel that makes it easy to chat up a neighbor. I'm not going to pretend I'm any expert on cocktails, and theirs are just as pricey as anywhere else, but I appreciate their laid back attitudes and willingness to play around with recipes. 

If you don't think Lower Nob Hill and the Tenderloin have much to offer as far as a classy drink, think again. Rye is worth the visit and a welcome haven for both casual and serious cocktail afficienados.
author: Alex L.

description:
Why Rye, why!?

Why are you located in such a sketch area??

Thankfully, I was with an individual who doubled as my bodyguard. I already had my cocktail-crazed eyes glued to the $10 PIMM'S CUP #5, a house-made recreation of the original Pimm's No. 5 with a rye whiskey base, lemon, english cucumber, mint, ginger syrup, and seltzer. Ultimately, my friend decided on the special written on the board: the $11 "This Ancho First Rodeo (?)" made with 1.5 bourbon, 1 ancho chili liquor, 0.5 creme de cacao, 0.5 lemon, a dash of angostura bitters, with egg white, topped with bourbon barrel aged beer (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rye-san-francisco?select=12AM0e4ypK1M9g7KpOKVZA#12AM0e4ypK1M9g7KpOKVZA). And, staying true to its name, he asked for his drink as a question ahaha.

I adored their rendition of the Pimm's Cup #5, which I would colloquially describe as a strongly gingerfied mojito with rum swapped out for whiskey. After some Wiki research, I learned that Pimm's Cup is a fruit cup, an English-specialty long drink comprised of a spirit base (#5 uses rye whiskey) and a soft drink (ginger syrup in this case). Despite it being labeled a starter rather than a cocktail (thanks for calling my palate a wimp, Rye), the drink harmoniously highlighted the duo of mint and ginger, the perfect partners-in-crime for masking the taste of alcohol. The bartender muddles...smashes some real ginger into the drink, and he sticks in a cucumber peel to seal the deal. Ooh I should request smashed cucumber in it next time. Mint + ginger + cucumber = EPIC TRIFECTA.

My friend said that the egg white in the Ancho First Rodeo (?) lends to the creamy froth of the drink, but not so much the flavor. The bourbon went down smoothly and paired well with the blend of light ancho chili and cacao creme, sprinkled with some dark cacao bits. I didn't really taste the lemon or ango, but perhaps the chocolate and cream dimensions outweighed the citrus. This was a drink that grew on me, mhmmm.

Menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rye-san-francisco?select=12AM0e4ypK1M9g7KpOKVZA#2nQxi8z9lnRTLxy9oPooeQ
and
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rye-san-francisco?select=12AM0e4ypK1M9g7KpOKVZA#GZxIG2JgFp37d46UsKV2Fw

Random facts: They have a lone restroom in the back, next to the humongous chalkboard (omg we forgot to leave our marks! Too busy moving on to the next one...next time grr), which is also next to the pool table. The seating includes bar seats, some small tables in the side area and back, and chairs along the side wall. It can get cushy, but it never got crowded. Oh, and they have an open air porch in the front of the venue...which comes off more as a prison for smokers =__=

tbh, I enjoyed Rye's drinks as much as I enjoyed the Alembic's, and I would give them 5 stars...but, y'know, I don't think 2 drinks is a large enough sample size. I need to have tried a representative variety of drinks so that I can appropriately evaluate this cocktail bar with statistical significance. A very valid reason to return to Rye, o' course. 

Which means a return to the Tenderloin...why Rye, whyyyyyyyyyy.
author: Adele F.

description:
Great selection of whiskeys, and a very cozy, intimate environment. There's some bigger bench seating down behind the bar and some high tops on the "first floor" when you first walk in. It also looked like they had a little caged area that was outside but fenced in where you could drink and hang out-- which is a nice option as well. 

Service was great and the drinks were delicious. Can't complain!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: This might be a bit unfair since we had only ordered a drink each but that's all we needed to decide we would move on.  The Old Fashioned tasted similar to fireball so that was the end of it.  Bar is nice, ambiance is good, drinks are... well don't order the Old Fashioned.
author: Joshua T.

description: Tasty libations and extremely friendly! Very decent prices. Super cool vibe, yet not too dark. 5.10.17
author: Gary M.

description: Nice cozy setup, the bar tender was nice and quick. Drinks were good too, specially liked their drink of the day. Seating is pretty good, they have a very small patio space too for smokers.
author: Roma M.

description:
Rye,

The bartenders knew their drinks.... need we say more well ok, they were professional and educated in scotches as well as whisky.

Thank you for making my experience a positive Tuesday night! 

Early to mid week service is tough and these guys owned every person.

Recommend yes! Great classic drinks yes! Great creations? Daily!
author: Roxy H.

description:
This place was OK. 

I was looking for places that made really good mixed drinks, being the mood for some whiskey-based refreshment. I found this location. The name told me it should be what I'm looking for. 

There were only a few people sitting at the bar when we arrived (it was 6:30ish on a Tuesday night). It had a cool vibe to it- dark, lots of dark distressed wood and candlelight. I asked the bartender (a girl squeezing herself into a midriff-exposing top that she really shouldn't have been trying to wear) if we could sit anywhere, and she said yes but we had to order at the bar. 

My date sat, while I waited at the bar to order. She was conversing with some customers she seemed to know, and it took a long time for her to move her attention to me. I stood there awkwardly waiting at the end of the bar. Finally should took my drink orders, and proceeded to make them. It took a long time, but was pretty neat to watch- they are definitely particular about their drink-making there. With all of the hullabaloo that went into making them, I expected to have two of the best cocktails I'd ever had. They were good, but not outstanding (see pictures). 

It seems like a cool place for small groups to hang out. Definitely a hipster vibe.
author: Mari K.

description:
Good cocktails, nice bartenders, and spacious seatings..

However, just not my type of crowd. Came here on Sunday night and the people here were super loud and obnoxious and just awkward..

Thought it might just be an off night but walked by here again with a friend Tuesday night and same scenario..loud obnoxious and awkward
author: Jenn K.

description: Rye is the best cocktail bar/ cocktail lounge/ place you go, if you want to have a good drink. Julie and Aryea are literally the best. The la lambada (ask for it with a little extra spice) is my favorite drink in The City, and the ethereal pause is delicious. Rye also makes the best Pimm's cup in SF, not to mention they have a solid spirits selection and can make you just about anything. All the bartenders are dope, great atmosphere and they always have some funky yet I like this song kind of music playing, oh and did I mention Julie is the freaking best. Love Rye.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Pretty solid. A friend and I were bar hopping in the area and saw the reviews at Rye. I dig Rye since it's got a nice vibe, and is fairly spacious and comfortable relative to other bars. The place is pretty big -- there's the initial bar area and a few seats, but if you go onto the side, there's an outdoor... patio, not really a patio but a more outdoor seating area vs. smaller intimate table for twos and comfortable couches. The place isn't too loud which I like and also is well-lit enough for a bar at least. 

We came on a Friday night around 10pm and looks like we got pretty lucky since most Yelpers complain about long lines -- I pretty much came in and got my drink in under a few minutes. Can't remember what it was called, but it was pretty delicious.

tldr; would recommend since it doesn't feel too crowded, but maybe we just got lucky since it was early -- good drinks though
author: Jasmine X.

description: We love the atmosphere here,  and the drinks are always creative. We particularly liked their Chapter & Verse special. The spiciness was perfect. Friendly bartenders too! Definitely recommend for date night or an outing with a small group of friends.
author: Kelly D.

description: High end cocktails, large windows, and chill music makes this place a bit romantic and yet manly enough for a couple of bros.
author: Ivonne M.

description:
This place is pretty basic. The crowd was not cute. Music wasn't good, and no where to sit. The drink was pretty strong, it better be for 9 bucks. We left after one drink and I spent most of my time there talking to Quintin the bouncer, at least he was nice lol 

Sorry but this area sucks.
author: Jamie B.

description:
My friend and I arrived at around 11pm after dinner... eager for a good drink. I love mixology bars and am well aware of the time it takes to make a drink. I walked in ready to patiently wait our turn.

With that said, fuck the bartenders. My friend literally stood there for 30 minutes without any acknowledgement. He took orders from others who got there well after she did. THEN after finally being noticed, the bartender said she would be next. Instead of serving her next... he turned to another group of 5 white girls and served them. And then continues to serve ANOTHER party. 15 minutes after he says "I swear I'm not ignoring you, I'll get you next". Dude... that statement just proves that you WERE fucking ignoring her. I'm not saying he's racist, but ............. I stepped in to talk shit and just as he was finally going to take our order, we walked out.

What a shit show.

I'm so mad I wasted an hour of my vacation in SF at Rye. Never again.
author: Elysse P.

description:
Awesome cocktail bar. My favorite in the city.
Real bartenders, that know what they are doing and clearly love it.
Cocktail menu is diverse and the drinks are simply amazing!! Add the great decor and ambiance for a perfect place to bring your date or people that appreciate cocktails. 
Prices are fair and even lower than certain other pretentious "cocktail bars" in the city.
Thanks RYE
author: Marion P.

description: This is sucha cute place to catch up with some friends over drinks!
author: Tiffany T.

description: I pretty much love everything about this place. The staff is incredibly fun and personable. The atmosphere is always just right. The cocktails are on point. Did I mention the staff is amazing? I generally have to clear my schedule before coming here, because I usually end up staying much longer than anticipated. Do yourself a favor and come to this bar!
author: Phil C.

description: I found this place while vacationing in San Francisco and actually ended up coming back twice! Excellent handcrafted cocktails! Bartenders are friendly and the place is cozy and clean. A must if you are in the area!
author: Josue R.

description:
Came in here with a few friends on a Friday night. We found seats fairly easily, but it was starting to fill up.

My friend ordered drinks for the table, and it took him a while to place the order. 

I got the yelp-suggested basil gimlet. This was probably my favourite drink of the night (We went to five places, and I had one drink at each place). The basil flavour balanced nicely against the dry gin and lime. It's somewhat of an adventure on your tongue. Starts with the basil, and immediately switches to sweetness, then tartness, and finishes with a dry sweet basil that comes off the tongue nicely.

The bathroom was decorated for Halloween. Decor was simple, speakeasy-esque. They had good music playing (somewhat indie). Even with the music, I was still able to hold conversations with my friends at a slightly elevated volume. 

I enjoyed my time here. The Basil Gimlet was good (affordable too!) and the environment was swell. 

Recommended and I'll be back.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I actually didn't have any drinks here (besides a sip of my friend's weird olive oil drink), so I can't comment much on the drink quality.

The ambiance here isn't bad. I had a group of friends with me and it was really relaxed. No dance floor though. This is definitely a place where you stand or sit around with your friends and just have a good time.

They have easily accessible bathrooms inside which is nice. No need to stumble down a flight of stairs while drunk.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Shitty aloof service. Lack of cocktail knowledge. 

Obnoxious frat boy types abound. 

Better service to friends of the bar. 

Not worth the pretension
author: Evan W.

description:
Why, I love me some Rye.

That's the bar, not the spirit. Now, if I loved the spirit, I would also love Rye, of course, and I daresay so will you!

I've been to Rye a couple times late, late at night (late for San Francisco is not late for New Orleans, so say around Midnight), when the bar is dark and quiet and I like it like that. I like to sit in the adjoining room and sip on some kind of sparkling drink (like the Thistle). The bartenders are nice, the drinks are priced reasonably and really, you can't go wrong with any of this, can you?

An excellent bar you can always count on for a superb craft cocktail.
author: Joi B.

description: Try the Rye Old Fashioned! There's plenty of seating, including an small patio out front.
author: Will M.

description: Pretty good service and they make good cocktails. There's a decent amount of seating for groups too.
author: Ximena C.

description: This place is bomb. Why? Because they'll actually put raw egg in their cocktails. Secondly, the mixologists are super versed and willing to make any request provided they have the ingredients or can get them at the corner store. The outdoor smoking cage is rather nice too, it feels like an extension of the inside so even on a cold winter night it's not horrible smoking out there and the cage also puts a much appreciated barrier between you and the Tenderloin street life that wonder up. Fairly priced for the quality of cocktails.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
The drinks here are pretty good, but the staff is absolutely terrible. The bartenders are pretentious for their skill level. A friend who isn't a cocktail snob asked for a relatively standard drink that wasn't on the menu and they refused. (I did tell him that would happen, but he didn't believe me.)

I was also there with friends at one point where they asked us to wait for the check as they were closing only to have the bouncer kick us out without the credit card. He even pulled the chair out from underneath one of the group. Some of the rest of the wait staff told us to "Go back to the south bay" when we complained. The friend got his card a while later after the waitress told the rest of them was was going on, but we never received an apology.

This is a place I'll never come to again.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I really want to like Rye a lot more because they make pretty fine cocktails here but it can just be unbearably packed and slow on weekend nights. 

Still, if you come for an early happy hour during the week, it is quite delightful. You might even get a sofa seat and table service. Score. Bartenders... sorry I mean mixologists, are pretty deliberate with their concoctions which means meticulously crafted cocktails if you don't mind the wait. Leave your ID as collateral for a copper mug and enjoy a crisp Moscow Mule. Also like the fact that they have a tiny smoking nook just inches from potential tenderloin street craziness. It sometimes can be a drink and a show. 

Typically skipping Rye if it's packed, I don't mind it as a weekday happy hour spot in the Loin but it is getting competitive for "craft cocktail" bars in the neighborhood. Rye thankfully is an early pioneer.
author: Jon L.

description:
Very smooth and relaxing atmosphere. Had a couple of beers and chatted with the bartender.
Was really cool coming in from out of town and being able to feel at home in a beautifully decorated lounge. I stopped by only for a while and all the time I was there I felt really at home like a local tavern back home.
Much love thank you Rye!
author: Pedro S.

description: We liked the vibe and drinks in this place. I had the merchant mule - its was darn good. The old fashion was good too. We'll be back and next time trying the Gimlet.
author: Sharon B.

description: Great atmosphere, great drinks, kinda hipster-y vibe. Stumbled upon this place when our go-to was closed the day after Christmas. I can't say I would for sure come back since the vibe of the place didn't suit me much, but it's a pretty neat place with good drinks. The female bartender makes a mean Tom Collins.
author: Beatrice F.

description:
My friends and I were visiting San Francisco from Chicago and looking for a bar to go to and we came across Rye and decided to check it out. The exterior of the building gave it a very excessive feel with one big wooden door that opened and closed. The interior was dimly lit and people were everywhere. The cocktails were very exquisite and unusual mixes and you could tell that the company put a lot of time into coming up with which ingredients to mix. 

I tried two different drinks that I can't remember the names of off the top of my head, but an ingredient in one of my drinks was a liquor that was exclusively made in California. I liked both of the drinks I tried, but I felt that the glasses were very small for the price of the drink. Overall, my friends and I had a good time at Rye. I would recommend it if you're in the San Francisco area and looking for a cocktail bar.
author: Angelica F.

description:
The drinks are expensive, but I suppose this is to be expected in SF. I asked the bartender to recommend a "not so sweet" cocktail and ended up with a $10 Pimm's Cup that was definitely more sugary than I liked. Ended up getting a house Scotch at $12 (again, it's SF). The crowd is light at first, but it gets busy around 10. 

Their bathroom is actually pretty clean and well-stocked!
author: Leslie H.

description: Wow. What a great little place to drink some awesome masterpieces of mixology. The hardest thing about this place was picking a drink from their extensive menu - from their version of the Moscow mule to an 18yr old Japanese scotch to the drink of the day. And guess what, I had them all
author: Nabeel N.

description:
It's been a LOOOOOOONG time since I've met someone who made me feel this way...

He made me blush.

He made me giggle. 

He gave me that warm fuzzy feeling inside. 

He even made me "think" I was the most beautiful woman in the world. 

Meet my HOT DATE for Valentine's Day: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/GIm5jbvmymBNo_e7Y84efw?select=xe6I9oylxw2_i6_I0ChhFw

Yuep, this is HOW I celebrated "Singles Awareness Day"! 

DON'T HATE. At least, Mr. Basil Gimlet does NOT talk back!

OTHER NOTES:
*Mixed crowd (hipsters and prepsters)
*Artisan cocktails are $9-10.
*Rustic meets urban décor with wooden bar, exposed red brick walls, pool table, and sleek furnishings.
*Background music but no dance floor. 
*Outdoor smoking cage.
*3 restrooms.
*Difficult street parking. Parking lot is half a block away at the Alcazar Theater ($10 max). 
*CC's accepted.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Tears for fears pumping the stereo? I want to go to there.

Actually, when I walked in Phil Collins was on and shortly after Peter Gabriel. Had they flat out played Genesis I would have had to leave my group to seek higher ground and cleaner underwear. Panty meltin' tunes here, y'all. 

Other panty meltin' mind grapes regarding Rye:

- Dimly lit. Perfect for a make-up monster like myself. A little goes a long way and I appreciate that.

- STRONG drinks. I probably could have gotten away with just a couple stripes of eye-liner now that I'm trying to recall the rest of the evening. Not looking so hot? NBD. Buy yourself and your date a drink. Both of you will stop caring about that extra fun but feckless sh*t real fast. 

- Sit in the caged 'Alfresco' area if you're a big zoo fan. I'm an animal, natch, so this area was a fun one to let my imagination run wild in. And after a few cocktails, you might have more than your imagination going wild. Keep your tops on, girls. This is still a classy place. Or don't- whatever, I don't really mind either way.   

- Speaking of chests, most of the cocktails will put hair on your chest. As T-Boz, Chili, and Left Eye said: Don't go chasing waterfalls. Because I usually drink beer and I know I'm a puss when it comes to whiskey, gin, etc so I went with something that looked like both Shirley Temple and I would appreciate. 

- Enter the Ginny Smith. 1 1/2 oz No3 Gin, 1/2 oz Apple Liqueur, 1 oz Lime, 3/4 oz Ginger + Orange Bitters. $10 for the martini sized glass and worth every red cent... that a lady named JZ treated me to.

- Bathroom (1 of 2- I only used one so I can't speak for the one on the cage side of the bar) has a chalkboard to draw (lewd) images on... except someone had already stole the chalk before I could literally make my mark. Next time I'll be packin' my own heat. 

Next time I visit I hope to they can sync the tunes to my libido and follow through on my Genesis prophecy... maybe a lil vintage Rod Stewart too. Everyone loves a little Face, right? Er- I mean Faces, obvi.
author: Candice G.

description:
Came here for a drink on Monday night.

There weren't many people, so we were able to score 2 seats at the bar. I knew I had to try the basil gimlet, and we also ordered another one of their specialty drinks (the name escaped me...but it was a rum sort of punch).

DELICIOUS!!! The basil gimlet blew my socks off. Refreshing. Sweet. Tasty. Everything I could want in a drink! (except a bigger glass). The other drink was tasty as well! 

The most notable thing though was how friendly the service was. I think this was the nicest bartender I've ever encountered.... EVER. She explained each drink to us and even wrote down the recipe for the basil gimlet!! We didn't feel rushed and she was helpful in making the decision to what other specialty drink we wanted to try. 

I could see how it'd be crazy on a weekend, making it less appealing. Especially since each drink takes a few minutes to carefully make. 

I think I'll stick to coming here on weekdays.
author: Noelle H.

description: If you're looking for great cocktails made by talented mixolgist using quality ingredients, RYE is your place! Can't say I've had a drink I haven't liked here. Its well decorated and I like they have a separate lounge area with seating. Like most SF bars it is pretty small so probably not the best for HUGE groups. They play fun music which is always a plus in my book. Will be back for HH=)
author: Hetal P.

description:
A go to spot that has a cool pool table or used to at least and has a nice little bar and seating area that usually gets pretty crowded pretty quick!

Check out their gimlets and Hibiki on the menu. Great drinks in a cool area as part of a bar hop so definitely add Rye to your list.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Gin's my go to for drinks and naturally I got the Commonwealth Tonic. The grapefruit flavor gave it the kick I needed after a long week of work. 

Also had a few sips of the other bourbon based cocktails and they were pretty good too. 

But what I enjoyed the most? A great cross between sit down bar, hang out spot, with a little more class. 

Definitely would go back to try The Flash. Will update review when I get the chance!
author: Leslie L.

description: Large selection of whiskeys BUT uncomfortable chairs, they also have wine and mix drinks, put some comfortable seats and I'll come back
author: Tiff W.

description: Pretty good service and they make good cocktails. There's a decent amount of seating for groups too.
author: Griffin B.

description:
We had couple of hours to kill before our show and we were looking for a place to grab a drink. The place had a minimalist exterior...you will miss it if you blink ;). 

Surprisingly spacious and very elegant inside.  It was a quiet night and we were able to sit at the bar. All the drinks we tasted were very good. Very friendly bartenders and good service. Would love to go back on a more happening day.

They had a pretty diverse variety of drinks, ... lombada?, moscow mule, ... thistle? and something else.
author: Ujwal C.

description: Julie is my spirit animal.  We have a group of people who come in often, I mean, like really often.  The bartenders are some of the best in the city.  We love them. Ask Julie for a Red Drink, it's a drink she makes for me every time I go there and its f**king delicious.
author: Shaun C.

description: A cool place to hang out for date night. It looks like a small place from outside but is pretty decent sized. Bartenders were friendly and gave good suggestions. Tried a few of their signature cocktails which were all very good. My favorite was the Moscow mule and something 'thistle' - forgot the name now :( Oh well just have to go back for it!!
author: Meghna G.

description:
Pros:
- whoa that basil gimlet is really good
- fun, young, and slightly hipster atmosphere
- you can reserve a table for parties and whatnot

Cons:
- kind of pricey? I think 1 drink is around $10
- only one bathroom/toilet
- really loud and not great for talking

Bottom line: Cool place. I might stop here at the beginning of the night to warm up, but ultimately go somewhere else with music or dancing after.
author: Jiann M.

description:
Great vibe, great bartenders! I actually came here and couldn't have alcohol at the time so the bartender made me two really yummy non-alcoholic sodas. My date had some beers and a drink called a Flip w/ egg, bourbon and nutmeg that he raved about. There's a pool table and two areas for seating. Wish they had bar snacks or salty nibbles. Crowd is pretty young and can be techie at times (sign of the changes taking place in Tenderloin Heights).

 I liked that its not pretentious or snooty (I'm looking at you handlebar moustache bartender at Swig....) but bartenders are down to earth and make great drinks! Will definitely be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Love this place. Great simple modern decor, good music and great drinks! Their cocktails are really good. It's half inside lounge half an inside outside patio. 

It can get pretty busy though so you might have to stand a while before snapping a chair at the bar.
author: Tamara S.

description: Nice spot, we order 3 different drinks and they all were okay, could have been better. But a cool hangout spot.
author: Shaz T.

description:
Drinks were good, and the prices were around $10 per cocktail. I tried the basil gimlet and it really is as good as everyone says!

However, Rye was quite crowded and noisy. We had to wait forever to get served, there weren't any free seats, and it was so loud that conversation just wasn't possible. 

So even though the drinks here are above average, they just aren't worth the hassle. I'd much sooner grab a less-refined drink at a less-crowded dive bar. At least there I could relax.
author: Dan D.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night and it was pretty packed. Don't know if it was just cos it was labor day weekend or what.

This was one of our last stops bar hopping and it was a great stop.  Drinks were delicious, strong, and consistent.  Loved the atmosphere and the drinks, which were also reasonably priced for the amount of care/work they put into it.

I will def come back when I'm in SF.
author: Audrey C.

description:
The pretension from the bar tenders is not worth waiting for the drink. Get over yourselves and do your job...making drinks. 
I stood at the bar for a good 10 minutes waiting to even be acknowledged but they were too busy checking their phones with their backs turned to the bar and talking to their friends. It wasn't even busy. So I went back to the table and waited for my friends to finish their drinks and left.
I had high hopes for this place, but I won't be back.
author: Ned G.

description: Great cocktails, esp the Pimm's #5 and of course excellent selection of ryes and bourbons. Quiet and intimate, nice lighting - not too bright not too dark. Great date spot or to catch up with a friend, you can actually hear the other person. Bonus candlelit semi-private outdoor smoke-friendly area right off of the main space, but even with two people smoking it wasn't noticeable (I am not a smoker). Glad to have found this spot!
author: Jennie P.

description:
Not bad, I like the vibe, the open space and clean brick walls. There was a small patio for semi-private canoodling and some long tables for larger parties. 

Costs were alright, a little pricier than I'd like but the drinks weren't my favorite. I had the strawberry special which was too syrupy, and the hibiki cocktail which unfortunately was not enjoyable. I'll give it a shot again when I'm in the area.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Solid spot same drinks as many other SF locations but they still have Japanese whiskey in stock and not over priced . Lots of area to sit so that's cool.
author: Justin I.

description:
Great bar but was seriously understaffed. The staff was actually pretty good but it's hard to get to the bar and put your order in.
The whiskey is a bit overpriced, especially the scotch.
The layout of the bar is a bit awkward and doesn't feel cosy.
Go there when it's quiet
author: Joffrey T.

description:
This was my last stop of the bar hopping my friends and I did on our night in San Francisco. This is a cool spot to meet around and hang out with friends or potentially meeting up with someone new. The place is low lighted and the vibe of the place gives it an early 20th century style type of bar (I wanna say 30s/40s) along with some more lounging areas on the right side of the bar. 

I ordered a cocktail there and I must say, I was really good! the bartenders were attentive with everyone and they served everyone and a decent time. Overall, this place is great and i would come back again with my friends and try out the different drinks that they offer.
author: Tito G.

description:
It was Shirley W's birthday and I was in town to visit her for the long weekend. The plan was to check out other local bars in the area, but they were either closed or had a private event. I guess we lucked out as we found a little gem called --- RYE.

[drank]
Special: Drogo's Son (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rye-san-francisco#sUhDxQAKj3sESqb9Jv3dNA) was unique mix of the night. Had a little kick to it and was quite smooth. It was a drink that catered to mostly females. 

Drinks of the night (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rye-san-francisco#AgEMNYWoOJoagAcvLmDD5Q) 

I also had a few of their MOSCOW MULES which are served in a copper mug. Apparently that's the correct way to serve it. I guess I've been drinking mine the wrong way. But then again, I hardly order this drink. If you do order this drink, you gotta give the bartender your I.D. because people seem to steal the copper mugs (which are about $30 each). Once you return the mug, you can retrieve your I.D. back. This drink was a favorite amongst the crowd.

FYI =
-Parking on the street (good luck finding a parking spot!)
-Bathroom door does NOT lock all the way through (you might get walked in on....)
-Pool table in main area at the back
-Mini out-door patio 
-Urban, modern, dark, candle-lit (great for a date!)
-Cocktails $9-11
-Wine and beer also available
-CC's accepted
-Most importantly: STRONG DRINKS SERVED HERE

My visit to Rye was on a whim. And I'm kinda glad we stumbled upon this establishment as it's ambiance was very sultry, sexy looking people and they served strong drinks. I wouldn't mind coming back here again for drinks with my friends or to people watch ;)

Yelp 2013 100 for 100 Challenge - Review #97
author: Kristen M.

description:
if you walking for the first time, you might miss this spot in a wink, thank you yelp for finding this spot. And the basil gimlet! least it made my friends day... he broke up with his girl and this was the best place then with great ambiance and lighting.
Parking is on your luck!
author: Dannialson N.

description: A very modern cocktail bar with interesting drinks and great atmosphere. Both the drinks I tried (wish I could remember their names - should tell you something about my night) were super creative and well-made. And this is the first time I've seen a basket of eggs at a bar, so that was totally weird. Will definitely be back.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Came a few Mondays ago on a second date, and while the date ended poorly (my fault, of course), I finally got to try Rye, and it was fantastic! 

I forget what exactly my date ordered, but both that and my Bank Heist Swizzle were tasty drinks, albeit a bit on the sweeter and lighter side - or so I thought, because I did start feeling just a little something towards the end of my cocktail: in other words, the bartenders here do a pretty good job of masking the alcohol in the drinks, which is great for those who don't actually like alcohol that tastes like, well, alcohol.

The space itself has kind of a chic, modern, industrial look to it. Pretty nice, especially on a Monday, when the place isn't crowded.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A pretty large space with an open floor plan, albeit on two separate levels, so only one of them (the main level, from the entrance) is actually accessible.

Bathroom - Fortunately, they have two sets of bathrooms, one per level. I didn't actually check them out, but I suspect they were accessible as well.
author: Johnny W.

description:
This place is a typical hipster cocktail bar/lounge that just tries too hard. When you walk in you can barely see anything because it's so dark. The bartenders weren't willing to leave the bar to take any orders; they gave us menus and said take a seat wherever you like but come back to the bar to order...okay. So we found two seats at the bar for ease of ordering. One bartender took our order and the other bartender, an older guy, came back to the front of house and started making one of our drinks. We asked him a couple of questions about the drinks and he just acted like we were bothering him. Being a former bartender, I was just curious and I didn't think my questions were stupid or unreasonable.

The cocktails were okay, my boyfriend ordered the Old-Fashioned on the menu that has Creme de Cacao and I ordered some rum cocktail. The Old-Fashioned was pretty tasty, I'll give them that. Smooth, creamy, delicious. I could only taste the rum in my drink so it was just a semi fruity fire in my mouth with every sip. For $25 I don't think the drinks were worth it, so we left after one drink. Not that we felt welcome to stay anyways. 

I don't know if it was where we were seated (at the end of the bar near a mixing station) but everything was a bit wet and sticky, as if they hadn't wiped the bar down all night. Granted, it was so dark they probably couldn't tell it was dirty.
author: Kristin H.

description: I've lived in this neighborhood for 8 years and I can't believe I just discovered Rye! Went there for the first time last weekend. My partner and I had 5 drinks total and they were all delicious. BUT the Old Fashioned Cure All is the drink that will get us to return again, and again. It was the BOMB!
author: Alex H.

description:
Good cocktails, plenty of seating and a nice vibe - we ended up here after stopping into Bourbon & Branch's Library room and decided that it was a bit stuffy. There's semi out door seating as well as bar and lounge seating.

I had two drinks:

Pimm's Cup: a summery, cucumbers cocktail. Slightly sweeter than ideal.

Japanese whisky + ginger syrup + seltzer: great balance, and the ginger gave it a kick. Definitely my favorite drink of the ones my group ordered.
author: Danielle K.

description:
To walk into a bar and get instantly greeted with a smile and a cocktail list that breathes sophistication is a moment that should be savored.

Rye does this on the regular though. 

Their staff are profound professionals with lovely personality and the whole place is just beyond what's up.

Rye is a comforting cocktail dream of a place and if you're visiting or a local - go.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I love this place.  It's usually my go to spot for quick meet ups with friends and dates.  The drinks are good and there's always a place to sit.  I usually go after work on weekdays, but weekends are fun too.  They play good music and the crowd is mixed.  

They make a proper whiskey sour with egg whites.... Its one of my top 3 bars in SF for it.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Looks a garage from a certain angle. Looks like a cage when you stand in front of the lounge. It's not a garage or a cage, it's actually a lounge.

We had...The Flash (reminds me of a superhero), Swizzle (tropical), Basil Gimlet? and a few others...I'm not a drinker so I can't really say how they good/bad they were.

Drinks do take a while, there's only one waitress & she's always busy. This place can get crowded so get there early (9ish) if you want a table.

Very dark & very loud. WHAT DID YOU SAY?!?!?!
author: Kylie L.

description:
I'm not much of a mixed drink kind of person. In general, I don't like bourbon, whiskey, rye, etc. So why did I end up at Rye, you ask? Because I came with some friends and it was relatively empty. 

Still, I tried several of their concoctions and they were all quite tasty. Also, our server was really nice and patient with us. 

I just wish they'd turn the music down a little bit so you didn't have to put your mouth on someone's ear for them to hear you. It's cool if you're on a date, but otherwise it's just inconvenient.
author: Akash K.

description:
Fun place with fun atmosphere. When you're there have one of the bar's mixologists make you something yummy! The pool table is a great conversation starter too. 

Tucked away so locals like this one. 

The only negative was that it was hard to get a drink, but really... It's worth it!
author: Leslie E.

description:
A fabulous place to grab a cocktail before dinner. I was drawn to this place by its minimalist exterior vibe (look close or you might miss the sign). Inside, the atmosphere is sophisticated, trendy and distinctly bourgeois. It's  spacious yet lively, and the drink menu is creative and skillfully crafted. After the first sip of my whiskey-based flip, I told my husband we should just skip dinner and stay here for a few more. 

The scene is pretty solidly after-work, with some tourists thrown in. Not a dive, or the place to go if you're just looking to grab a seat at the bar and knock a few back in a super low-key setting, but perfect to set the mood for a night out. Highly recommended.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I recently moved across the street so this is set to be my new hang out. 

The place on week days is quiet and chill and a good opportunity to learn how to play pool or rather play pool on a couple of drinks. The bartenders are great when it comes to creating drinks. Their menu doesn't have much on it so you've pretty much got to know what you want or have them make you something special. I'm not super picky but I don't like cucumber and am a fan of vodka and they make something great every time I go in. 

I will warn you that weekends are a hot, crazy mess. It's just like any other good bar in the area but just know it's gonna be a fight to get to the bartenders.
author: Leina K.

description:
A worthwhile bar visit in the lovely city of San Fran. Just fancy, dark and cool enough to satisfy your complete rolodex of friends and acquaintances. With a neo-casual vibe, this bar dishes out cocktails like the pros. Of course, you can judge a good by bar the way the bartender shakes up that bev order of yours - and Rye bartenders are ferocious with their shakin' abilities.

Find a cozy corner, play a little pool or make friends with the bartenders - you'll find what you love at Rye. For me, it was the Basil Gimlet and mingling with my coworkers.
author: Breanna B.

description:
I can't speak for the other nights of the week, but on a Wednesday night, Rye has just the kind of atmosphere I like: 

Chill, not too upscale but not divey, a great mix of people and a totally manageable crowd. Plus, you can't beat a pool table! 

But really, I will tell you what actually won me over: The Old Fashioned. Normally I'm not a fan, but they made mine with honey and it was amazing. Their ice cubes are big (you guessed it) cubes, but you get one in a drink. It's massive, solid and melts at the perfect pace. The cocktail itself was smooth, not too sweet and there was no bite. Perfect. 

Double awesome? A cocktail like this in Cleveland would cost you $12-15. But not at Rye! We're talking $8! I got three (not all for me) and my tab was tiny. I was actually surprised at how cheap they were--especially for the quality of ingredients. 

And if all else fails, their service is quite nice.
author: Cara L.

description:
I tend to judge a bar by its exterior; Rye def makes the cut.

Like its sophisticated neighbors Redford and W&W, this little Tenderloin joint has an awesome variety of specialty cocktails. I described my taste buds (sour/bitter, penchant for gin) to the bartender and she mixed me up something tart and refreshing. She told me it had no name; all I know is it contained gin, pomegranate and celery -- an ingredient I usually can't stand, but barely noticed in this drink because it was SO delicious.

I also tried my sister's La Lambada with tequila and sweet peppers (wasn't too impressed) and the Basil Gimlet (no longer on the menu but they'll still make it for you), which was just the perfect summer drink -- sweet/sour and crisp, with a basil mint aftertaste. Mmmm.

It was a bit crowded inside around 7:30pm on a Thursday night and hard to find a place to stand, much less sit, but we eventually landed a roomy booth with an awesome cement table.

Rye is a great spot for dates and groups, if you can snag a seat!
author: Tiffany W.

description: Ever since my friend introduced me to this place, I try to make it a go to place when I come to visit. Ambiance is great, bartenders and owner are great people, and I love sitting up at the bar observing all the magic that goes into their drinks! I've tried a number of their drinks but hands down their signature basil gimlet is my go to drink. 3 of those in one night and I am A okay!
author: Jennifer U.

description: I'm a big fan of Moscow Mules and just had to get it when I saw it on the menu here. It's called a Merchant Mule here but it's the same thing. It's vodka with ginger beer, lime, mint all in a copper mug. The copper mugs gives it a cool factor, literally. They usually ask to hold an ID in exchange for the copper mugs since people try to steal them. The mule was so good that all my friends kept stealing my drink from me. I think I was slurping ice when I got it back in my hand. No worries though, I'm glad everyone enjoyed it.
author: Michael C.

description: Just the right kind of place to hang out in the Downtown SF area with a nice little decor which has sufficient seating spaces near and around the bar.
