The basil gimlet, as most Yelpers have recommended, is pretty good. I also had the special Negroni with Fallaron Gin which was good too.
author: Aritra G.

description: love their unique drinks! Basil Gimlet and Cucumber Gimlet...  Very good!
author: Emily K.

description:
Very fun place, a great alternative to Chambers if you want something a little quieter. There's even a cage outside for smokers!

Great decor, very east coast actually. Came here back around the holidays and loved the lighting reflecting back from the large mirrors that adorned the walls.  The owner (I can't remember her name) was extremely friendly too.

There's seating available behind the bar. Would definitely return with a small group of friends to hang out!
author: Alice Z.

description:
We had mixed feelings about this place. We adventured out on a Friday night only to find that this place was packed, we expected some congestion because of its popularity but we waited to order drinks at the bar for 6 minutes before squeezing in.

However, the staff was phenomenal at taking care of guests in the second row and were quick at making drinks. There needed to be more seating in the downstairs lounge but the outdoor patio for smokers was a plus for those who wanted to indulge outside. We might try this place again in the future but never again on a weekend!
author: Kathy And Matt B.

description: They make a pretty solid old fashioned. But there is no food and almost always no place to sit.
author: Neha M.

description:
Rye.  I've heard talk about this bar but until now have never been.  Now it may become my new favorite spot in SF.  I can imagine it may get pretty packed on a weekend but I stopped by on a hump day and was pleasantly surprised.  I managed to get a space at the bar and while their shelf was stocked horizontally and not vertically, it actually sort of made the selection more intriguing because you never know what was behind the bottles in front.  

One thing that DID catch my eye was a shiny brand new bottle of St. George Single Malt.  I had previously only had one of their previous releases at Local Edition and the bartender let me know that they had just received their allocation of just 3 bottles so I had the honor of the first pour.  If you're into Whiskey and have not tried this ridiculously hard-to-find single malt made in the bay area, you can probably find it here.

Second on the list is the Buffalo Trace Antique Collection.  I did not run through the entire group but I did confirm that while they did not have George T. Stagg, they did have Thomas H. Handy hidden away.

The rest of their whiskey selection is has enough variety to separate itself from other joints and their cocktails are also pretty well-made (My Mint Julep was mighty fine).

I will definitely be back for my favs!
author: Chris C.

description:
Love the vibe here. It's dimly lit, calm, and they have great cucumber and basil gimlets. The drinks are fast, and you can order at the seated areas too. Great place to start or enjoy the night out with friends at. Best of all, no cover!

Couple places near by: Jones, Ambassador, Traditions, all places you can barhop around to!
author: Joanna S.

description: Met up with someone here and it was a wonderful bar. There's outdoor seating if you'd like and that where we sat. Service I have to admit was pretty slow. Took longer to pour a drink that should have been pretty simple.  I really like this bar quite a bit. It's has a great vibe and ambiance to it. They also have their own house drinks here. Great place to meet up and actually be able to talk unlike some bars in SF.
author: Julie L.

description:
My favorite 'nice' bar in the TL (over Trocadero and Tradition).

Before I get into the review, lets be clear on the area: it's NOT sketch. Sorry to previous reviewer Adele and others who are scared of the TL - stop being pussies. The TL hasn't been sketch in 10 years. And I'm sure there are natives who are tougher and have been here longer than me that think its been benign for even longer than that. 

Been going here sporadically since it opened. I've never ordered any of the listed menu drinks. I drink classics and just straight booze. Because I exercise proper drink ordering etiquette, my wait for a drink -even during busy times - is minimal. 

I find the music can be a bit too loud for me around the seated area towards the caged bottles. I'm kinda bummed the pool table is gone, but those are minor complaints. 

It's held in high regard by many people in the restaurant/bar industry. Maybe not for the average YELPer who is looking for vodka drinks and Jack & coke
author: Monsieur_Meursault _.

description:
I had my first of many mojitos here. Ended up here after a marathon night during spring break where I managed to bruise my tail bone (note: they take ages to heal) on the stairs of The Fillmore. Also I have no idea what was up with the shoes I was wearing but it rubbed all the skin off my feet so I had to sleep feet out ass out for two weeks god that was fucking awful. 

Everyone I've spoken to hates this place so I might've been too drunk to realize the negatives of this place. I have beer goggles for bars instead of boys. Go figure.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Decided to play it safe and go for a basil gimlet.  Sometimes, just go with the flow when you're checking out a new bar, right?  I'm usually a beer gal, but the speakeasy vibe served up by the bartender in a derby said, "No.  Go for something u can't make at home."

At the corner was a chill guy making beef tacos.  It was pretty random.

The neighborhood is slightly cracked out.  A drugged up lady asked, "Do you like deals?  Do you like VIctoria's Secret?"  I walked on.  Then she cackled, "Do you like... penis??"  I was LOLing inside, so tempted to say, "I like munching carpets, how 'bout that???" but it woulda been too much and plus I'd be lying.
author: Miran C.

description:
This is a great after dinner lounge bar. It was very close to the Hilton Union Square where I was staying. I wandered in here just to check it out. Found an empty barstool and decided to order a quick drink. Little did I realize how strong the drink was so I was going to have to nurse it awhile before I walk back to my hotel. 

There was an interesting mix of locals and nearby hotel stayers such as myself. It was quite friendly. I talked to a few locals about the drinks there. There was also a fellow traveler like myself who was just here for the weekend and enjoying a quick cocktail. Thought I would be responsible and leave after one cocktail since I had an early morning start the next day.
author: Julee D.

description: Rye is an excellent bar. I had the rye old fashioned cure all and it was amazing. Probably one of the top 5 drinks I've had in my life. I really liked the vibe in this bar, not too crowded and easy to have a conversation without having to speak too loudly. The bartenders here are very nice and there is an Osha Thai located right next door if you want a quick bite to eat after enjoying a few cocktails. I will definitely be back for a few more cocktails!!
author: Scoot S.

description:
I discovered this little gem through the Sosh app, a Whiskey Conisseaur flight that features three types of whiskies, one unaged "white dog" whiskey and two others. Upon entering, the bartender was expecting us, so the flight was ready to go. The warm and inviting ambiance offered a cozy feel, a little swanky but rustic at the same time. 

After taking the 3 shots and learning about each one, she asked us to pick our favorite and she would create a cocktail with it. She asked us our taste preferences and went to work creating a customized drink on the spot. And damn, did they hit the spot! Seriously, one of the best cocktails I have ever sipped. I didn't want it to end. 

Our bartender was a sweetie and very knowledgable, personable and gave us a great background on each selection. The price was awesome since I went through Sosh and it was all taken care of (including 20% tip) though the app. I would never have discovered the place despite living in the neighborhood for a few years since I tend to stick to the same dive spot, and I am glad I did. I read, I think in a 7x7 article, that hanging out in their smoker's cage at Rye (which is quite beautiful) and watching the people walk by was listed as one of the top things to do in SF before you die. So I can knock that one off my bucket list, even though I didn't even know it was there :). And I will probably keep knockin' that one off multiple times, probably just to return to chat with that awesome bartendress! And drink more whiskey, of course.
author: Marina M.

description:
We came here spontaneously on a Saturday past 11. It may be in a shady TL area, but really though, there's SO many ppl bar hopping/clubbing in this area, it's not bad at all. 

It was packed, took us over half an hour to get drinks. The reason being is that this place has well made unique drinks, so it takes awhile to make it. We just kept staring at the bartenders making drinks in a fascinating fashion, hmmm...

Anyways, got 2 hophead hooch and a Manhattan and Birds of something? $10 each, pretty good for quality drinks. They all turned out strong, a plus. We didn't like the flavor of the hophead so much, actually I couldn't finish it and gagged halfway through. The others didn't enjoy their drinks so much, but its because we were noobs and didn't 't know the right ones to try. 

A lot older and sophisticated crowd on a Saturday night, another plus. Will we come back here? Since its in the TL, don't think we will go out of way again, but if we stumbled upon it, we'll def order something.
author: Rita K.

description:
What makes a bar/lounge better than another similar bar/lounge, especially in cities that have a lot of bar/lounges? 

The drinks? The decor? The bartenders? The music? The cocktail creations?

Don't kid yourself. 

No, it usually comes down to the "Vibe". and the "Vibe" depends on the people that frequent the place.  

If they are your kind of people, and it makes you relaxed, hopeful, excited, happy, then it is a good bar for you. 

After all, there are only 3 reasons you go to a bar:
1. To meet with friends, chillax, and have a good time. .
2. To meet strangers and get lucky
3. To get drunk because you are not doing 1 or 2. 

And like Cheers on TV, it's great to go to a place where everyone knows your name. 

I had never been to Rye, so possibly nobody knew my name, but since it was Yelp's SFCM Ruggy's place of choice for a farewell party before heading off to NYC, a lot of people knew my name. Mainly fellow Yelpers. 

The place reminded me, at least this night,  of a bar in NYC, actually. Especially when it got crowded. It had that Vibe, where you have to squeeze by people and get your accidental grope, which may turn into eye contact, which may turn into conversation, only because it is right in front of you. And there were a lot of attractive people here, looking to get lucky with others. 

The bar has some large art pieces on the walls, a small pool table in the rear, a downstairs lounge, and a caged outdoor smoking area off the lounge onto Geary street. 

It is sort of the place where you go after work or after dinner, but before you go to the clubs or elsewhere in the city. It is a place removed from the FiDi, so no suits, but on the edge of the Theaters, Union Square shopping, and Tenderloin clubs. 

The crowd is mostly Caucasian 30 somethings, with a sprinkle of SF's diversity.  They do have some tasty and popular drinks here, which helps to bring the ladies. 

Most men, well they drink what they always drink, so it doesn't matter, as long as there are ladies present. 

So I came for reason #1 to meet friends and say goodbye to Ruggy. 
Best wishes on your next adventure in the Big Apple! 

Who knows, I might come back here for other reasons!
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I tried the Basil Gimlet, ranked #2 on the Alcademics top 50 drinks you have to drink before you die in SF, and it was amazing! Strong, tangy, and tasty. 

After a couple of these, I reluctantly asked the bartender for a drink recommendation similar to the basil gimlet just so I could try something new. He whipped up a raspberry gimlet (not on the menu), which I dare say, might be better than the Basil Gimlet! It tasted really fresh, and I liked that it was more tart.

Tried a couple others, some were pretty good (blood and sand was made perfectly), and some were just OK. 

I want to note that I felt that the bartenders were quite unnecessarily rude. I love that their drinks are somewhat reasonably priced ($9-11) and they take credit card (unlike some other places nearby ... ahem Big...)
author: Jess C.

description:
Great place to grab some really nice cocktails; drinks with egg white or egg, whisky sour was excellent.

Bartender Julie was wonderful, gave us some recommendations for places and things to do while in the city.
author: Christopher W.

description:
This is actually a pretty nice bar. 

Definitely was struggling of whether to give it a 3 star or 4 star review... and although I initially had it as 3 stars, I bumped it that extra status simply because I'm glad it exists as an option. 

It's an aesthetically refined bar although the vibe inside is amazingly friendly. 

I remember the moscow mules being not great. The cucumber basil drink that everyone posts about on yelp was too sweet for me however the majority of the group enjoyed it. 


Came here on a weeknight so I can't comment on how crowded it gets but it's very nice and service is attentive when it's less busy (as it should be but we all know this isn't always the case)
author: Michael A.

description:
There's a place to have your first of everything, and I had two firsts at Rye:

1) My first Basil Gimlet
2) My first PYE

I cherish both experiences, and highly recommend that any interested in an outstanding, legendary cocktails visit Rye :-)
author: Glenn G.

description:
Been mostly in NY for speakeasy bars.

First time in SF, great cocktails had 2 whiskey ones

One was name ....feather it was one of my best cocktails ever.

Crowd very un cool though, screaming loud people, so not speakeasy bar more a regular one.
author: Patrik D.

description:
Cute ambience, dark lighting, artisan cocktails (a little on the expensive side), but a little small (pool table in the center leaves no room for patrons to stand given the long pool sticks and their potential to jab you!).

It's a good place to grab a cocktail but only recommend if you're with a small party of 2 or 3 given the size of the space. Definitely more suitable for an intimate date.
author: Siv L.

description:
Make mine brown.

Just get some guy to stand on a stool and pour whisky on my head until it flows down my neck and soaks my clothes. Make him keep pouring until it pools in my shoes. I'll gulp down what I can while this is happening. Then we'll make up a name for it and men with beards and ink sleeves and brown boots will come from far and wide to have this thing because it will be so amazing it will definitely be a thing. 

Ye cats they do a good Old Fashioned though. They make their house one with cinnamon imbued in the whisky or something fancy like that and we passed on that and had it straight up old skool, which suits me fine because hey, classic. 

Don't expect to recognise your mum in here. It's pretty dark.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
I thoroughly dig this spot - so very much, so very much.

Though the name of the bar is clearly an ode to a distilled spirit, that's where the connection to the modern-day mixology 'trend' ends. Here, you won't find a frontman ironically mustachioed for mere effect, you'll be hard-pressed to pick up on sneering attitude and you won't overhear contrived loose talk about the latest flavor in bitters just so said loose talker will appear well-versed in the art of cocktails, for the gain of street cred. And why not? Because the bartenders are too busy tending. Less talk, more legitimacy my friends.

I also appreciate that all of the bartenders can turn around a bonafide craft cocktail in less than five minutes... none of that unnecessary fluff is involved, which means my drink gets into my hands quicker = a happier, spendier me. It's true - a proper libation doesn't need to be coddled, nursed, weaned, sent to an Ivy league college and then groomed into corporate America's next millionaire to be good. Nope, it just needs to TASTE like a million bucks.

What else do you want to know? Just go, and now.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Douchebag: "Uh, do I know you from somewhere?"

Me: "Hmm.  I don't think so"

DB: "no, really. you LOOK familiar. BTW, my name is blah, blah, blah......"

* Oh, yes. This is going to be PAINFUL *

This guy continues on and on about how it's his friend's bday, why don't I go over there to meet his friend since he's into Asian girls. 

At this point, I tell him, "not interested" and do the 360 to face my friends.  He hangs out right next to our group bitching to his buddy how he NEVER gets rejected and how dare I give him the bad vibe. 

Oh. 

My. 

God. 

Girls, a guy comes up to you like that with lame-ass lines and doesn't even bother to offer to buy your FINE self a drink, I'm sure you would've done the same thing.

I was holding my precious basil gimlet in my hand and wanted so badly to throw it in his face.  But then again, I decided not to, since he's not worth  it and I'm not the type to waste good alcohol. 

Rye was not like this (on a weeknight) the last time I was here. They have the friendly regular neighborhood people who come here to enjoy their well-mixed cocktails, the comfy separate lounge area and yes, even the prison looking smoker's cage. 

Don't let douches like him deter you from coming here.  The basil gimlet is worth your trip.  

Oh, bring an escort next time. Preferably a tall Federale. Guns optional.
author: Janice C.

description: This has become my favorite lounge in SF, I love their drinks!!!  The drinks have a lot of elements, but they're delicious!  The bartenders know their stuff.  If you can grab a seat, it's a great spot to chill.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Came here yesterday night after dinner for my birthday. My friend got me a basil gimlet and one for himself. My other friend got an amaretto sour. It was very easy to find a place to sit. The ambiance was very chill. My drink was pretty good but I liked my friend's pink amaretto sour more. 

These girls comes over and gives us free samples of this strawberry flavored alcohol and free magnets. It was good. 

Since it was my birthday my friend convinced me to do a shot... I have low tolerance and I have never had straight hard liquor. My friend goes to the bartender and asks for a drink that is strong but goes down easy. The bartender makes him this mix thing for free. It was tasty! I guess I got off easy by the drinking the weak "shot" 

15 minutes before we left, this couple comes in with these two pretty dogs! I love this place!
author: Sarah C.

description:
We stopped by here for Ruggy's last hurrah. Wanugee thought this was more like a NYC bar so it was fitting for Ruggy to have a last goodbye here since he's off to the Big Apple soon.

The dark interior and the lower seating area as well makes this place swankier than most bars in this 'hood. They have a good drink selection and when it's not packed to the gills I'd imagine this would be a good place for a date.

Overall, I would recommend this place to people looking to gather folks for a drink.
author: Amy J.

description:
And once again I'm updating my review:

A couple of fellow Yelp Elites and I decided to hang out and grab a few drinks.  With all the great talk of how amazing their basil gimlets are, my new friends decided they HAD to try it.  Of course, it always lives up to its expectation... it refreshing and simply delicious.

However, I wanted to try something else.  Every time I come to Rye, I always order a basil gimlet.  EVERY TIME.  If their basil gimlets are that amazing, I'm sure their other drinks are great too.  I remember on my first adventure here, a friend of mine ordered something with lavender and egg whites.  I know it may sound a bit strange.. but trust me, this may be my new favorite drink here.  There's no name, at least I don't think there's one... but if you ask any of the bartenders to make you a drink with egg whites and lavender, they always make this beautiful concoction with no name.  The lavender is so fragrant, the egg whites make it deliciously frothy, and there's a hint of honey to make it perfectly sweet.  Oh it's just such an amazing and delicate drink!

Oh yeah, and Rye gave us free shots!  HAYYYYY!!!!!!!! :)
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I really liked this lounge because it was classy yet casual, and had a very chill vibe. It's a great place to come and hang out with friends. We sat in the lounge area indoors which was pretty small but intimate and  had nice decor. 

The bartenders were friendly and veryyyy skilled at mixing drinks. I was really impressed! It was so fun watching them make the different concoctions!

I tried The Flash which was a mix of gin, pummeled kiwi, cucumber, lemon, and cane sugar. A little on the strong side, but very refreshing! This one seems to be a local favorite. 

I also tried the Vertigo Cocktail which was sapphire gin infused earl grey and chai tea, lemon, sugar, and egg whites. I never had a cocktail with egg whites in it before and it was so interesting watching how they made it! The egg whites added a little foam on the top. This cocktail was yummy and tasted like spiked iced tea. 

They also make one mean Long Island Iced Tea. One of the strongest I've ever tried. Whoooeeeyyy! This one is definitely not for the lightweights.
author: Diana I.

description:
Less my style, no music, very calm place.. I came with a lot of friends to celebrate birthday. Not sure if I'll come back there ever
But must say that costumer service was great although I wasn't so pleased with the cocktails, didn't like it
author: Sonia S.

description: I can't remember the last time I enjoyed my cocktail this much! I couldn't decide on what to order and truly appreciated how helpful the bartender was during my first visit. This place has one of a kind beverages and a funky atmosphere with a unique crowd.
author: Heidi J.

description:
Put it in my dusty shoebox entitled "Good TL Bars." 

The layout was interesting. Smokers cage? Uh... OK. 

They played a treasured mix of 80s songs including a heavy hit of Depeche Mode which always gets me excited. 

I liked the downstairs. We got a booth which is pretty unheard of in that area- usually its just stools around a barrel. The one bathroom thing is interesting. The "lightest beer they had was a Stella" so that pretty much means they serve good beers only, no domestic crap. (Though we did have a rousing debate about whether bud light, miller lite, or coors light was better.) (Winner coors.) (It wasn't at this bar, don't worry.) (Then we discussed the federal government.) (...Wow you can't take us anywhere.)
author: Emily D.

description: Classic and new cocktails with a wide selection of fresh and alcoholic ingredients. Come on an evening other than Friday or Saturday night to get more attention -- including drinks composed just for your tastes -- from the resident bartenders.
author: David S.

description: The cocktails were fine but man, the music was so loud I couldn't hear 90% of what was being said in my group. It's nice that there's an outdoor area for smokers but every time the door opened, it brought in a waft of cigarette smoke- not great.
author: Liz C.

description:
They have a pool table, not sure if its quarter based or what but just wanted to highlight that for people.

As for the drinks, they are reasonably priced, especially for craft cocktails ($9-12). I ordered the Pimm's cup and found it to be good but not as stiff as I would have liked. Keep in mind, ice can be quite deceptive at showing how much liquid you are actually getting. 

Overall Thoughts

I would come back again for the chill atmosphere and lounge scene but don't expect super strong drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
Another venue with mixologists instead of bartenders. Introduced by another yelper, it is now one of my favorite places to go for quality cocktails - you know, the kind that:

-uses fresh ingredients (no bar-containers of ingredients and garnishes seen)
-uses quality alcohol
-drinks take minutes, rather than seconds, to make
-don't give you hangovers the next day

Not a divy bar but not too chic either, and has a separate area if you prefer a lounge vibe...a nice compromise. There is a pool table too. I've only sat at the bar to watch the handiwork. Go here from opening until the post-dinner crowd comes in, when it gets crowded.

Don't aska rye, justa goh, rye nao, hah, boom tish.
author: Peter L.

description: I stumbled into Rye tonight without a plan. Vince behind the bar was a true professional. He made my old fashioned and impressed me with his cocktail knowledge as he worked the bar. Great cocktail bar.
author: Justin A.

description:
Decent spot. Pretty cramped, so be aware of the packs of people clustering the one and only bar. Overworked bartenders at least on weekends. The smoker's cage is a cool concept. 

Tables are hard to come by, and there really isn't too much space to stand and socialize... So I'd have to say this place has a nice decor and ambiance, the drinks are above average, but the crowded nature of the spot makes me wary of going on weekends.
author: Roy C.

description:
Cute layout, fun vibe.

Had a great drink - told the bartender what I liked and got a cross between a Manhattan and a light Lemon Drop. 

Nice place to drop by with friends!
author: Eszter K.

description:
We went here to have a good time but it was spoiled by the bar tender who was in a very bad mood!!
Good place but the staff needs to b a little more friendlier... And nice to ppl!!
author: Parul S.

description: I loved this spot! It was super hip with incredible drinks. The bartenders definitely sway more towards the "mixologist" type, so expect to wait a bit for your drink...but never fear, the wait is completely worth it. It's got a pretty young, sophisticated vibe. Great for groups!
author: Audrey Z.

description:
If you hate hipster bars with overly sarcastic people, you'll truly hate this place. 

Also, if you are looking to be served (if you would like to call it that) by some of the most inattentive bartenders EVER, surely try your luck here.

First off, the original bartender was way to sarcastic for my liking (if I'm not laughing and giving you side eye instead, take a hint). I needed a few extra moments to figure out what type of drink I wanted and he mumbles "How you're so decisive". I ignore him and proceed to order from the other bartender who made my drink without the stupid jokes.  After finishing my drink, I decided to have another one thinking it should be no problem (it's Sunday night Monday morning with 3 other customers including my date, shouldn't be hard right?) Wrong! The douchebag bartender was having a conversation with his friends and completely ignoring my attempts to flag him down. I attempted to flag down the friendly bartender, but he also is having a conversation with a friend and was not paying attention to me flagging him down. I give them both a few moments thinking that it's just quick convos  with customers (silly me) and they were still talking (of course!). I literally had to walk over to the end of the bar, stand in front of the friendly bartender and say 'I would like another drink'. He said of course and quickly made me another one. 

I surely would never spend my own money here (think goodness I was on a date because I would have left ZERO tip if I hadn't walked out from the horrible customer service first)
author: Roslyn H.

description:
Why 3 stars? Because it wasn't for me, but it was alright.

 ---  ---  ---

Expensive, a snobby reputation and dimly lit. That's not my normal spot, but I enjoyed some lubrication nonetheless.

For starters, the snob-legend did not live up to the hype during my visit. It takes a pretty intensely snobbish atmosphere for me to take heart to such a thing, and this was not one of those situations.

It was a little pricey, but isn't everything in San Francisco? In SF, I feel a lot like I do in New York - from the second I land at the airport, I open my wallet and the city sucks out its contents like a vacuum. 

Our bartender wasn't exactly a beaming light of sunshine and smiles, but she was patient with us non-regulars and helpful with suggestions.

Overall, I probably wouldn't return because I'm more of a beer drinker than fancy cocktail consumer, but 'twasn't bad.
author: Brett N.

description:
My friend and I decided to stop in here on a whim as we were walking down the street one night while visiting San Francisco. Seemed pretty busy and looked like a good spot for a drink.

It was actually quite crowded in the bar section so we grabbed our drinks and sat down in the dining area. I noticed they have a small outdoor patio area which is nice, especially as it got quite loud inside. As far as the drinks went... we had already been drinking beer that night and did not want to stray, so we chose from a fairly limited beer selection. If I ever end up back here I'll have to try some of the specialty drinks.

Definitely a cool little place worth checking out.
author: Brandon F.

description:
Everyone tries the basil gimlet...be adventurous!  The Little Bee is delicious and dangerous.  What more could you ask for in a drink? ;)

Great atmosphere and good crowd.
author: Ali B.

description:
I recently went Bar hopping again..so I came by this place.
The beautiful bartender was out of ingedients on a drink I loved
called the "Flash" so she improptu made me a drink..I response

to My words "Surpirse me"...and that she did.
I really don't remember want I had but It was a variation of 
something with Vodka, and pom-a-granted. lol.
author: Michael R.

description:
Boo... How do you make a gin and tonic taste watered down? The bartender/s (looking at you, bald guy with mustache and beard) at Rye seem to know how to.

Other than that, the venue is solid for a bar/lounge stop for the end of the evening. Staff is polite and the doorman is a cool dude.

I get it, it's New Year's Day and it's closing time. You want to go home. So do I. Just wished I could go home with a better night cap.
author: Michael T.

description:
Gorgeous bar at the tenderloin.

The Pimm's cup was delicious. Bartenders really know what they're doing. It could've been a tad stronger though. 

The old fashioned had a great kick. Love the vibe of this place, and would love to come back
author: Rachel T.

description:
I wanted to like this place I really did! After living and being fed-up with the marina I decided to venture out to Rye, biggest mistake yet. Not only are the people here a bit more pretentious they're not high up on coke to mask their inability to hold their alcohol. 
The service was TERRIBLE, I stood at the bar flashed my pearly whites and even used my "excuse me can I order a drink" and the bartender looked at me and went to someone else. LAME! Anyways I doubt I'll be back, well I might, I did love watching the drunk as shit white girl go up to a group of guys and say "I love black men".
author: Cristelle J.

description:
After reading some reviews, I would really like to come back and give Rye another try, because my experience was just blah.  

We came here as our last stop of the evening but maybe a first or second would have been better.  One of the guys we were with wanted spiced rum and ginger.  Easy right?  Nope!  The bartender told him very perplexedly that they have no spiced rum.  Ok, this isn't ever my choice of booze, but how can you not have any?  Just weird.  Drinks are pricy, but that was expected.  My drink way waaay watered down - probably a good thing since I had already knocked back a few, but for $10, I want to think I'm drinking something other than soda water.

It was totally packed and we were standing in the way for a while, but we were able to find a spot on the "outdoor" patio, which compared to others, was just cramped and had awkward stools when there should just be the couple tall tables.  Hmm.  

Before leaving, I of course had to use the restroom.  For the entire place, there is just a onesy!  I really don't want to have to share a bathroom with a bunch of drunk dudes at the end of a long night, sorry.
author: Josie S.

description:
Walked into this place at the end of a rough night, a lot of waking and not a lot of drinking. Different than most nights but by the time I got my drink I was really able to enjoy it and get the full flavor of everything.

The atmosphere is very young SF. Trendy but not overpowering. I enjoyed the open area seating and overall how not cramped the bar area was

Te only draw back was the blonde bar tender woman. She made myself and all my friends killer drinks but did it in mostly a bitch way.
Complaining about how late it was and how by that time of the night she doesn't put much effort into how the drink is made or will taste due to the time and that she has been working all night. 
I can understand if it's late and you're tired but if you're job is making drinks for 10 bucks then get it done, if you want to work at a dive bar and mix whiskey sours then complain there.

She really just killed the mood and was overall was very off putting. I would definitely go back, would never be severed by her again.
author: Willy W.

description: Great spot for drinks, multi level with friendly staff, industrial design/decor.  Although not on menu, the bartender made an amazing French 75. All & all great spot for friends or date night!
author: Michelle Q.

description:
Pretty awesome spot! Picked this place to gather some friends for a pre bday showdown in the hopes of facing the last days of my still very youthful status with grace and it turned out to be an overall successful celebration! Just a few annoying things but I was a very happy camper at the end of the night! And my friends all had a great time too!

My PROS:
1) No dress code and no cover!
2) Awesome crowd - friendly, patient, non pissed off mix of patrons even though everyone and their brothers, sisters and cousins were crowding the bar!
3) What others have been saying about the bartenders is true - friendly bunch and mixes great drinks!
4) At least they have one little table with a few seats that doesn't require a bottle service reservation located near the pool table area. Thank goodness a couple of friends got there a little early and snagged it!
5) Pool table!!!  No fees to use it! No fights over it either!  Good distraction.
6) Clean bathrooms!
7) There's an outdoor cage for smokers with a couple of small 2-person bar type tables.

My CONS:
1) Dang it was packed when we arrived at about 10 on a Saturday night! Not a lot of places to sit so beware ladies who decide to wear stilletos into this venue!  I think the lounge area requires bottle service because two friends got booted out when they tried to sit. I didn't think they'd require a reservation for seating but I guess they do... oh well... (correction: bottle service is not usually required but the night I came I guess someone reserved all of the tables)
2) so packed it could take anywhere from 10-20 minutes to get a drink at the bar
3) They measure their drinks to the tee but guess what their drinks are pretty awesome (well at least the ones I ordered were!)
4) Aww pretty good music but no dance floor? 

It's more of a bar or club that's missing a dance floor than a lounge because you can't really have a normal convo without yelling at your companion.  However, I think with the exception of the few annoyances I was entirely happy with my experience here at this bar.  Too bad the actual lounging area may require bottle service Saturday nights though (correction: nope, bottle service usually not required but you are able to reserve all their tables if you wanted to).  Drink prices were decent; they aren't wallet breaking, at least in my opinion... but hopefully that doesn't mean there was a calculation mistake in there somewhere! 2 jack shots, 4 kamikazes, 1 vodka cocktail - all for $50! Nice.
author: Mercy D.

description: Got in here on a Saturday night right before they were going to close, was able to have one more drink and we enjoyed the 30 minutes we stayed until they closed! Will definitely come back and have a couple drinks when back in San Fran! Loved it here!
author: Dulce G.

description:
Mixology bars are the new Skechers Shape Ups. Wait, those were big, right? We've long desired bartenders with some creative savvy and actual know-how, and we've finally gotten it. 

The ambiance is both chic and understated, and the highlight--or me, at least--is the smoke cage. Yes, smoke cage. As a smoker, you get to mingle with the other smokers in a fancy smoker cage, and as a non-smoker, you get to watch smokers mingle and do their mating dances, a la the zoo. It's a fascinating sociological-experiment night out. I'll be damned if I didn't see at least two future walk-of-shames come out of that cage. I wasn't exactly blessed with any record-breaking talents, but I do have the innate ability to spot THAT much.

I gave the bartender a list of my favorite drinks, and she concocted something of a raspberry-mojito-meets-a-bellini for me, and I sipped the hell out of it as I watched an episode of "What Will Hook Up In The Cage?".
author: Ellie W.

description: Meh. Went to check out the place with friends since it was near our hotel and has so many good reviews. Nothing impressive. If you are in the area and looking for a place for a few drinks, sure. But nothing worth coming back for. Drinks are bit pricey but SF is expensive so that's understandable.
author: Bixi T.

description: Great cocktails and very nice bartender. She indulged our curiosity and taught us a lot about pimms.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Oh Rye... what would Yelp employees do without you? You've provided many a delicious cocktail to CM's, Sales Reps and Engineers alike. You don't care what floor we work on or who we report to, as long as we pay our tab at the end of the night! 

With such an extensive drink menu, it's hard to figure out what to order. Lucky for me, I come here enough and can give you a hot tip: order the Flash (cucumber, gin, kiwi) or the Basil Gimlet. Both are fresh and tasty - I could really drink them all night, but would regret that decision the next day. 

The best thing about Rye, besides the booze, is the laid-back atmosphere. Some cocktail bars have an air of pretension where you feel like you can't sit down and relax. No worries, here. Whether you want to play a game of pool, sit back in a cozy booth or enjoy a smoke on the front patio, the folks at Rye don't care. That's not to say that the bartenders aren't hustling - they work their asses off making fresh drinks and ensuring that your glass is never empty. 

Love, love, love - will always come back for one more round!
author: Abby S.

description:
A simple Yelp search of "bars" near Powell Bart station will pull up Rye. My best friend and I wanted a good bar to hang out at in the city on a Saturday night that was walkable from the BART station and I did a little research. It's a couple blocks from Union Square and at night the area is a bit sketchy, but Rye is such a cool place that once you're inside, you'll forget about the homeless people outside. The ambiance is awesome...cool, dark, candle-lit and pretty. 

The bartenders are really good at the mixology they do, and hopefully you perused through Yelp before going here because you won't find their signature drinks on the menu since they are just THAT well known for them! Get the Basil Gimlet FOR SURE. One of the best drinks I've ever had. Really. Ever. But it's also dangerous because it tastes so good that I can't taste the alcohol. It'll hit you before you know it. The Flash is also good, but we had ours without kiwi for the night because they ran out. I'd be curious how much better it would taste with the kiwi instead. Ours was just more cucumber-y. Which was still delicious. 

Ask them to make anything you want and I'm pretty sure they can do it. If you come early in the night, it's a great spot to chill and talk. We got there around 8:30 and left maybe an hour or so later so we probably avoided whatever crowds that might have come later at night and had a pretty good spot on a couch to talk as well as at the bar top counter. The space at the bar is very limited though, so I can imagine it would be hard to get your drinks later in the night. All in all, we had a chill experience and I'd come back. Just wish they had food to munch on too! 

P.S. I followed Thia G and Ngoc N's suggestion to order from a guy bartender since they need that arm strength to crush the basil and shake up your drinks real good :)
author: Jasmine C.

description: Basil gimlet is amazing, and I don't even like basil.  I did try another cocktail once and it was not good, so stick to basil gimlet.  Atmosphere is comfortable and I enjoy the somewhat diverse crowd.  If you're a smoker, you'd love the cage.  It's walking distance to Katana Ya (kitchen closes at 1:15am) as well, so you can begin or end your night eating delicious ramen.
author: Vivian H.

description: Awesome cocktail bar out in San Francisco. The bartenders were very knowledgable and know how to put on a show !
author: Bobby V.

description:
Woweewowow!  My drink, that good!  

It's a magical thing when you and a drink come together as one.  Me and that drink definitely had magic together.  The drink I speak of is the Tijuana Brass.  I scanned over the menu really quickly and thought it was called Tequila Bliss.  

I asked the bartender for that and he was having none of me.  I get it, the bar was packed and some dumb chick is ordering a drink he's never heard of.  This man had mad bartending skillz so I'm SURE he's probably heard of every drink under the sun.  I quickly scanned the menu again and asked for the correct name and he looked at me shocked and said "dummy, do you even like beer?"  OK, he didn't say dummy, but I was like heck yeah I like beer!  

This drink...ah-maz-ing!  Who would have thunk tequila and cheapie Tecate beer would make such a fantastic team...but they DID!  I had to hold myself back from imbibing on more.  Good thing because it was one of those dimly lit bars and I may have been found passed out in the corner somewhere...

I thought for a moment I was in Mexico, on a sandy beach in Riviera Maya.  I'll avoid Tijuana though, it's scary.
author: Rachel C.

description:
My favorite bar in the city! Hands down best bartenders around. They are so good at what they do, it's incredible. 

The basil gimlet is perfection. Fresh, sweet and slightly tangy. Order one. You won't regret it.
author: Vanessa G.

description: This seems like one of the more popular places in the area. It was a younger crowd than all the other places we stopped by (younger as in under 40, I didn't feel like the only non-gray-haired person in the room lol) and it had a good atmosphere.
author: Kathlena H.

description:
4 Stars!... At least that's my rating from what I can remember!

It was Saturday on Halloween weekend and we were going bar hopping for my 25th birthday. We made this stop #1 since one of my friends/coworkers was having his birthday celebration at this place. Walking in was easy -- just an ID check and no cover charge. This place was pretty busy with a young, friendly crowd. Dim lighting set the ambiance and getting to the bar was pretty easy. I didn't seem much else of the place because I got caught chatting with people at the corner of the bar by the door.

When we were going in and out trying to gather the rest of our group before heading to our next stop, the guy at the door was really nice about it and didn't bother us at all. 

A solid place for a good drink in a trendy (but not hipster) bar. Hopefully I'll make it out here again!
author: Leana L.

description:
Pretty chill bar.  Really crowded.  But the crowd is really friendly.  My ankle was broken and people gave up their seats.  The service was great too, but I wasn't a fan of my Moscow Mule...and my friends had drinks that were even sweeter and not up to par with a good Moscow Mule.   The Whiskey was good though.  

Overall, if I wasn't already tired of the TL, I would go back.
author: Edelmira D.

description:
Was planning on post-dinner cocktails at Bourban&Branch (just around the corner), but they were closed on our nice Sunday night... so with the help of Yelp, we came here.

I'll keep this short:
Pool table and open speakeasy/lounge like atmosphere - 5stars
Their infamous Basil Gimlet (not on the menu); very cool and refreshing - 4stars
No elderflower liquor - 1star

Overall a very nice and easy going place - for a Sunday night. Supposedly it gets pretty rowdy here throughout the week... but regardless, I'd be happy to come back here to give their other drinks a try... specially since I love anything muddled (:
author: Lana N.

description:
The Yelpers had spoken, and basil gimlet it was.
Came here after work for a drinky drink and decided to try it. Plus, twas happy hour so the price and awesome drink definitely made me happy. You can either have it with vodka or gin, and the delightful bartender recommended gin - twas excellent.

Only bummer part was finding out they don't serve food when I had the drunchies...
author: Kris I.

description:
Great vibe and ambiance for a bar that serves great whiskey cocktails. Had both a manhattan and old fashioned with rye.  The bartender took his time and effort with the drink and it definitely came through in the taste.  

I highly recommend this place for a chill time and a great cocktail.

Also enjoyed the old school hip hop playing in the background.
author: Matt S.

description:
First ever mixology bar I have been to and I'm thoroughly impressed. The Mixologists seem really into what they are mixing and listened to their customer's requests.

I'm allergic to alcohol but tasted my cousin blood orange with mint cocktail and I really liked the taste very much. This place gets pretty full and you'll have to wait if the bar is at their full capacity, but the bouncer is super friendly and really enjoy talking to you.
author: Robin S.

description:
Chill bar. Variations on the Manhattan galore! 

Jennifer rocks - friendly, helpful, delicious cocktails.

Will definitely be back!
author: Crystal M.

description:
It's hard to spot from the street because it's a mostly nondescript black door with a very tiny sign. Parking was hard to find, unless you were willing to park in the super dodgy areas (we had luck uphill where the nicer apartment towers are). 

I love that the smell of good whiskey hits you as soon as you walk in there! It's very inviting, with warm lighting, lots of seating, and a decent patio area. The area in front of the bar is kind of small and annoying to get shoved around while you wait for your drink, but the bartender we had was efficient. 

The mint julep comes all fancy in a metal cup, and they have fresh mint and other herbs that I couldn't identify here. I ordered a double whiskey smash. Usually when that much alcohol goes into a drink, you can't expect it to taste good, just get the job done, but it was still pretty yummy! The ingredients are top notch and the skill that goes into mixing make the drinks worth the $10-$12 price.
author: Cat N.

description:
We walked in, and Some Drunk Girl comes up to us and says, "Uh, this is a private party." 

I've fallen for that one before. You wouldn't BELIEVE how many people don't want me around. But my compatriots were a bit more savvy. Instead of running home and sobbing into their pillows, they looked around. There was no one at the door, no list, nothing to indicate that there was in fact a private party. 

So we ignored her and ordered an Aviation, a Spiced Ginger, and a Grey Lady. Now, I've said this before: I'm not a cocktail guy. But as the saying goes, when in Rome...order some sort of girly drink.

Our bartender was actually a pleasure to watch. She wasted nary a movement and was clearly very knowledgeable. Also, the end result was fantastic. It turned out my Aviation was not girly in the least. It kind of rocked. 

Perhaps I'm entering a new chapter in my life, one where I will indulge in fewer, but higher quality cocktails. Or perhaps I will continue to drink forties, Popov, Ten High, and be the drunk we all know I am. It's like 80/20 in favor of the latter.

Armed with superior cocktails, we stepped out into the small screened-in patio area. It quickly became apparent our friend at the door had not been hallucinating, and there had been a private party. The remnants of a catered dinner were strewn about, and nearly everyone in the bar was whammered. 

Some Drunk Girl was out there swaying up a storm. When she noticed that one of my companions smoked, she came over, played around with an empty box of cigarettes that had been left on the table, and then worked up the courage to ask for one. As a peace offering, she said, "I have an open bar tab..." 

I'm cutting the rest of that story off, as it's not interesting enough* to share. But Rye seems like an exceptional place for cocktails, provided that you don't have to deal with Some Drunk Girl.
___________

*Certainly not because I drank too much and don't remember the rest of it.
author: Peter D.

description: One of my favorite bars to unwind at. The decor is a throwback to the speakeasy style with a sleek modern twist, dark wood, low moody lighting, brick and concrete. The drinks are finely crafted and the bartenders are always welcoming and very knowledgeably passionate of their craft, if you're up for learning a thing or two. The energy here is laid back; classy and classic without being uptight. The music is always right on the mark as well. A true SF favorite of mine.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Went here last night by accident and was happy to do so. Passed up the bar I wanted to go to but when I walked inside the atmosphere was very cozy. Since it was a Sunday I wasn't expecting much but we were greeted by our bartender and when asked about the whiskey was knowledgable. Music was very loud though. Small specialty cocktail menu focused on whiskey but many other libations available. 

Faves: among all the whiskey they have Tecate cans!
author: Christina L.

description: Plays killer old skool hip hop and lots of Biggie!  2 thumbs up.
author: Justin L.

description:
As many a yelper has said before me, Rye is slick, sleek, and slightly snotty - but in a good way, I swear. 

If you're into artisan cocktails, fancy whiskey and all that jazz, then you'll be knocked out by the offerings at Rye. They take their time to make your drink, and have the ability to mix just about anything you ask them for. Their menu is also pretty cool - I've tossed back several of their bourbon tipples and a few gin varieties, too. 

The space itself is cool - poured concrete and glass with warmth added by raw wooden surfaces and glow-y lighting. Though I've not sat anywhere but the bar or the seats in back by the pool table (you heard), there's plenty of space to park your pack for an hour or two.
author: Hilary H.

description: Known Jen for over 13 years she has never served me a bad drink!! Shes not only a good friend but a great mixologist!! Love rye and all its talents~ come here for great drinks and good times!!
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
Currently my favorite bar in San Francisco.

The drinks are made absolutely impeccably.  Top notch bartending here.

You'll pay the price for it, both in cost and in wait times.  That being said -- it's totally worth it.

Come early and sit at the bar and make friends with the bartender -- it's the only way you'll be able to get enough drinks to even get tipsy :)

The Whiskey sour is easily the best made whiskey sour in SF(Runner up -- Burritt Room)

Stop reading this and go check it out!

PS: Pet Peeve --- WTF is with cell service here?  It's a gaddam black hole!
author: Yan L.

description:
Cool vibe here at Rye....

Love the bricked wall with graffiti art...

Love the cocktail mixes....

Love the prices....

Love the music...

Smoking spot. whut!
author: Monica H.

description: Good drinks! Good crowd! Weird space! The bartenders are alright folk and there's a smoker's cage. I guess this is a craft cocktail place. No? Yes?
author: Tommy W.

description:
great small spot to grab a cocktail. nice ambiance, not too dirty like a dive bar considering the location, but not too swanky that it makes you feel uptight. most of the drinks are interesting and delicious cocktails that range from $9-10. 

only downside- there are tables that make it appear like you can sit and order since the menu is on the table, but you can only order from the bar. not that big of a deal, but slightweight annoying if someone snatches your table when you go the bar to grab a drink.
author: Jessica V.

description: Cool cocktail bar here. My favorite drink is the La Lambada.  Place can get crowded, so try to grab bar seats when it opens. Bartenders here are good, one gave me a menu right away when I got to the bar, even when it was super crowded.
author: Lisa T.

description: Appropriately mysterious and industrial. The drinks are poured well and the crowd is just on the edge of hipster/geeky/chic. This is a hidden gem!
author: Regina D.

description:
Quite generous with the hard stuff, and easy on the eyes, if you find yourself on a Tenderloin bar crawl (OK, WHEN you find yourself on a Tenderloin bar crawl), Rye is a must-stop.

The bartenders are incredibly friendly, even topped off our drinks because a friend put the whole tab on one card, and the crowd's surprisingly upscale for the neighborhood. There's dim lighting, and lots of late night eating options for the inevitable 1am ravenous hunger. The gender ratio's a little off (though my female friend says that's why she likes the place), but if you like anything orange or full of whiskey, make it a point to stop by Rye.
author: Kevin B.

description: I am a sucker for a great cocktail bar and this one was excellent. It wasn't too uptight so it felt like a comfy spot to drink. The bartender was super friendly and nice. The drinks were great, very innovative. I enjoyed it!
author: Heather W.

description:
Rye is a typical mixologista bar that serves yummy cocktails. Their basil gimlet is solid and a classic - you can never go wrong with it.

While the bar area is quite nice and simple and they have an adjacent small lounge-area, it can get incredibly crowded here, making it difficult for a good conversation spot. It's probably best to come here expecting a fun, chill, easy-going loud environment. Drinks are $9-$13 per cocktail.
author: Veronica S.

description:
They played The Strokes here. That alone should tell you this place is awesome! 
Dark and loud, limited seating and incredible cocktails. 

They made the best Jameson/Ginger beer I've ever had. Their cocktails are hand crafted to perfection, so service is a little sluggish. Drink prices are a little steep but so worth every sip!
author: Lydia L.

description:
Yay for hand crafted artisan cocktails in the heart of the Tenderloin. Well, I could do without the Tenderloin part but Rye is definitely worth the trip. 

Great dim lighting, woodsy vibe, interesting mix of folks across their 20s and 30s and talented bartenders. Definitely makes for a fine Friday or Saturday post-dinner spot. 

You really can't go wrong with ordering anything on their drinks menu but as almost every other review suggests, the Basil Gimlet is the unadulterated winner. It's sweet, tangy and quite strong, just the way I love my cocktails. 

So the next time you're on a clubbing or barhopping spree in the Tenderloin, stop by Rye for some spectacular cocktails. 

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
I am going out on a limb, here. As much as I like fancy schmancy stuff, dark rooms, mysterious women, and cages... I'm just not feeling this place. I don't know what it is. It has all the elements, I *should* like... it just leaves me cold. It's almost too cool (if such a thing is possible) without having any real identity. I have been here more than a few times. I avoid it as often as possible. Each time I arrive, I try to have a good time for my friends' sake but I always wind up leaving early.

I think it comes down to cucumber. I prefer mine in salads, not in cocktails.
author: Johnny T.

description:
It's easy to walk by this place and not even know its there. The interior decor is really great. It has a cool vibe without feeling too pretentious. There is a great patio and a pool table plus plenty of places to sit. It's very relaxing. 

The Santiago Sun was a delicious alternative to all of the whiskey drinks on the menu but the Basil Gimlet really won me over.
author: Kari G.

description:
Nice lounge, with a great little area to hang out. Doesn't seem to be as crowded as some of the other places, but I'm haven't been enough to tell.

They have interesting cocktails, and they take time to make them. It's interesting standing by the bar to see them make the drinks though; they even crush the ice right there on the side of the counter.

The drinks are good; a bit to the sweet side which is perfect for me.
author: Alice C.

description: Nice place.  It was quiet when we went on a Saturday but it was also like 4 or 5pm. Great cocktails.  Will be back.
author: Lindsay W.

description:
Well, it's a bit ridiculous that a seasoned beer drinker is reviewing one of the most well loved cocktail bars in SF, but there you go. They even impressed with their choice of ales. (But then, perhaps that's because I'm British and didn't know the majority of them?) In any case; décor - check. Cool and dark. Drinks - check. Plenty to satisfy everyone. Smoking area - check. A strange and alluring cage where passers by can look but not touch. I liked it a lot. Staff - check. Friendly and patient whilst I "ummed" and "ahhhed" over what to have. 

An all round win! Definitely worth your time, money and musings. Love it!
author: Rowena H.

description:
Place was packed on a monday, bartenders working hard, but the guy would ask for orders then forget. Would drop off a drink and leave before people could pay, ran out of glassware and waited with 4 other people for 10-15 minutes just to close our tabs. 

Drinks are hand-crafted, delicious, and often rather potent. The bartenders know exactly what they're doing, but more often than not it seems like the place is a little understaffed.

Regardless, this is an excellent bar located reasonably close to downtown. It's laid back enough that you don't need to dress up, but classy enough that walking in wearing a suit wouldn't be out of place either.
author: Taylor S.

description: I never thought anyone could make a bad vodka soda until I came here. Seriously, who messes up a vodka soda?? You're pretty much just paying for a very basic hipster aesthetic, and a really gross air of pretentiousness.
author: Jackie G.

description:
Whoaaaaaa duuuuuude. Those are some mean and strong cocktails! Have to admit that things got much better when I saw the size/shape of the killer ice cubes this place is crankin' out. I had a nice, perky gin drink from the menu. Don't exactly recall the name, but it was strong and not served in a tumbler with one of the mentioned, tubular ice cubes. 

Nice setup, too. Therein lies the world's oldest pool table. Billiards fans from the 1800's probably played on this joker. Seriously. It's so old, with noticeably large gashes in the felt, and plenty of ware....and many spilled drinks, I'm sure.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
My friend and I decided to do some bar hopping after work on Friday to wind down from the crazy week we had, and our first stop was Rye. 

We got here at around 6:30? They were doing happy hour until 7:30-- $2 off drinks (i think) +1 star for that because really, who's going to say no to cheaper drinks? 

I forgot what I got, but my friend got the moscow mule. It was cool because it came in a copper cup and they ask for your id to make sure you don't take the cup with you. The drinks here are really good-- you can taste the alcohol but not strong enough to think you're just drinking hard liquor but not too sweet that you feel like you're just drinking soda/juice. all about $9-12 regular price i think? 

Overall, it was a great experience. I liked how they had a little outdoor cage area for smokers.. I think my only complaint would be that the music is really loud so it's hard to hear/talk to your friends, even when they're only sitting across from you.
author: Judy B.

description: Love the atmosphere, and the basil gimlet is amazing. Great place to go for a drink with a few friends to just hang out, or begin the night.
author: Christine C.

description:
I thought this place looked pretty good from the pictures/reviews I saw on Yelp, so I decided to go. When I walked in, they handed me a menu but it only had around 10 drinks and none of them sounded that great to me. I asked for the 'Santiago Sun' (which is a drink that I saw in one of the photos on the yelp page), but the bartender didn't know how to make it. I think I asked for another drink off their old menu and they didn't know how to make that either :( disappointing. So I got the basil gimlet, and it was really good! So +1 for that. I think I also got the Pimms cup and it was pretty good too. But my boyfriend had the opposite experience-- he got some drink on the menu that had black tea in it. Sounded interested but tasted disgusting lol. He got another drink on the menu and that one didn't taste good either.

Overall, I'm pretty disappointed at the limited variety of drinks that the bartenders could make. Also, the drinks aren't very consistent. Some are good, some aren't. Even though me and my boyfriend were sitting at the bar, the bartenders were really inattentive and kept talking to their friends who were there so the service isn't great either. Maybe I just came on an off day, but I don't think I"ll be coming back
author: Christina L.

description:
Rye has a very NYC feeling to it (a good thing). I recently came here for a Cal alum reunion and was REALLY impressed as soon as I walked in. The space is great. I love exposed brick walls, high ceilings and pool table. 

I had a couple of Racer 5's and tried a sip of the some egg nog martini they had which was tasty. The bartenders were very friendly with us and all in all very impressed with this place. It is stumbling distance from my house so I was shocked I hadn't been there before. Very impressive cocktail menu so if you're into that it is definitely worth checking out.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Went here for a date and sat out on the small patio at the front of the bar. Rye was decorated well, good mood lighting and there were plenty of restrooms - although they were lacking toilet paper. 

Drinks were good. Came on a Friday at 6pm and it was pretty dead inside. Close to work - would go again.
author: Aneilia M.

description:
I came here on a regular ol' Thursday night and don't plan to return based on my experience. The crowd was a bit frat-ish, and the "music" playing was 80s tunes a la bad wedding. Who needs to EVER hear Eurythmics again, EVER?

There was a drunk girl who could barely stand up. Oh, and there's an attached smoking lounge room, so basically it smells like smoke in here because the smoke just wafts into the bar. Kinda gross.

And, the cocktails, my whole reason for going out and paying money in a joint like this? Nothing to write home about. I honestly don't even remember what I had, they were so unmemorable. They weren't BAD; they simply weren't memorable or all that creative/special. There's been an explosion of amazing mixology around the Bay, so whereas this place may have passed muster two years ago, it really needs to up its game now to compete.

But based on atmosphere alone I won't be rushing back.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday and it was fairly crowded. This bar is hard to find if you don't know what you're looking for since there sign is small on the outside. It is modern décor on the inside and dark.

Their $3 beers for Happy Hour are great but the service is a bit lacking. The bar staff was not the most friendly on this night and slow at times. The crowd is diverse and for this part of town, that is expected.

All in all, a decent place to chill with your friends, but I wouldn't expect to meet anyone new.
author: Steve V.

description:
I like this cocktail bar. It's very neat looking inside. Their cocktail menu changes, depending on the season, they said. I forgot what I ordered but it was their special drink of the day with dragonfruit vodka. I really liked the drink. The drinks are expensive at around $9-11. 

What my friends noticed though is that all of our drinks had mint, so in the end, our drinks were like mojitos. (Not to discredit Rye's drinks.)

They have 1 bathroom and it's clean when I went in there.

If you want to try new and interesting cocktail drinks, give Rye a shot.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
The only reason Rye gets a 4 is because its in a really shady area.  Which is totally not it's fault but it's shady nonetheless.  The actual bar was made for those of us who love the perfectly concocted drink in a place where you can play pool.  It was just so fun, with great drinks that are super strong while still being delicious and beautiful San Fran people in an ambiance that makes you glad to be alive-and to be out playing.  
I will so be back and I can see why locals are in love.
author: Lama B.

description:
The best basil gimlet I've had to date.

Beautifully crafted. Rye is located in TL, a bit sketch but always worth the trip. Beautiful industrial space; dimly lit, speak-easy type atmosphere. Laid-back, unassuming vibe. Best nights are during the week, it gets extremely crowded here on the weekends and you'll wait a long time for a drink.

The mixologists here are top notch and meticulous in their preparation; like a well-oiled machine. Incredible list of cocktails. Order the basil gimlet, you will not be disappointed. Or let them know your liquor of choice and have them create something for you. Enjoy!
author: Ashley K.

description:
This place is cool. Pretty low key vibe - it was dimly lit and quite quiet when we were there. There was no table service; we ordered at the bar, but both of the bartenders were friendly and efficient. 

I had a delicious cocktail they've named La Lambada - leblon cachaca, mezcal, lime, jalapeño tincture, and mole bitters, garnished with red sweet pepper. It had a kick, but was definitely not overwhelming. A really well balanced and thought out concoction. $10.

I tried my friend's Commonwealth Tonic, which I was less into. London Dry Gin, Bitterman's Commonwealth Tonic Liqueur, hopped grapefruit bitters and soda. It was a bit too heavy on the soda/tonic for my tastes, but was refreshing nonetheless. $9.

I happened to be at a hotel just down the street, so this was a welcomed find in the Union Square/Tenderloin area which all too often can feel like the Times Square of San Francisco.
author: Christian S.

description:
Ain't too shabby!

This is more of a chill-and-talk-with-friends kind of place as opposed to a let's-get-so-wasted-I-don't-know-where-I-left-my-pants kind of place. Small place, but a very intimate ambiance what with the extremely dim lighting and all.

Bouncer was super friendly, and the bartenders know how to make a drink! Strong and tasty. I like how they crush fresh fruit into their drinks. Definitely worth it to pay $10 for a drink here than for a weak AMF at the average club.
author: Mina K.

description:
This place is kinda stupid. I took a friend there last night looking for something different than our neighborhood favorite, and was, at first, a little disgusted. Later, I was just humored by the ridiculousness of my experience. 

We scored a couple of barstools--a stroke of luck on a Saturday night--and sat down. The bar-back cleared the empty glasses in front of us, but didn't bother to wipe the bar, so our hands, when we rested them there as people do, rested in the sticky residue of whatever the people before us had been drinking and spilling. Not what I want after paying $15 for an ounce-and-a-half of whiskey. If you're going to charge that much, you better pay your staff to do a very good job. 

We ordered two Yamazakis, ice on the side. The bartender said something like, "you have to be some of the most particular drinkers out there," which seemed a little weird because whiskey, relative to the haute-cocktail culture in SF, is pretty straightforward regarding the bartender: pour and serve. No frills. Then he mentioned something about his father and Scotch and cigars, and how he wouldn't drink unless he had a smoke and a place to sit. I guess my buddy and I triggered this bartender's daddy issues. (Look, pal. I'm sorry your dad was a particular asshole, but I just want you to pour my drink. If I think you're a good bartender and I want to trust you, maybe I'll tell you about my father, and I'll tip you for listening and pretending to give a shit. Until then, shut up and pour and don't tell me I'm "particular".) 

The place looks great, all concrete and wood, brick and glass. I'm not a fan of the wall art, but that's just a preference. Also, they have gender-neutral restrooms. This is a telling detail. It's telling because no woman in her right mind would venture into a bar restroom that men are also allowed into. I think they have a ladies' room, too, but the question remains, 'why, for a place with classy decor, do they make gender-neutral restrooms?' Rye needs a men's room and a ladies' room. The men can spray the fucking ceiling with their piss-drunk piss, and the women can have a safe place to sit. Don't invite women to go into the men's room. It's not classy.

Above the bar at Rye, amongst all the back-lit bottles, is a glass tankard of kitschy rye tincture. It's flavored with citrus and spice and smells like Christmas. Stay away from it. It tastes like Triaminic. The bartender was nice enough to pour a round of shots on the house when I asked for a taste, and I appreciated that gesture. That's good bartending, and, along with the interior design, it earned the place a second star from me. But, the shit is shwag. You don't have to have a rye tincture if you're going to call your bar Rye. You do have to have a reasonable selection of Ryes, though, which I can only assume the place does. I don't think I'll be going back there to find out. If you're going to charge me $15 for a couple of ounces from a bottle that retails for $45, I expect to be drinking on a clean bar in a classy establishment. Ostensibly though it tries, the attempt is specious.
author: Ryan W.

description:
I hate you, Rye, for being entirely across the country. I have spent the last 6 months trying to find a cocktail that even comes close to measuring up.

We came in on an early weeknight evening - the bar was not packed, the staff was knowledgeable and attentive, the drinks were outstanding! Our bartender explained the back story of several cocktails while working hard at making our labor-intensive drinks - which we found really cool.  The Flash was my favorite, followed closely by (surprise) the Basil Gimlet.
author: Alicia B.

description:
The outside looks a tad shady, but the interior is modern, mellow & very dim. 

I almost want to give this place 5 stars for the drink itself, but overall my experience was a 4. Since the Basil Gimlet is a popular drink, I gave that a try. It was quite refreshing, the basil flavor was perfectly prominent. Ten dollars for that was well worth it because it was something new that I have never tried. My fellow lounger ordered the Flash with muddled kiwi and cucumber...that was even MORE refreshing. More citrusy than cucumbery. If you haven't tried the Basil Gimlet or Flash, I'd recommend those. Oh, and 4 kamikaze shots is roundabout 28. First time trying it, and it's pretty tasty! Someone else ordered a Stella which was $5. 

The alcohol content in the drink was well-balanced...there wasn't a strong taste of alcohol, but it was not a cocktail that tasted like juice. Bravo. 

We had an underage lady in our group, but she was allowed to go in since no one checks the ID until you actually order at the bar. We went on a Wednesday night and it was not crowded at all. Maybe around 4 other groups? We just ordered the drink and brought it to the seating area..finished it rather quickly, and went back to the hotel. So we did not actually experience the lounging part of the lounge.
author: Anna S.

description:
Improv cocktails with a proper selection of liquor that included chartreuse

Name a theme or key ingredient and the mixologist shakes up a tasty tipple with creative garnish. I am not a big fan of drinking, so the bartenders must be amazing to make me order multiple cocktails, not to be social, but to enjoy their intricate flavors.

There's a caged patio for those wild smokers; the patio is how I find Rye, whose entrance is obscure: a sliding door you have to feel for like you're trapped in The Labyrinth.

Overbearingly loud music and crowds - good place to come out to your parents that you're... not republican

Short people need to be extraordinarily patient, cute or clever to get past the hordes of people wrapped five layers deep around the bar and order a drink

Dark, refined industrial interior
author: Lum P.

description: I never want my cocktail to be gone it's so delicious. Superb atmosphere to have a deep chat with someone you care about.
author: Melissa R.

description: Went out to dinner with some coworkers last week but the reservation was at 8 PM.   I left the office around 6:30 and walked down Geary towards my destination.   Since I was early, I figured I'd get a drink and I came across Rye.   The first drink I had was some variation on the Manhattan.   It was a nice drink but slightly too sweet for my taste.   For my second drink, I just went for a double Bulleit on the rocks.   Yeah, that was more like it!  :)   As far as ambiance, this place definitely had a cool hip vibe to it... They were playing good ol' 80s classics by Run-DMC.   Booze and 80s rap... Can't beat that!
author: David O.

description:
Why, Rye, you are so modern and sexy and your drinks are so disgustingly strong!

We went there tonight for two friends' birthdays and we tried "Like A G-6", and let me tell you, this drink was NOTHING like a G-6!  It came in a pretty pink color and it smelled so good except this drink punched me in the face.  

Don't get me wrong - I am not  a wimp and rarely do I say no to alcoholic beverages (and that's why usually I black out - I still don't know my limit because after the 8th drink, I just lose count!), but this is a one-sip wonder.  Yeah, for $10, you could possibly get wasted on this seemingly friendly and girly pink drink.

I love the energy in there, it's so hip and trendy, just the way I imagined most low key & uppity SF bars to be.  I loved their pool table; though I don't play pool, it provided me with hours of entertainment watching my friends missing the ball.

Aside from the bar, there's a lounging area - perfect for intimate conversation!  The crowd that come here also look pretty sexy too. Holler!
author: Peggy S.

description: Cool place, but not outstanding. It was a chill bar, drinks only, few people at 6pm. Known for their whiskey, obviously, but I tried the Dragons Spritzer! It was delicious :) played great music.
author: Sara P.

description: Seating on the side, front smoking area, and bar stools and a pool table towards the back. Fun cocktails place with friendly bartenders. Great setting with a group. Cool vibe for a 'lets go out and have a drink' atmosphere. Wouldn't come here for a date night (too loud).
author: Christine L.

description: P in the V Sundays. Best night of the week!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
tried all these drinks and they were all very delicious!
basil gimlet, 5 island milk punch, little bee, honey trap, and rye & rock.
my fav would be the basil gimlet, and little bee.
honey trap tastes like something i'd drink when im sick without the alcohol lol...
it's still delicious but i prefer something else like the ones i recommended above.
the place is quite and very nice. small but very clean and relaxing.
they have a smoking area with doors closed just right next to the tables so u don't have to go all the way out.
author: Ru C.

description:
This place is cool. My only gripe that on any busy night, you're going to wait 20 minutes to get eye contact with a bartender because of how packed it is and how long it takes to make their cocktails.

They make em really well though.
author: Alec C.

description:
Loved the drinks here. Flash was the best I had.

A bit loud and crowded for me. For a lounge they don't have much of anything in the way of comfy seating. 

Also, as more and more people go in and out of the smoking area it can stink up that side of the bar, which is gross for those of us who don't death stick it.
author: Alexi A.

description:
Rye is too small- and for a lounge it should have a bit more seating.  Or maybe it was just cuz I went on a Saturday night and the small place was way too packed!  

But I do have to say their drinks are pretty good and the prices are not bad also!  This place is known for their cocktails which they make really well but which causes the service to be on the slower side.

Wouldn't mind coming here again but more likely on a weekday so it wouldn't be so crowded and I could actually enjoy the place.
author: Esther S.

description: Hipster Dive bar meets a mixology scene.  Seemed to be an industry hangout to some extent which is a good sign of proper ambience.  Very interesting exterior with it's placement Tenderloin District.  Uber to the place and run inside.  They have great spirits selection and fresh juices versus mixes.  The ice was on point as well with nice chilled glasses used properly with style of drink.  The bartenders were fast, precise, and skilled on ratios and seemed really nice.  Their intuition was potent on reading every customers taste and experience as well as how inebriated they were.  This is a fun place especially if you're staying in Union Square area of sf and even on weekdays you can get a late night drink till 2.  Will visit here more times.
author: Michael O.

description:
This place has a nice dark atmosphere with lots of space, a smoking room, at least two bathrooms, and a pool table. The drinks were ok, but I asked for an AMF and the pretentious bartender gave me tude and told me he could only make me a real drink. Look for other options across the street if you don't want to buy their fancy $10 whiskey drinks.

The bottom line: NOU likes the atmosphere, but no AMF's here
author: Evan L.

description:
The hubs and I stopped here on an impromptu cocktail tour we made up while strolling the city.  We had a great time playing a friendly game of pool while sipping on delicious cocktails.

We will be back.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Loved hitting up this spot for a solid Sunday day drinking session.
