The vibe here is a mix between modern and classic, fancy yet laid-back.  They take their drinks seriously here (a good thing), and you should go out of your way to order something that requires muddling (I just don't use that word often enough) and you can't go wrong.

Particularly tasty is a muddled (see what I mean) drink they do with (if I recall) mint, cucumber, kiwi and gin.  Sounds like an odd-ball combination, but really comes together nicely in a tall glass and is quite refreshing on the occasional hot San Francisco day.
author: Brad P.

description:
After passing the noisy SWIG and dancing floor Ambassador trying to look for a more low key and mature crowd lounge, we settled in at Rye.

Drinks were pretty watery but enough of them will get you there! The brick walls and hard concrete decoration without cushioning means the place does not absorb the noise well... which also means you have to talk in ears most of the time...

Music was kinda "rocking country." Love the other side of the bar where they actually have sofas for people to sit down and chat instead of pure standing room. The cage is definitely for chain smokers who love to have a drink in their hands at the same time...

Also love the fact that there are NO mirrors in the single W room (did not use the others by the bar.) It definitely makes it no lines!
author: T L.

description:
There are tons of reviews about how pretty this place is and how good the drinks are...and yes, the decor IS nice and they DO make a mean dirty martini. 

But I like Rye for the company in the cage. Rye's packed with super friendly, interesting, talkative people.This is not your typical nice-looking, stuffy bar - Everyone mingles!! And they interact with people outside their circle of friends!! And not in a "pick up on you" sort of way. How refreshing!

Life stories and numbers swapped over cigarettes in a human pen...Ah yes, good times.
author: Esme W.

description:
Yes, I work hard and I deserve a drink at a swanky place. 

Right after dinner at Osha, my friends and I came here, we had a few drinks and enjoy the atmosphere and music of this fine looking bar. If this bar was named after a porn star, it would be Jenna Jameson. Very sexy, very erotic, and very classy....well....maybe not so classy. But it is a beautiful bar... and it does serve alcohol and it does make a person feel awesome!
author: Stanley K.

description: As my grandmother always muttered under her breath when she awoke from her alcohol-induced comas: "if you got it flaunt it." Or wait, it might have been: "Life is a gauntlet" ...
author: Joanna M.

description:
I've decided that I can never go to the Tenderloin with another girl.  The last time I did so, a homeless man took a swing at my special lady friend, and we fled in terror.  This particular time, I was accompanied by a male, and the crackheads kept their peace...well, except for this one guy wearing a track suit and big, shiny, 80's sunglasses.   It might have been M.C. Hammer -- what ever happened to that guy, anyway?  Anyway,  he babbled something about how cute we were and how he wanted to come to our wedding:  arguably scarier than the previously attempted battery (let me just insert a lawyerly pet peeve of mine: assault doesn't mean what you think it does, ok?). 

Anyway, all that excitement, and you need a freaking drink.  I liked this bar less and less the more time I spent there.  The decor reminded me of Communist Russia or something, except I'm pretty sure Communists wouldn't tolerate flat tonic.  Also, the cocktail waitress didn't bring me change from the $20 I gave her for two drinks.  Granted, it wouldn't have been much, but you don't just assume you get to keep the difference.  That kind of thing will put you on a hit list.

Just sayin.
author: Alissa K.

description: Great drinks but they take a while to make, kinda pricey but nice cozy place for a weeknight drink, gets to crowded on weekends for me.
author: Danielle A.

description: Went to this bar for a friends birthday .  The decor is nice with a pool table and small area with first come first serve tables. we got to experience their specialty drinks like the cucumber and basil gimlets which were good.
author: Michael T.

description:
This small bar on the corner of Geary at Leavenworth near the original Osha Thai. The bouncers were friendly and let me in fairly quickly as there was no cover nor a huge line. However, there was a long wait for drinks, which were moderately priced, as the bartenders bought my friends and I what we ordered without a hitch.

The place had diverse crowd, with a pool table near the bar, smoking area for my smoker friends, a wine arrangement in the second lounge area, with bricks completing the far right wall.  There was enough room to stand or sit, though we stood as much as we sat that night.  I'd come back here again unless the Tenderloin becomes even less attractive on weekends.
author: Rob L.

description:
Ahh I love Rye, mostly because it's right next to my homegirl Maria's house. Thirty seconds away, no shit! The only times I've been here were during the week (Tuesday or Wednesday) so I've never really encountered any crowds or douchebags. I really like their margaritas. When I go, I usually have the Maria special, a beer (usually Stella) and a shot of tequila. A Chimay and shot of Patron will cost $12.

There's a pool table in there but we didn't get to play last time because it was broken, guh! I like sitting outside in the cage.
author: Tatiana D.

description:
The drinks are AMAZING (that's why they each take a full five minutes to make).  It looks like they have a small farmer's market behind the bar when it comes to their choices of muddle-ables.  

And the scene does absolutely nothing to take away from the joy your drinks will bring you.  It's a chic little place, but really doesn't have any kind of pretentious feel.  After all, you are in the TL and not the Marina.  Down to earth mature crowd.
author: Ann W.

description:
Rye is like a supermodel - fun to look at but lacking substance on the inside.  That is, the design and layout are near perfect, but the people who inhabit the place are a little on the square side for me to want to spend my time here. 

It is beautiful.  The first thing you notice is its big sliding wood front door (though it's stained with a cheesy metal "Rye" on its upper-left).  To the right of the door is a an enclosed semi-outdoor lounge, complete with high tables, soft stools, candles, and a caged wall to shield smokers from passing crackheads.  Its main wall is exposed brick (nice) and they're always projecting Japanimation films over it (cool).  

But thanks to mediocre music and a decidedly business-oriented clientele, even though I live on this block I have little desire to return here.  Those thirty-five year olds in suits already have Swig down the street.  If there was some type of transfusion to replace this crowd with a younger, more casual one, I could enjoy spending money here. 

If you embrace a clean, classy style, you'll love this place.
author: Paul R.

description:
I went here with my man, Joe B., who was looking dapper as usual, and it was a nice change from the previous bar we had just grabbed a drink at.

Rye is classy. Rye is spry...and a good gin drink is the apple of my eye. 

Thanks to Nish to promoting a Damrak mixology contest here, I decided to go. 

I love the bar, very extensive array of fine spirits and clients in even better spirits. And what was even better, the drinks were on the brand! Woo hoo!

As an ex-smoker, I really admired the glass enveloped smoking cage they have created at Rye. It easily gives you access to the street to talk to your friends or enemies who are coming/going as well as provides a hefty set of ghetto bars to keep you safe from the n'er do wells of the TL. 

I especially like the look of the brick wall you can prop yourself up against in your fedora to puff while looking oh-so-cool-and-aloof....as if a basil gimlet never made your taste buds dance like a stripper with ants in her...pants?

It's also breaks up the design of the bar quite well, and kudos to them for having THREE very clean bathrooms in the joint. Did I mention they also had a pool table? 

Douchebags aside, it was nice to be amongst the pretty people for a night with new and exciting drinkies to try.
author: Jessica P.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the city. Good bar, great drinks, you can stand, you can sit, you can smoke. Sometimes it's busy, sometimes it's chill, but it's never a pain in the ass.

Every single drink you get is well-made and tasty. Yeah, it's all trendy to hang out in squalid dive bars these days, but enough already, it's not that bad to go somewhere where the floor is clean and the bartenders are nice and you can get a drink that's not whiskey or a shot of jäger or a PBR. This is the place to go when you're feeling like a grown-up.
author: Jarrod B.

description:
Knocking down 0.5 star. The drinks are still good albeit super small as they have always been. The crowd this time seemed much more Marina-esque than I anticipated.  

Since all the youngens were busy socializing standing up, all the leather couches were open and available. My old ass & feet w/ 4 inch spiky heels require somewhere to sit, so it was nice to have open couches to sit around comfortably. Also, it's much easier to order drinks via cocktail waitress than standing at the bar trying to get the bartender's attention. Next time, I'll go straight to the couch.
author: Nana N.

description:
Been there once and I loved it.

The decor is great (dark, wood, dare I say romantic).  The drinks are quality (I'm a cocktail type of girl).  The bartenders were great - attentive, quick to serve, etc.  The crowd was great also (granted I was there with a large crowd so we kinda stayed to ourselves).

I would suggest for anyone who wants a semi quiet drink at a classy joint.
author: Girls Named Cherise C.

description:
Updated 6.18.07

I'm updating my review because of how cool the staff has been to me for a long time now. We seem to end up here a lot these days, and although it's still kind of a scene, I'm usually here with a good crew and the staff knows me, so they always treat me right. Always a great choice for a happy hour, because Greg and his staff mix the best drinks that won't weigh you down for rest of the night. And seriously, are there more Barneclo's on the wall than I remember?

----
I'm a whiner. Plain and simple. I like what I like and that's pretty much all you'll get from me. So, that said, the bar is beautiful, but it's way to scene-y in here for my tastes. "Look at me, I'm at this hip bar Rye! I saw you here last weekend, did you see me?" Um, yeah. Not my scene. I have to say, the decor was awesome, they have a cool logo, and the Brian Barneclo on the wall is sweet. That and the bartender was nice to me despite the fact that I looked really annoyed and hopped in fresh from a rock show at Bimbo's. She just smiled and gave me a $4 can of Tecate, which was nice. Expensive, but nice.
author: Michael E.

description:
Quite by the progression of things (i.e, my own growing interest in the mixology culture) I have found myself slowing collecting an "imbibed there" list of local joints that cater to the cocktail conneseuir. There are places I have drank, hope to drink and might not ever drink...but hey, a girl can dream right?

I can now add the Rye to my "drank there" category. Expertly mixed cocktails, a friendly staff and a beatnik-esque atmosphere that's perfect for sippin' and vibin'.

Their sazerac is absolutely the best version I have ever had...as some places tend to slack on this particular classic. And their luau drink...complex with a nice balance between the pineapple and bitters.

The outdoor caged area, intended as a  smoker's patio of sorts, was our perch...a sweet spot to watch the passersby and enjoy the cool summer breeze.

I'd give this joint a "high priority status" atop my list of must-drink cocktails in SF and country-wide.
author: Leighann F.

description:
UPDATE: 

Had my birthday party here last night, and boy did Greg L. and Erica do a good job of keeping me liquored up! (I am still sitting home in jammies gulping Emergen-C at 2 pm.) They were amazing to all of us, in fact. A little Erotic City remix on the speakers, love from all my buddies, presents!, and a steady flow of fresh cocktails--damn, I like this 35 years old thing already! 
________________________________________________
My new favorite bar! Dirty martini, cigar, good company, all in a perfectly-sized, warm yet sleek space. The bartender was awesome and most* of the patrons friendly. I think I'll have my birthday party there in a few weeks. 

*there was an older woman holding up the bar when I walked in (I'm not talking Cougar or even Advanced Cougar, I'm talking senior citizen), and I casually said, "How are you doing tonight?" She replied drolly, "Do you really care?" Youch!
author: Gretchen T.

description:
Liked:  the wine bottle lattice wall along the back, the booths, the dark moodiness that makes you want to do things in the corner with someone and the drinks (strong without lacking flavor).  

Really disliked:  the "outdoor" smoking area.  Really just another room... I hate cigarette smoke and felt like I had just stumbled back into the 50s when smoking was cool and second-hand fumes just added to the "ambiance."  Ick.  

I'd have wanted to stay much longer in this cool bar if not for the smokers.
author: Kate M.

description:
If you are from the Yelp crowd Rye seduces you with cocktails better than home.  Mint is yours, bitters, ginger fresh cranberries.  

But let's try Hypnotic instead.  "You will now listen to my voice.  My voice will help you."

From the outside looking in, dark modernism, inside a neighborhood feel.  Black and white, European.  "I will guide you deeper and deeper."

"I say, one."  You are in a semi-enclosed smoking patio, you chill from a warm cage squad cars crawling homeless people bellowing upstreet club kids snacking nextdoor at Osha.  They stare, you stare, each curious for the other side.  "Your hands and your fingers are getting warmer and heavier.  I say, two."

You are playing pool, nice.  You settle into a couch.  The room is dark and inviting but missing something.  Something missing.  You think of home.  Your arms and shoulders begin to feel heavy, you are floating.  "I say, three."

You want something else for the back room.  Where is the interactive sculpture?  The water feature?  Where is the coin-operated mechanical device?  The fortute-telling robot hooker?  Where are the militant robot chicken songs?  You You want something else. 

Your wallet is getting lighter, well-crafted drinks are receding, you did not mean to slosh, did not mean to stay, you came to meet and hang and have one or two after the theater, the show, but now you are immobile on the couch. "Four, your feet and your legs legs get heavier. Five, The warmth is spreading to the whole of your body.  On six, I want you to go deeper.  I say, six."

You will not remember anything else I say.  "Ten you will be in Europa. . . I say, ten."

You are listening to the noise of rain.  You are in NISHmania, the year is 1945.  There is a train, werewolves, Nazis, bombs, blood in a bathtub. . . I want you to wake up when I say. . !

Will somebody call a taxi?

In the morning, the sleeper has found rest on the bottom of the river. The force of the stream has opened the door and is leading you on. Above your body, people are still alive. Follow the river as days pass. Head for the ocean that mirrors the sky. You want to wake up to free yourself of the image of Europa, but it is not possible.

You are in Yelptopia.
author: Gil S.

description:
With a door that could easily be missed, this Tenderloin spot is a sultry lounge, perfect for a cocktail and intimate conversation.

I've wanted to visit Rye for quite some time, and last night a few us of ventured out here to give it a shot. After reading the numerous reviews, I knew I couldn't just get a beer, so I ordered one of their signature cocktails. The 'Blue Moon' was a magnificent gin infused cocktail, that went down easy and dropped my body into a comfortable slump.

Rye has a hip, urban feel with a sensual undertone. It's dark, candle lit, and has private seating arrangements for you and your significant other.

Great place for drinks after that first date.
author: Mike K.

description:
Positioned in an area where there are several trendy bars nearby (Ambassador, Swig, Bourbon & Branch), Rye has a lot of competition.  But they live up to it with their friendly bartenders, their innovative drinks (basil gimlet, anyone?) and their chill atmosphere.  I like the fact that they have an outdoor patio, although it was a little chilly for me to go out there the other night!  The layout is a bit odd - not necessarily in a bad way, but it's a bit disconnected with the bar on one side, seating on the other.  Although I suppose this is a plus for some people who want to be away from some of the craziness that surrounds the bar.  

My one complaint is that I wish there was more seating.  The pool table is cool but it didn't seem like too many people were interested in it when I was there...and it is prime space for people to chill with their drinks.
author: Melanie N.

description:
There will be NO pictures posted!
I thoroughly enjoyed myself at Rye last night.  I had the "whatever he's/she's having" cocktail. Planted my ass in front of Miss Barista extraordinaire  and drank every delectable cocktail under the sun. Miss Sunshine, at Rye, I forget her name, made me a gin cocktail with cucumbers, strawberries and champagne. Best damn cocktail I EVER had. I always had the misconception that gin was reserved for old white dudes giving mustache rides. Rye changed all that last night.

After torturing Miss Barista Sunshine at Rye, I made my way (stumbled) to Cantina where the bartender was a real (rhymes with kunt) and threw back a few more, IMO depressing cocktails. I should've patronized the yummy asian bartender instead of the "bitch from hell" that was serving us. Yes, I know they pull tips but something tells me the asian dude would've upped my Cantina experience.

Oh well, moving on.  I end up at Dog knows where bar next, and the rest is His Story. I wake up this morning and my lip, nose is busted. My front tooth chipped, hence the "no pictures being posted". My girlfriend tells me I was so belligerently trashed that I tripped over my own foot and faceplanted into the sidewalk, stumbling back to the hotel.  I will post my only recognizable picture from Rye when I get home, BUT the rest of my trip will be photoshopped. Thank you Miss Barista Sunshine for starting my trip off with a Bang. I need to find a cosmetic dentist and an AA sponsor, pronto.

I
author: Love S.

description:
This bar made me really really like The Smiths.  They play goodmusic on the iPod and the fruit muddled (a popular thing in S.F.) drinks were the bomb...and,uh,the bartender forgot to charge us for the 2nd drink we ordered. LOL
Swanky and Sleek interior - its fun to sit at the bar so you can see how the drinks are made.  The bartenders must have great arm muscles from all the muddeling they do on a nightly basis ; )
author: Katie M.

description:
Great for socializing and drinking refreshing cocktails. The bar staff made amazing fresh fruit drinks. Fresh strawberries, orange, lime, cucumber.... you name it and they got it! 

Oh and one of the bar tenders made this absolutely delicious blood orange cocktail mixed with Patrone tequila and jalapeno syrup. It sounds funky but it was amazing! 

The only negative with this spot is that the drinks are not strong but they are ultra yummy!
author: Lenee F.

description:
Ok, so I've met the owners here and they are great guys. I love the look of their bar and their drink menu but last night was a deal breaker for me. I had, in my opinion, one of the worst bartenders EVER! She was slow, overheard people complaining and lashed out at them with rude comments, and focused on one area of the bar while a group of us waited for 15-20 minutes for a drink! 

Why only 2 bartenders on a Friday night? 

One of the worst experiences with a bartender since my move here 2 years ago.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Very chill place to get a cocktail in the TL. The dark and sexy decor with it's simple exposed brick, caged wine racks, and Upper Playground-ish art make for confortable lounging with friends.

Whiskey is the libation of choice, but they also have a creative cocktail menu mixing classics (sazerac, manhattan, and sidecars) with more contemporary drinks mixing fresh juices with the likes of absinthe, red bull, and basil.

Extra points for being right next to OSHA Thai for those after drinking noodles, always a good idea at th time, but will kill you in the morning!
author: Mike T.

description: Cool place. Stopped by here after bourbon and branch. The barkeeper was really nice and informative.
author: Paul O.

description:
What a great hidden gem! If it wasn't for the location I'd be all over it all the time. Rye has great drinks and great staff. The location is in the TL so the neighborhood is a little sketchy. But the space and the design of Rye is really nice. It's sleek and simple, they also have a pool table in the back which I thought was cool. 

I'm a fan of Rye for a few reasons. 
1. They make their drinks with fresh ingredients (no sweet and sour mix for your whiskey sours kiddos!) 
2. You can come in dressed up or dressed down, either way you're good to go!
3. I would definitely come in on a weekday to insure seating and great service.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I am seriously in love with this place. Have been here several times, both for happy hour and late night. Not in the best 'hood, but it is so worth the trek. The crowd is always chill - not too pretentious or obnoxious. The bar is always packed, but you never wait too long for a drink. The smoking cage outside is kind of like a patio and always a good time. I've been out there several times and been solicited by a variety of crackheads. Pretty entertaining. Free pool, cute little lounge tables, friendly bartenders and great overall ambiance. 

The reason I love Rye so much? The Basil Gimlet. It's seriously the best martini ever. I have dreams about this drink. My mouth is watering as I speak of it.  You choose your poison: vodka or gin and then watch the 'tender muddle it up with basil, sugar, yada yada. Served up with leaves of basil garnish - it's a little taste of heaven. If I had my choice, I'd choose death by basil gimlet. Umm.
author: Jenny S.

description:
My "new" family the Poleng crew took me out to show the night in the city. I've been wanting to come to this place as I heard that they have the bartending competition and their great mixology.

It's really cool inside. For that small place, they have managed to put a pool table. This bar really reminded me of a bar called Prison in Shizuoka, Japan. The wires, the concrete, cool interior.

The mixology and Miss Amanda. Damn. I'm ashamed as a bartender that the half of the ingredients on the menu i didn't know. Amanda used to be our St. Germain rep, and I never knew that she was such a great mixologist. Yes like so many other people mentioned, the Basil gimlet is fucking delicious.

She made us a soon to be on the menu her creation with muddled cherries, spiced rum, apricot liqueur, coffee with coconut milk and egg white foam on top. It was mind blowing. I would say it was definitely a dessert drink after dinner, but the care and the mixology she showed me there took my understanding of bartending to another level.

She's there on Tue and Sat, so go see her! This was fo sho a San Francisco experience I moved all the way from LA here for.
author: Kokoro I.

description:
Why anyone would give this place more than 1 star is beyond me.  

1) I`ll start off with the one good thing about this place...THE FLASH.  Order this drink!  This brings us to number 2....

2) ...expect at minimum a 10 min wait to place your order.  Unless you are 'boys' with the bartender (which means you are probably hipster-skater- punk) I wouldn't expect to get acknowledged very quickly.   I understand the whole  "good drinks take time" thing (I'm in the business), but the difference between muddling and preparing a fresh cocktail with urgency, and taking your sweet-ass time because this is your first bartending job and now you're the cool kid, is what brings me to point #3...

3)...THE BARTENDERS SUCK!  My worst pet peeve are slow bartenders who don't work with any sense of urgency, especially when its busy.  Rye seems to have a knack for hiring non-experienced bartenders who'd rather do shots behind the bar and talk to their friends than wait on the guests and make $$.  I have been at least 5 times, and it seems to get worse and worse.   (The last time, the bartenders were too busy talking about who was gonna leave to score some coke across the street than to serve anyone).  

4) Too small- especially when you walk in.  Then, there is only about 10 tables and the 'cage' smoking area that gets so packed you'd think you were in a cage.

**Overall, I would only recommend this place for one thing and one thing only....THE FLASH!!
author: Steve M.

description:
Hands down my favorite bar in SF! I just can't say enough about Rye, my home away from home! I just LOVE Amanda, Jon, Jen and all the rest of incredible and uber-friendly staff. I hosted a large party here last year and they were all so cool and helpful during the whole process, which really helped to ease some of the stress... 

Rye is a beautiful, well designed bar without all the pretentiousness that typically goes along with this type of venue - it's a breath of fresh air! 

The drinks speak for themselves, but a favorite is always the Pearl, it's unlike anything else I've ever tried and won't let you down either. 

NOTE: Best nights are during the week, Rye gets too crowded late night on the weekends.
author: Hazel Grace D.

description:
Yeah! Another new and cool bar in my hood. The guys (from 15 Rommolo and Rosewood) have done it again, and turned an old dump into a hip new "Cocktail" lounge, where the emphasis is on the cocktails! 
I'll be spending quite a bit of time in here!
author: Jason D.

description:
I love Rye, this place is the bar-version of a good sushi restaurant. The bartender has it all laid out - the booze, the bitters, the fruit all cut up and ready, and the simple syrup handy in a bottle. All they have to do is mix it up, crush it a little. Also if you don't know what you want, you just let them know you'd like a surprise and bam, there it is. They usually get it right.

Pretty much quick cocktail making in an artform. Plus these are the funnest and the most down to earth, coolest bartenders in the city. Clean bathrooms, separate smoking room, chic decor, and really one of a kind cocktail menu. If you want to drink a gin and tonic... go elsewhere. You come here for a different experience - and although CLASSY and a bit on the pricier side, there is nothing unapproachable or pretentious about this place. And for what it is - a cocktail lounge - this place is chill and a good gathering place for ALL kinds of people. Don't expect music and dancing, don't expect trendy or hip. It is what it is and a good one at that.
author: Y K.

description:
hot..literally...they have no ventilation...but...sheesh....turn on the a/c or a fan..it was sweaty and crowded in this place...and can we agree that they have the slowest bartenders ever....20 minutes for a drink...that is way too long..i gotta double fist to keep my buzz going...avoid on busy hot days....

but i should add that they serve up some interesting house cocktails....blackberry lemon drop, basil gimlet, apple bomb, etc....but maybe it's because these drinks take so much time to make that the wait is so long...

maybe worth a visit on a cool day..when it's not so crowded and a sauna....it's a definite hit or miss depending on the evening you visit....maybe on a slower tuesday or wednesday night..it would have been better
author: Hen A.

description:
I was up in SanFran for 4 days for a friend's birthday. We stopped by this place on two different nights as we were making the rounds. The 1st night was a Thursday and we didn't get there until after 10pm. The place was pretty quiet, but that was ok since it allowed us all to catch up. The drinks we had that night were really good. The 2nd time we stopped in was a Saturday night and the place was packed out, but we had to come back for some great drinks.

The vibe in here is really cool. The bartenders here are true mixologists. I can't even name all the crazy concoctions we had. Some of them had raw egg whites in them. So like any great bar with a master mixologist working at it I said, "I have strange mixed taste for either good rum or good scotch." That's all I had to say and he proceeded to whip up some mind boggling drink with 5 different rums in it. It was really good... A+
author: Scottie V.

description:
I love a Manhattan.  I didn't know a Manhattan made with Rye until fairly recently.  I still love me some bourbon but a Manhattan with some rye is also on my favorite drink list.

Last night we entered Rye for a drink after dinner next door at Osha Thai Noodle House and before Kiki and Herb at the A.C.T.  We snagged a seat the at the bar after ogling over the smoking cage.  Unfortunately the Fire Marshal was also eying the cage as we walked in.  As we were deciding what to order and how many, he was grilling the poor bartenders about the exit sign to the street in the cage and why the door was not unlocked during business hours.  Nervousness passed through the place by all who were on staff at the moment.  They quickly unlocked the cage door and the fire marshal left.

The bartender regained her composure, took our order and served up a perfect rye Manhattan and a Flash with lots of kiwi and a refreshing cucumber garnish.  On top of it all she only charged us happy hour prices!  What a gal!
author: Tracy A.

description:
Why would you spend $2-5 for a round of pool when you can play here for free on a ghetto pool table, balls missing, no 8 ball, and a cardboard box  on the bottom catching the balls?  

This is not a dive bar, but it's my dive bar (does that make sense?).  Drinks are pricey, but order the $9 Basil Gimlet and it makes it all worth it.  It's the most delicious drink I've ever had.  It's perfect and I start buzzing off of 2.  The hispanic bartender is nice and lets me eat the mini blood oranges on top of the bar.  The music is good, the drinks are delicious, the patrons are mixed, and the bartenders are sweet.
author: Nezza F.

description: Great place to get drinks at, service is fast, the staff is extremely friendly. There is also a pool table in the back. The atmosphere is really chill, you don't feel like you are at loud crazy club.
author: Anthony V.

description:
I came here on a Thursday and the place was really chill and had seating.  The drinks are a bit pricey but SF reasonable and really tasty. They had some unique drinks which were fun and interesting but took a long time to make.

There were really long waits for the drinks -- but they were worth it.  If the drinks came out faster it would have been a 5 star night for me.  The decor is nice and surprisingly not too loud.  Oh, do NOT order the Pisco Sour.  I enjoyed all their other drinks, but this was piss-co.  Yek.

Bonus is that it's next to Osha's :)
author: Van W.

description:
My first experience here was quite an extraordinary one!

My night started out with my friend joining me from Grand Rapids, MI. I wanted to show him a good time so we joined up with some friends of mine on a bar crawl to a few bars that I hadn't been to before. 

This was the second bar we ended up going to. The vibe walking into to it on a Friday night was very welcoming. The bar and the decor is fairly simple and classy.  Prior to approaching the quite busy bar, I had a slight apprehension of what the service was going to be like; which to my surprise the service was some of the best I've had in the city. Because of such great atmosphere and service we ended up canceling our bar crawl with friends and staying here till last call.

I'd recommend this bar and atmosphere to anyone that is visiting or a local looking to have a great evening out.
author: Peter S.

description: Bumping my review up to a fourth star for customer service! Someone from Rye took the time to message me back and offered to buy me a drink. Its refreshing to see people who care so much about their craft! Bravo!
author: Myles T.

description:
Free billiard table (I'm so much better when the table's smaller!), average priced, fantasic tasting cocktails, and next to the horrible service but cheap & delicious OSHA. 

And, the bartender caught me before I walked out the door without my credit card. Two thumbs up.
author: erica d.

description: Rye is one of the few bars I keep coming back to when I need to entertain some folks.  The vibe is quite laid back and not overly stimulating.  It's usually pretty easy to get into and it's open every day of the week (this is important when you need to get your Sunday drink on).  It's usually pretty easy to get in and find a comfortable spot.  There's a small smoking patio as well.  It can take a while to get a drink and the cocktails are a bit small, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you're racing to get anywhere or racing to get hammered.  Females particularly like the Basil Gimlet ;)
author: Vu N.

description:
Stopped by this arty yet subtle bar today and had one of the bartender's specialties...a honeydew melon and orange bitter something or other thingmajiggy and YUM. Seems like the kind of bar I would call mine if it were in LA, but alas as a mere tourist in the big city of steep hills and fast walking people I will just have to cherish the memory and the slight buzz that came with my visit :)

If you are near here though, I highly recommend stopping in and having them whip you up a special drink!!

Enjoy!
author: Stephy S.

description:
Great place to hang out.  The "cage" section is great because you can get fresh air in there when the bar gets too hot.

Reduced-size pool table in the back, and lounge areas behind the bar give this place enough room to move around and scope things out, or to sit down and kick it with friends and new acquaintances.

Plus, Rye is located in an area where if you want to explore other bars in the neighborhood you can always walk down Geary and find a number of decent places to check out.

+1 star for generally having better patrons than other city bars
+1 star for the fresh-air access in the "cage"
+1 star for being well-staffed
-1 star for one smart-ass bartender chick who thought she was being funny by insulting me
+2 stars because the rest of the staff made up for it by being professional and friendly.
author: Justin C.

description: Fast, hard-working bar tenders who know their whiskeys and cocktails. Great selection of brown party liquors and an awesome atmosphere!
author: Jon M.

description:
I love Jen... she is the bartender... and a friend.

I just don't see how the SAME place keeps opening all over town. Yes, it is kinda nice. Yes, you have an all-high-end selection of booze.  But what gives with this and other places. There is nothing special about them at all.  Take away the funky chairs and you have nothing.

I love Jen... she is the bartender... and a friend.

P.S. This is the first place where I heard the bartender say to another "your music is so bad it was yelped!" Nice.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Great modern clean design.

Everytime I have been there the crowd has been different.

Basil gimlet...  Nuff said...
author: Aldrin S.

description:
I kinda wish we could have come here earlier.  

Really neat feel to the place.  I was pretty drunk so that could have had something to do with it...

I really liked the...what were those?  couches?  i don't know, but I seem to remember it was nice and comfy and I was seated next to or facing all the people I was with.  Was there a beer table in front of us too?  yes, and i think I love that!

The bathrooms were rather nice if I do recall correctly?  And there was an outdoor patio thingy where you could smoke (and i'm not entirely sure here) and drink at the same time...until you die from it...but yah.  I didn't utilize this feature.  Probably cause I was the only dirty lung there and felt weird for smoking alone?  I don't know.

I would like to go here again. 

I don't remember much about the other patrons...I was pretty saucy at this point and in my own little drunken vortex.  So I will say they were good.
author: desiree n.

description:
I hit up this bar right after work with a friend.  It was about 6 o'clock so it had just opened and the bartender was still setting everything up.  We sat down, told him our poison of choice and that we don't like "fruity" drinks, and he suggested drinks for both of us that ended up being right on point and delicious!  I'm actually going back here tonight and I'm really excited.  Last time I told the bartender that I like champagne and he made this really cool cocktail with champagne called the pearl.  Hopefully they still have it!
Update: they DO still have this drink and it's now a permanent fixture on the menu! Thank you, bar genius!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I only go to Rye when it is empty. 
This is why it is getting 4 stars. My reviews lean heavy on what kind of crowd populates a spot and I don't really like the crowds that end up here. 
But I do like the drinks and the decor and the bartenders. 
So when the bar is open just for me and my guests it is awesome. 
Try the Flash or the new drink with kumquats in it oh that was really good. How did they know I like kumquats?
author: Melissa H.

description:
I literally live right across the street from this place, and each time I go there, I really hope it will be a better experience.  I really want to like that place, but it's all for not.  First, although the bar may not be busy, you'll have to wait a REALLY long time for your drink.  Secondary to this, the drinks aren't that good.  That being said, I'm a gin martini guy, so I have a certain way I want my drink.  If you want to wait, and have a good atmosphere, but a better drink, go across the street to Ambassador.  You may enjoy Rye more if you want to smoke in a cage like a trapped monkey, but that's your choice.

EDIT:  Since my last review, this place has become worse.  Not only do you have to beg for a drink, (in spite of no one being around), but the vermouth in the martinis are so strong it makes it not worth it.  

Tip for the bartender: When in doubt, take the time to chat with your friends on your own time, we're here to drink.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Friendly bouncer. Tasty cocktails. Chill ambiance.

The guy manning the door greeted every one of us with a smile. He kindly asked me if the two people walking towards him were the friends I was waiting for. He shared a joke with us before wishing us a good night inside.

The Basil Gimlet is refreshing, tart and not stuffy or fake-tasting like some cocktails can get when they've been mixed with sugar water. The Strawberry lemon drop (because they ran out of blackberries) was sweet, delicious to sip on and made differently, depending on which bartender serves you. I like this. The first lemon drop had a sliver of strawberry garnish, the second lemon drop had a light fruity foam. Both so good.

Want to hang out at a bar that exudes trendiness but doesn't reek of snobs or creeps? Come enjoy Rye. It gets crowded, so they must be doing everything right. Watch out for Miss Cue-Stick-happy though; gf almost wiped me and my friends out when she was playing pool. Apparently she thought she had free range of the pool table area, and all of the surrounding chairs and wall space around it...
author: Megan L.

description:
It's hard to review a bar when you have only been there on Saturday night. I mean, even good bars suck on Saturday night. They're all too crowded, and you have to make threats or put some appealing body part on the bar in order to get the bartender's attention and get a drink. But, I was only there on Satuday night, so here goes.

They do have a good selection of rye, which gets them three stars. I like me my whiskey, and anyone who has a decent selection will get some props.

I suppose the decor is nice, in a generic, Scandinavian-esque sort of way. Personally, I like my bars a little warmer and cozier. But whatever; that's a personal preference. There was a neat chalkboard art-mosaic thing in the back. If you know who did it, drop me a line; I'd like to commission a mural for my apartment (don't tell the landlord).

The people were pretty much standard Tendernob weekend bar people - Marina-ers slumming, it looked like mostly. (If you've ever been to a bar in the Marina, you'll know why they come down here.) That's OK; not my crowd, personally, but OK. The music wasn't bad, but no one was dancing (except us, a little).

I did have a major problem with the fact that when we set our half-finished drinks down for ten seconds on the side of the pool table (which no one was using), a barback swooped in and took them away. (Aside: I HATE overzealous cleanup people. What is wrong with them? Can't they ask "are you finished" before taking my food and drink away? I mean, if there's still some left, don't assume I'm done just because I'm not talking with my mouth full. Jeez.) They did give us a free replacement drink, but we had to wade through about 917 people to get to the bar to get it.

Overall, I prefer Whiskey Thieves. Or Hemlock Tavern.
author: Mark G.

description:
I feel like I am in a back alley of London when I go here.  I barely found this place the first time... black door with small black letters - am I hip enough to slip inside?
I will drink your basil gimlet anytime - I love the brazen use of crushed kiwi and cucumber in your cocktails.
Forgive, but what is with the 'boy's club' smoking area on the balcony?  This wouldn't come to my attention if the door remained closed, and the smoke stayed outside.  Haven't we collectively realized that second-hand smoke is dangerous & that smoking isn't cool anymore?
author: Katie H.

description:
Beautiful decor.... and *very* well crafted cocktails.  so far this has been the place to break my wine-only alcohol-fast.  i had a sip of my friend's personal request for an "orange mojito" and i was sold.

We went early, so it was mellow enough and delightfully devoid of the abnoxious crowds that other folks alluded to!
author: lulu p.

description:
Thanks grandpa Nish for introducing me to this fantastic establishment! I love the decor, the bartenders kick ass and the drinks are superb!

A special thanks to the blonde bar tender(whose name escapes me) for the "amore" drink you created especially for me!
author: erica c.

description:
A fantastically intimate feel without being teenie.  

Mood lighting to make you wanna settle up next to some delicious cutie.

Potent and creative cocktails ... to the tune of Strawberry Blonde -- muddled strawberries in a mixture of gin and somethin' fizzy.  I think I capped out at 6???

Plenty of booths, couches, loungey sitting shtuff to get cozy, next to said delicious cutie ... or good friends -- whatever your poison.

Not feeling like socializing around the couches or the bar?  Not a problem, grab a stick and hit some balls.  What did she say???...  I said play some pool at their table situated just behind the bar.  Dirty little mind, you ...
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
I came here for a bday get-together on Saturday night, and overall the venue was decent (though I didn't really roam around all that much).  

I like that it wasn't that stupidly packed, and the ambience was very laid back.  It was a good place to chat with folks, and the price of drinks are par for the course (2 drinks = $14-$16).

If you're not in the mood for dancing or madness, this is a nice place to go.  Or if you're in the mood for dancing or madness, just get more drunk than I was.
author: Shay F.

description:
My roommate is a bartender here, so I may be a little bit biased but I swear I would love this place even if  that weren't the case.

This review is strictly for the drinks. I can't say enough about their drinks! So amazingly tasty! They use all fresh ingredients and prepare each drink from scratch right before your eyes. I'm talking strawberries, blueberries, cucumber, rosewater, basil, lemon, etc... Just unique and really, really yummy!

They also have a free pool table and plenty of spots for sitting down. Great place to start off the night (and ambassador is right across the street!)
author: Summer E.

description:
Any bar that is not afraid to use egg whites in a drink gets a hearty thumbs up! 

I was handed a champagne flute and told to drink it without much in the way of explanation. What I had was one of the best champagne cocktails ever made. It had an essence of strawberries (but not sweet) and a nice floater of meringue on top. I think this could almost qualify as healthy.

The bar itself was not hard to find, but figuring out how to get in wasn't so obvious. The patio is surrounded by a cage, which has the immediate effect of making you want to get inside the bar right now! But the unmarked door, that looks more like a plate glass window, takes a certain amount of faith to try to open. 

The decor is very Hotel-Bar 2006 Chic. Dark walls, clean lines, a lone vase full of pussy willows (I guess they are a conversation starter) coupled with the dim lighting and moody music, make this bar a fabulous place to get together with friends for a few healthy cocktails.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I can see why this is a Yelp favorite.

The dark of the space is welcoming in the way that all hip bars should be.  

There was just a hint of ambiant light around the edges, as it should be.

The champagne was wonderful, as it should be -- cold and bubbly... as I am the girl that I am I don't really recall if the prices were reasonable, as I don't recall paying for a round.  ;)

Interesting, cool to talk to assortment of individuals - granted, many were fellow Yelpers (so it doesn't seem fair to give a review of how cool the people are who hang there, as it would appear that the cool decks were stacked in Rye's favor this particular Monday...)

Fun night.
Glad I went.
Props to Nish for the recommendation.
author: Kate R.

description:
Basil.  Gimlet.

I yelp'd this place before I went and was reminded over and over of how awesome the basil gimlet was.  Since my go-to drink at all the bars is a gimlet (gin, please) I was all over this and it was what I started off with.  Awesomely mixed, great taste.. I switched between this and a Pimm's Cup (also mixed well.. yummy with the extra pieces of cucumber floating through).  

Four drinks in and on an empty stomach, I make my way home to my boyfriend where we go to Blockbuster and I proceed to embarrass him by practically running into people and calling his name from across the store.  Lunch probably would've been a good idea.
author: Dianne d.

description:
fabulous cocktails! Yum :)

Basil martini rocks!

super cute decor.

nuff said
author: Piper D.

description:
Rye is very classy, except for the fact that it's in the tenderloin. I love the sexy interior and the candles on the table add a great touch. I don't smoke but I do like that they give smokers a smoking room. 

Never had a bad drink here (which is uncommon for me to say).. I LOVE LOVE LOVE the basil gimlet here and it's been a while so I may have to stop in soon. Second fave drink here is the mojito.. which they create with perfection.

When it comes to my dirty martinis I'm very particular, until about the fourth.. but the bartenders here have never never let me down. Very rarely do I have a dirty martini night, as all of my friends know happens after a few (I'll keep that to myself). I feel one of those nights coming on...

Minus one star for how crowded it tends to get and seems to be difficult to get a drink at times. Also, not a huge fan of the hipster crowd that flocks here.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Like this place needs another review. 

So this was the third (and last because after drinking at two other spots trying everything on the drink menu it was time to stop or head to SF General for a good old stomach pumping, you remember those days in college) stop in my odyssey to find that great bar and perfect drink. 

Well this place came mighty close to great bar and perfect drink. The Manhattans I ordered came out cold, crisp and packed with bourbon flavor like they are meant to be, best of all they passed the cherry test with brandied cherries. 

So skip the other two place (Piso and Brick) and just head here, order a drink and then order another.

Cheers
author: G R.

description:
A great place, especially for the aesthetically crippled. Flattering low-watt light bulbs hide imperfections better than a hijab. And the cocktails are unequivocally some of the best in the city. Mix liquor with good lighting and get laid.


Ok seriously. I like the place. You really should too.
author: Michael P.

description:
As a gay guy I seldom hit up the lounges and clubs that cater to the heterosexual audience. But my close friend and I had talked about going to some of the places in the TL and long behold his boyfriend, accompanied by one of his home girls , meet us later in the evening while in Castro and proposed that we all head out to Rye.

"Like the bread?" I think to myself...."Are we going to dinner?"
After learning about it we head there. A straight bar....perfect for anthropological study.

The club entrance right next to Osha Thai Noodle Cafe (See my review Haiku) is easily missed. Once inside though, you're treated to excellent wooden and metal visuals, a pool table and a second room in which you can chill and socialize in. What really kicks ass is the Prison of a smoking area that is to the right of the bar. I really thought it was interesting if not innovative for a lounge. 

But nothing is ever perfect, such is the state of this part of my review. I have to say that for how small it is, they could have used the space better. One Bar? Is that even a concept anymore? And to top it off I am a beer drinker, true beer consumers get their beers from the tap...Rye has none on tap...perhaps I was seeing things...simply odd. That being said...those two things knocked this potential 5 star establishment down to a 3 star semi disappointment.
author: James J.

description:
This place is legit...what a talented group of bartenders. I don't know shit about making drinks but these guys were peeling fruits and lighting things on fire and seriously created the most delicious blend of cocktails I've had in awhile.

Try the "Joy Division" (yes I ordered it just because I love the band) it's smoky strong and very tasty :)

Oh and on top of that, they're all really nice here. Awesome place!
author: Angela G.

description:
I'm not gonna lie.  I had higher expectations...perhaps it was an off night, or perhaps I should have napped before going out.  Maybe I was a bit on edge due to my handsome, witty date.  

Or maybe *just maybe* everyone and their brother was yelping their sexy heads off and the bar has not-so-accomodating acoustics. (I was there the night of the Yelp Love,Janis post-party.)

Also, I left smelling like cigarette smoke.  I hate that, especially because I don't smoke.  And I sat inside the whole time.  

I will say that, yes, I like the wall of wine and the bartenders were friendly and quick.  But the atmosphere bugged me.  The lightning by the bar was odd; off-balanced maybe?   In fact, the first words out of both mine and my friend's mouths (simultaneously) were "This place is strange."

I feel that this place deserves another chance, maybe on a more low key night.

UPDATE:  I came back last night (a Wednesday) and it was a much better scene.  Add one more star.
author: Beth G.

description: I love this place. This was my first stop on a recent Saturday night and I could have chilled here all night.  My girls and I enjoyed Cava by the glass in style while kickin' back to observe and murmur about.... what appeared to be... some kind of mysterious mustache party goin' on.  We were intrigued and strangely attracted to these fellows.  I was curious to notice at least two faux stashes... then witnessed one guy drawing one on (I gotta great pic of it) which confirmed my suspicion.  I am now creeped out by my dreams of these stashes.
author: Kerrie T.

description: omg!!! i love the basil gimlets here!!! I think i've been here five times already and even though they are 10 dollars each. uhhh... they are pretty strong so it's not like you're getting watered down drinks or badly made drinks at crappy bars . They definitely know how to make drinks right and it kind of reminds me of the speakeasy bars in ny except not as secretive. I wish sf had more speakeasy bars. :'(
author: Regina L.

description:
Ooh, I get to review a place the ubiquitous Aunny D of Yelpdom has visited.

So after drinks at one place, and another place, I ended up here.  I was just feeling like good ol' beer at this point, and by golly, that's just what I had.  Chimay Red to be specific. The "red" enticed me.  The "chimay" did nothing for me.  Anyway, it was alright.   Good enough to have two or three rounds.  

Througout the course of the stay, I tried a fancy cucumber drink.  A quick "command-f" tells me it was the Cucumber Basil Gimlet.  It was...cucumbery.  

The pool table in the back has enough space around it to not feel cramped.  The sideroom lent itself nicely to an alcohol-driven myspace photoshoot. Oh god, what was I thinking.  

It's a a real clean, modern looking establishment. Come closing time, the staff sure does rush you out, as expected. So if you're downtown looking for a bar, this one is a-ok.
author: Charles R.

description: Went on a Tuesday night bc ambassador was packed.... One man bar.. Wait no there's another female bartender who's trying to get laid so.... We all know the rest of this story...hmmm
author: Candace N.

description: The drinks were amazing and for me a bit on the strong side. The bartenders were very friendly and even replaced my drink after I accidentally knocked it off the table.
author: Lidia Z.

description:
Last March, while traveling cognito, I stumbled into this bar at a godly hour with a number of savory characters at my side. Knowing nothing of this bar previously, I walked through the door to find a sleek, kempt bar, filled with a shevelled, descript and ruly crowd.

Plussed, I went straight to the sipidly-adorned bar and found a wieldy selection of drinks on the menu. The bartenders were completely ept, and attentively treated everyone as persona grata. While drinking this good might be beknownst to many San Franciscans, it was new hat to me.

Over the next few weeks and months, I was communicado with everyone I knew, making many promptu plans to return to Rye. I managed to abuse everyone I knew of the notion that this is my one of my favorite bars in the city. As the the 166 other reviews can attest, this is one of the sung heros of the city, with many other gruntled reviewers having strong givings about having been here.

Highly recommended.
(Hat tip: Jack Winter, The New Yorker)
author: james s.

description:
Nice place to feel caged in.

Service caters to the collared suited elite. Expect to wait for your suds if you don't fit the mold. The smoker's section is the perfect summation: you try to ignore everyone else's small talk about I.T., sales and timeshares, while you exchange pithy glances with the sans-home folk who congregate outside the steel bars. Think San Quentin with a complex.
author: Chris R.

description: These bartenders definitely know what they're doing.  The patio is awesome because it faces the street so you can see all the people walking by.  Go on a week night and they have a pool table
author: C S.

description: This place isn't too bad, wasn't busy at all on a friday night. The inside is not as nice as it seems from the outside. It has one pool table, which is weird, I think placing more tables and chairs would be a better idea. It's very dark and hard to pick out. Decent service though
author: Phan H.

description:
At more than one point during my visit to Rye I fought the urge to throw the two-finger-eye-to-eye sign.  

I restrained myself then, but I'll do it here, now, in words.  You and me, Rye.  You and me.
author: L W.

description:
I've only been here once, so that 5th star there is on spec.  But the drinks are solid, they know what they're doing, and they apologized for the crappy music that some party was playing off their iPod.  Not too crowded at 7:30pm on a Saturday night -- it got moreso by 10:30ish, when we left; but still nowhere near the crowd I'd expected, given these reviews.

Their house Manhattan: Rittenhouse [80, the default]; Noilly Prat; Angostoura bitters.  Sweeter vermouth than I'm used to, but it works.  And, having conversed with the bartender about various proofs of ryes and gins, when I asked for whatever martini he wanted to make me with Old Raj 100, I got a fabulously smooth cocktail, with a twist.  Heaven.  One of the top two martinis I've ever had.

I'm adding this to my list of Nice Places To Get Good Cocktails Made By People Who Actually Care.  Yum.
author: Nori H.

description:
What's so great about this place?  I think these reviews are biased since a Yelp party was hosted here.  Anyway, it was really warm in there so we had to go back to our cars and leave our coats.  And the first bartender was a little weird.  We asked if they had watermelon pucker and he said, no but we have fresh honeydew melon.  Weird.  So I got a melon mojito kinda drink.  And it was pretty good, but bitter towards the end.  He seemed new to the whole mashing process.

**Anyway, we switched to a girl bartender later and she only charged us $7 each for our drinks, the same drinks we'd been ordering from the guy but he was charging us $8.  What's up with that?  That's just wrong.**

***correction/update:  although i haven't returned since my last review, i feel it's fair to post an update.  i got feedback from two guys at rye (including the first bartender) and apparently i misunderstood the pricing.  specialty drinks are $9 and regular drinks like a vodka tonic are $7.  so for our first order, it was $9 + $7, so i just assumed it was $8 each.  and then later we all got $7 drinks, so that's where the confusion stemmed from.***

Decor was nice but the bar itself was ehh.  Nice that it's right next door to Osha Thai.  Very convenient.

***further update: went back to give rye a second shot.  the place was still super hot inside even with the doors left open.  they need some ventiliation or fans in there, it's disgusting.  and oh my gosh, aside from marina house parties, i've never seen so many popped collars, i kid you not.  it was a laugh and three-quarters.  and as for the drinks, they were good.  but not good enough to keep me coming back for more until they fix the air circulation issue in there.

and oh, they definitely need to cordon off a section of the bar that's specifically meant for people to order drinks.  i mean, this is supposed to be a bar, right?  the people who were sipping their drinks at the bar and not letting anyone else get close enough to order a drink were pissing me off, and i mean pissing me off.  and that's serious.***
author: spiff e.

description:
Rye is what LA bars wanna be.  Seriously!  In LA, drinks are $11-12 dollars and are simple mixes of liquors with maybe a muddle of mint.  HERE, they take their drinks seriously.  They have fresh kiwis, blueberries, blackberries, cranberries, lemon, lime, mint, basil, cucumber, and various other things I can't remember.  And they don't screw around with simple vodka drinks.  They use every kind of alcohol and pair them perfectly with muddled fruit.  And at $8 a drink, you don't feel like you're being taken.

The ambience is nice, the bartenders are friendly as can be, and one even gave me advice on making my own lemongrass simple syrup at home.

Rye is what other bars should aspire to be.  Yay Rye.
author: Sara L.

description:
Rye has definitely benefited from Ambassador being across the street. I've been here a few times before Ambassador opened up and the place was always quiet and empty. It was a great small cool little local spot to grab a drink in a very trendy atmosphere, definitely a chill spot. Last night was a whole different story. The place was packed, there was a doorman, music blasting, great crowd.....I was definitely impressed with the turn around. 

With Rye, Ambassador and Osha within 20 feet of each other, this is easily going to be a place you'll find me on a regular basis.

UPDATED: Added the fifth star for Greg putting Hangar Lime on the menu. Easily one of my top 3 bars in SF. The entire staff from Quentin  to Jen, Jon to Greg are incredible humble folks. They are definitely what makes this place so special..... Keep doing what you guys are doing, it's working ;)
author: melissa g.

description:
After receiving an apology for the poor service and an offer of a free round from the owner I'm certainly convinced my last experience here was a fluke.  Thus I have decided to adjust my previous rating/review to reflect their excellent customer service.  This joint isn't even half bad   and really my only complaint is that they have no beer on tap.

Previous Review: 

Prior to a couple weeks ago I would have given Rye a good review however the service I received last time I was there was not only poor but rude.  

I waited for over 10 minutes at the bar and never received my drinks even after the bartender had taken my order while making drinks for someone else.  It wasn't even very busy this particular night and all I had ordered was two beers.
author: Derek D.

description: Upon recommendation on this site and watching the bartender make one, I went for the Basil Gimlet with gin.  I'm not one that is used to spending $9 on a drink too often, but this one was excellent and made with care.  The spot is nice and quiet, unlike many other place in the area.  I'd return for sure.
author: Marc S.

description:
Oh, Rye i love you so much.
Such a great bar during the week, a little pricey but its so worth it.
Every cocktail is delicious-esp. that cucumber one....mmmm!
I try to stay away from Rye on the weekends since it is full of Marina left overs from Ambassador :)
author: Victoria D.

description: I came to Rye for a friend's b-day party and then again tonite for some drinks with my gal pals. Totally different moods but same great ambiance. Oh and the drinks are good too (try the Kumquat Krush)!
author: Helen Y.

description:
"So Rye opened to the general public last night (Nish and Jason got to go to the preopening party thing, they are just special like that).

I am def a fan of Rye and will be spending a lot of time there. Great staff and cocktails. Seriously superior selection of rum.

UPDATE:   I am so lovin Rye!!  Quite possibly my new favorite bar.

UPDATE: (Still lovin' Rye!!!) My brother came to town recently - he likes to drink, knows a thing or two about cocktails and travels all over the world for work.  I took him to most of my favorite San Francisco bars (it was a long night) and he was quite impressed with the bartending skills and drinking atmospheres of San Francisco - but his very favorite of the whole night was Rye!
author: lisa g.

description:
It was a bit of a sausage fest, but any way I wasn't hungry.  Neither were my single friends I guess, since I recall them talking about knitting for a solid 5 minutes.  Inside was dim and reminded me of a warm breezy sewer, without the smell.  Also I've really begun to enjoy this all natural ingredients in the cocktails trend.  We chatted it up with a few strangers new in town.  Had a mildly good time and would most likely visit again.

Update : came back, and it was still stiflingly hot and there were just too many bodies at the bar area.  Three steps away is pretty open.  We got to sit at the table this time, which offered much more breathing space, despite the noxious drafts from the smoking patio.  The cucumber/kiwi drop that I had was one of the best cocktails I've had this year.  I dug the projection of holiday cartoons on they had going.  Still a solid 3 stars.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
not the cheapest place to go, but they make up for it with amazing drinks! 

i came here for my birthday celebration and while i was a little concerned it's not my usual crowd, the night ended up being a huge success. the basil gimlet is just as delicious as everyone says it is and very refreshing [buttttttt it's $11 haha]. the bartender also made these ridiculously good strawberry vodka something else shots throughout the night, and it seems like they incorporate a lot of fresh ingredients into their drinks. parking wasn't a huge problem, then again it was a wednesday night.

the place is cozy but it was big enough to fit all my friends. also, they have a free pool table! FREE!! i know we were all a drunk mess but the staff was still very accomodating and patient with us haha. it does seem however, that they focus so much on their specialty drinks that they can't make normal ones [ie AMF, 4 horsemen, they don't carry goose or belvedere]. the tokyo tea and long islands were ridiculously strong. like... forgot the second half of my birthday strong.  


overall, it was an awesome night. they let my roomie collect a few candles so i could blow them out at midnight haha. thanks to the staff for making my birthday one to [kind of] remember!
author: Angela L.

description:
The decor is pretty industrial and modern. Love how the bar is set up. The Ambassador is just within steps and across the street. Rye's mixed cocktails are very tasty. My personal favorite is the cucumber basil gimlet. So refreshing and has its own zing to the flavor. 

Friendly staff and very nice people who come to gather in this watering hole, no pun intended.
author: Mika D.

description:
Update: Been back several times and I like this place more and more. Fewer suits than other downtown bars, great service, cool bartenders, and great ambiance lead to happy nights.  

Stopped in after a night of nice spice at Lahore and the bartender, like a true fireman, rescued my innards with a blast of Citrus Fernet. Didn't know Fernet came flavored with Citrus! Well now you know...
author: Phil M.

description: The basil gimlet was tasty, but the prices like every other hipsterville bar in the area are just too high.
author: Scott M.

description: One of the classier lounges in the tenderloin area, this is a slightly upscale bar/lounge with a very modern look.  It has a remodeled feel with gorgeous vaulted ceilings  If I am in the area I like to stop by here and have a drink with a friend.  There is one pool table and some couches and low seating.  I had to minus one star because of no beer on tap, but there is a very nice and cozy outdoor patio area that accents the bar's interior.
author: Natan O.

description:
I gave Rye a shot based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. I had god knows how many Basil Gimlets- I told the bartender to ease up on the citrus and then it was perfect. 

It's the perfect size and the pool table provided entertainment for certain individuals in our group. The "smoking cage" (as I termed it that evening) was great. 

I thought my tab was going to be huge because I kept buying people drinks in my generous and jovial drunken stupor. Fortunately, it came back under $60. Not too shabby.

My only complaint was the music. They could really use a DJ in the place. And there's definitely room- my friends and I even picked out the ideal spot for decks. Johnny Cash, and don't get me wrong I'm a fan, just wasn't the right vibe. I think the music was coming from the random setting on iTunes. Besides that, I really like the place.
author: Cameo E.

description: Friendly and helpful bartenders and waitresses. Nice atmosphere, although it's a little loud for my taste, but the music was good so I didn't mind too much. Cocktails were perfectly balanced. I had the special of the night, which was called the Haberdasher (shout out to my man Harry Truman!), and another cocktail, the name of which escapes me, but it had Japanese whiskey and it was delicious. The boy had an Old Fashioned and it tasted like a stick of Big Red gum, but in a good way. The area away from the bar with booths and tables is the prime seating if you can get there early enough and claim a spot. The outside area would be nice except it's where all the smokers go. Boo, smokers, I thought they were all extinct. Apparently not. Anyways, if you're in the area, definitely check this place out. I only wish they had food, but there are plenty of late night dirt cheap eating establishments nearby should you get the whiskey induced munchies.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Yay for Rye! :) I LOVE this place. Definitely not for the crowd, but for the awesome service and the yummy highly labor intensive drinks! Oh man...coming from a fellow bartender, I give these bartenders MAD props for dealing with all these muddled, mixed, shaken, fruit filled drinks. The drinks take a bit, but if you watch with how much intensity and passion they are made with, you can appreciate EVERY sip of every drink. I tried the Orange Marmalade Sour...yummerz! A bit tangy for me, but still delicious! And I think I've found my perfect summer drink I'm gonna recreate for my own little apartment party get togethers...The Flash! A blend of 209 Gin, Kiwi, Cucumber, a little something here and a little something there,....light, refreshing, and a bit of heaven!

Aaron (sp?) the bartender! Super awesome, super accomodating?! (Those reviews are from the entire party I was with, girls, guys, EVERYONE loved Aaron!) 

Happy Hour Specials: $2 off house specialty cocktails and $1 off everything else! CHEERS to coming back another time!
author: Ann T.

description:
Went to Rye for the first time on a Saturday night.  The great space, friendly bartenders, and awesome cocktails earned it a solid 4 stars.  Unfortunately the packed bar was filled to the brim with a Marina crowd made up of shrieking halter-topped girls and "Look at My Striped Shirt" guys.  Lucky enough to get two seats at the bar, we had front row seats to such conversations as "Everyone thinks I live in the Marina even though I in fact live in Cow Hollow", and "They're out of Crown Royal (That's the most absurd thing I've ever heard!)"  Definitely not my type of crowd.

If it wasn't for the terrific bartenders, we probably would have left after one drink, but the fact that we stayed for four in the midst of yuppie hell is a real testament to them, the bar and the cocktails.  I loved the actual bar itself, with its exposed brick walls and candlelight, and the Basil Gimlet is wonderful, as is the Manhattan.  I would definitely come back to this bar again, but probably not on a Saturday night.
author: Janet G.

description:
Odd that I loved the open, industrial decor of this place more than the drinks on offer.  There was even a special smokers' section, slightly gated off, but visible from the street and open air.  Non-smoker here, but appreciated the attention to others who aren't. The music was low-key, but enhanced the loft-like feel of the place, with its steady electronic hum.

Not overly impressed with the drinks being a non-rye drinker, but the bartender was more than willing to accommodate my request for a Clover Club (no raspberry syrup) by making a muddled strawberry, lemon juice, Tanqueray and egg white drink in a flute that merited the attention it received as a very frou frou pink and fizzy drink.

Crowd was not the best, but the decor more than made up for it.  Would be a great place to throw a party as it's not the typical speakeasy joint with the low-lying ceiling, tables and dark booths.
author: J C.

description: Upsides: I like the ambience and the drinks were tasty and strong.  It's a cool space.  Downsides: I found it pricey and I thought the bartenders had no sense of urgency... they'd stop to chat with friends while preparing my drink.  Really long wait for drinks!
author: V M.

description:
Oh. My. Gawww.....

The strongest LONG ISLAND OF MY LIFE. I LOVE YOUUUUUUUU RYEE~~~ ahhahaha.

This place is CROWDED!!! But I can see why! The bartenders certainly know how to make their drinks, and their drinks are delicious! The atmosphere and the music was so-so, but the bartenders are so friendly and look so dedicated to making the best drinks for their customers. I'm definitely coming back here, I can't wait!
author: Khanh T.

description:
SO, Rye's basil gimlet is on 7x7's list of 100 things to eat & drink before you die (http://www.7x7.com/content/eat-drink/big-eat-sf-100-things-try-you-die). #98.

After trying it, I have no question why it's on this top 100 list. That fresh basil flavor makes this drink really tasty.
author: Hannah K.

description:
4.5 stars!

I didn't spend nearly as much time as I wanted to here, but I instantly loved it! We stopped by after Bourbon & Branch, played someone's unfinished pool game over Campari's and cocktails, and chatted up the lovely bouncer... It's an upscale-looking locale with a very laid-back atmosphere, which results in an ideal combination for a rainy Saturday evening. The pool area was a little dead, which worked out because it made playing a lot less intimidating, but I felt like the lack of seating really drew the crowd away to the other room and left it feeling a touch bare. No complaints though, it's an absolutely fabulous place, and I look forward to re-visiting and spending some actual quality time at Rye very soon!
author: G. J.

description: Great place to hangout and have a few drinks and play a little pool. The bartenders are very friendly and helpful. I'm not a big drinker and don't know much about the different drinks out there. Just talked to them and told them what I like and bam, a great drink popped up. Can wait to go back and hangout with some friends again.
author: victor j.

description:
**NOTE: Rye does take credit cards now**--I was asking a friend whether she wanted me to buy her drink because if so, I'd have to use a credit card (I'd already spied the little machine by the register), and she was like "they don't take credit cards." The bartender was swift to point out that they did now, and complained good-naturedly about how this myth was perpetuated when Rye first opened by some early reviews on *that other site*

Anyway, I've been here twice now, and the first time was such a blur, no need to mention it here. But we stopped in for happy hour yesterday ($2-off drinks) and it was quite nice. Dark and completely empty inside, and it was a beautiful day so we sat outside in the little caged in patio overlooking Geary. I cannot stress enough how very sweet the bartender was--just such a nice and funny guy. Such baretenders make life worth drinking. The beverages were top notch too. I had the Honey Melon (or something...it had honeydew in it)--very light and refreshing with mint; one friend had the Thai me up (??)--spicy drink with basil; and another the Apple Bomb (??), with apple brandy. The last one was very strong and would be awesome on a cold night.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
This is a fun little gem in the TL.  It has a nice relaxing feel to it, despite any crowd.  It's loungey, without trying to be the Eighteenth Street Lounge, and it has a definite sleek and modern look to it that doesn't go over the top.  I liked the ginormous wine rack that fills the back wall.  It has a more understated feel to than other bars in the area (I'm looking at you Redwood Room).  And that's how "cool" is accomplished: through understatement.  

The Basil gimlet and cucumber flavored "flash" were both very refreshing and not too sweet.  I'll definitely go back.
author: James M.

description:
I think the key is to arrive at Rye before 10 p.m. on weekends. We got right up to the bar and even found a seat where we enjoyed our amazingly prepared basil gimlets. 

The dark and stormy was also refreshingly tasty. 

I can see how this place could become annoying with long waits. However, I'm willing to wait in line for a cocktail made with real fruit and artisan spirits.
author: Lee H.

description: Cool bar, nice bartenders, and they served a killer basil gimlet.
author: Mike M.

description: The place is hip but the drinks are just average. I'd rate them higher if they actually used raw sugar over simple organic syrup. YUCK. Everyone says its like the same but I can easily say no and if I'm paying over $12 plus tip for a cocktail I expect as many ingredients to be as raw as possible. and I don't mind if my drink hasn't fully dissolved the sugar if thats the problem, I like stirring my drinks afterwards. Anyways I'd rather just take the walk across the street to Jones. Much tastier drinks and even cheaper, much more welcoming staff, plus REALLY cool outdoor patio.
author: Jonathon C.

description: Came here for a birthday party .. nice little area to hang out in ... have a pool table in the back next to the bar and another room with seats and alittle outdoor sitting area .. drinks were fine and a good time was had even though I had my ass whooped in pool ..
author: Anthony S.

description:
A lively bar/lounge in the city. Good place to get drinks and chill with friends. A bit too loud for me, though, but I had a good time with people here. It takes awhile to get drinks, for it was soooo crowded, but the bartender was trying their best and I have give them that. 
Service overall was good.
author: Leon C.

description:
This may be a fine bar, but it's definitely not my kind of atmosphere.  First of all -- the decor is super modern and super trendy...which in itself isn't a bad thing.  However in a bar with 20 foot ceilings, the almost bare walls make the place feel uninviting and sort of gloomy.  Now the crowd -- I couldn't quite place my finger on it, but I definitely smelled some Marina douchebaggery in the air....

Hmm...in fact, now that I think about it...this place totally reminds me of a couple of bars I've been to in the Marina -- the decor, the crowd, the atmosphere.  What it's doing in the tenderknob -- I don't know.

Oh, and to top it off -- we were charged $21 for a Don Julio Anejo neat and a Makers/Ginger.  Seems a bit excessive.
author: Eugene F.

description:
Rye specializes in fresh cocktails and they have a uber-creative menu filled with things like kiwi and mango that I didn't order off.  

Me: "Uh... would it be possible to mix me a margarita with just lime juice, tequila, and a orange liqueor?"

Bartender: "Uh... that's what a margarita is."

Me: "I know, but not where I live."

Bartender:  "You got it."  

He squeezes the limes fresh right in front of you.  It was just as awesome as the guacamole I would have made right in front of me at colibri the next day.  I really think ordering your own drink is the way to go - mine was the same price as my friends who ordered of the special menu but twice as big and four times as strong.
