The room itself is kinda eh and the people are kinda whatever, but it's a good place to start off the night if you want to be fancy...or something.   I'd go back - for a 'rita.
author: Lauren L.

description:
I'm only giving 4 stars for now since I was only able to enjoy 1 drink before rushing off to a show, so I didn't get the full experience but will definitely be back.
The drinks are speakeasy type of drinks you know, ginger beer, fresh herbs, high quality alcohol lovingly mixed just for you!
I went on a Friday night around 6:30 and there were only 4 other people in the bar.  If Rye were in any other neighborhood I'm sure it'd be packed.  $2 off their cocktails until 7-which are normally $9-$10.
Also, perfect view of the a**holes riding by in Critical Mass.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Atmosphere-chill schnazzy, intimate with the crowd.

Drinks-Strong and unique mixes.  Check the chalkboard for the special!

Price-$9-upper teens.

Crowd-good-lookin' ladies and gents, seemed friendly.

Area-Not nearly as bad as it's made out to be.

Overall-great place to lounge with a small crew or meet some chill people, try a new drink, or look good!
author: Justin B.

description:
I went last nigh was Monday night. So it was pretty empty and relaxed environment. 
I really liked the furniture's and setting, very nice. Very comfortable.
Really good for date. Romantic lighting.

My first drink was gin with green tea and pineapple juice type cocktail. It was pretty good even though I didn't taste any green tea. Then I had "The Flash" was made with gin, kiwi, cucumber and lemon. The  cocktail was to die for! then I had "The Flash" again... just to make sure how good it was...

I will be back!
author: Green Mango Y.

description:
This Tenderloin oasis is proof that gentrification happens everywhere.  Or maybe its just easier to catch a cab and women will walk further in non-sensible shoes than I originally thought.

One of my favorite things about the bar is the use of wood in the design.  Especially its entrance, a dignified wooden door slid open between the bar's monkey cage and portal where all worthy alcooldidacts must pass.

The interior is stylish and inviting.  Although something about the layout makes the space feel a bit cramped.  Which is really only bad if the place is flooded with a heavy crowd in search of a tasty beverage.  But I admire the choice not to skimp on the bar which rests in the center of the space.

It took me more than one visit to realize that, like the Lions Pub, this place has it going on in the produce department.  They keep a nice selection of things like mint, peach and blackberry on hand.  It makes for a great Mojito, or something akin to an infused vodka, without having to wait all that time while the ingredients marinate.  It's the next best thing to transubstantiation, and even the un-Metro will enjoy the fruitier side to Rye.  If not, there is always Chimay.

And in case you were wondering, yes they have tapioca balls.    They are served in a drink that looks like a thin milkshake with a not-quite-ricoculous over-sized lavender straw that won't get clogged by the star ingredient.  Nice touch!

Its super close to the Clift so your out of town guests can experience some of the best of the city without fear of getting lost when they tire of the Redwood Room.

I've been here a couple of times recently and I'm thinking there are still a few cool secrets I've yet to figure out.  Like where they keep the key to the wine library...
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Rye is hot... the people, the drinks, the ambiance, and the location.  I've been here twice now and both times were wonderful.

Order anything with fruit -- their fruity drinks are amazing and fresh.

The owner is really cute and very personable.

The people are super funky and fun.

AND, the first time I was in there, they played Ladytron, Destroy Everything you Touch.  Ummmm -- that, alone, made this bar a keeper.

Go to Rye before the word gets out and you have to drink your fruity marvel on the curb, because there's just not enough room for all the hot  San Franciscans in there.
author: Courtaney W.

description:
This one star review is based purely on the service. We got there on Saturday night around 10 30ish. It was starting to get pretty crowded, with people crowded around the bar talking, not exactly ordering drinks.

The bartender in my section really took her sweet time, and refused to look at anyone or acknowledge anyone while she very VERY slowly made her drinks. When she finally got to me I asked her what drinks come with the fresh fruit that was in front of her, and I got a menu shoved in my face as she turned her back on me. I think it would've taken all of 5 seconds to suggest a drink, but apparently me and my friends weren't worth that.

So after that I sent the bf to the bar to get us drinks, where he was basically ignored completely by the same bartender. She'd take the drink order of the guy on his left, then the one on his right, then the guy on his left again. I got all worked up about it and made everyone leave without even trying the fresh fruit drinks that everyone has been raving about, which was kind of disappointing. 

And maybe the timing was bad, but all the beautiful people either haven't shown up yet, or have realized that this bar has crappy service and moved onto the next hot spot...
author: Yvonne G.

description:
the "FLASH" itself deserves five stars all on its own. order it.

Rye is undeniably my kind of place --- chill ambience, awesome smoking "cage" outside, and the beautiful brick walls.  a perfect lounge for those who aren't so big on bar hopping or club bangin'.

my visit was short & sweet and i'll definitely be back soon!
author: Rina K.

description:
A cool place, chill and understated. We actually walked right by it the first time without even noticing.

They have some snack mixes and M&Ms on the bar. It's okay for patrons to much on them. They also have a few baskets of fruit (limes, lemons, oranges) on the bar. It is absolutely NOT okay for patrons to eat them. A member of our party drunkenly made that mistake at the end of a slow Sunday night and the bartender nearly went berserk.

So, word to the wise: go to Rye, enjoy the cocktails, but do not - I repeat, do not - consume the citrus.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I liked Rye. It IS a nice place.

The bar it's self is beautifully modern, the dark wood on the ceiling is a very nice touch. The furniture is sleek and modern, and the 'cage' for smokers outside is a great idea... I'm also a fan of the projected music videos on the brick wall. The drinks that I had were very good, and the bartenders and bouncer were nice.

The only problem was the crowd. I just didn't feel it that night, and according to other reviews it seems that 'it' isn't felt quite often. Big yuppie crowd; they weren't rude or anything but there wasn't really a party or celebratory atmosphere, more of a restrained and tired feeling. I don't know...

I guess I'll have to come back and see if that was just a fluke, but as it stand now, Rye seems to be unlike the beer I had that night, a bit... flat.
author: Aaron J.

description:
The pool table is free!  Oh, but they're missing a striped ball.  OK, we'll play 9-ball.  9-ball is much more a game of skill than 8-ball anyway.  Oh, but they have two 4-balls and no 3-ball.  OK, when the 2 is sunk, you get your pick of the available 4s.

This is actually more fun than standard 9-ball.  And I had the basil gimlet.  Worth writing home about.  (I did.)
author: Ben K.

description:
Meh.
It's on my block. It has a quasi-outdoor smoking room - good for hanging out with both smoking and non-smoking friends. Cocktails are kinda pricey and it always seems really crowded.
It gets four stars for being extremely convenient and having halfway decent cocktails. And a smoking room.

Update: OK, they have some pretty great cocktails. The bartenders are awesome considering how insanely busy they are every time I go. But I gotta try to go on like a Tuesday or something.
author: Thea K.

description:
Cool upscale neighborhood bar with a laid back vibe going on.  The place has a bunch of tasty specialty cocktails, including a lot of labor intensive drinks like mojitos.  Just be prepared to wait awhile for your drinks.

Definitely the sort of place that I like to go for a few drinks with friends.  Good drinks, a very low douchebag count, and lot of eye candy.

Random quasi-celebrity sighting:  Irene from the Real World Seattle.  You know, the girl that got slapped as she left the house for good because she called Stephen a homosexual.  I am such a reality tv dork.  =)
author: Wade Y.

description: This place has amazing drinks! Each drink takes about 5 minutes to make because they are so complex but the end result is tantalizing for your taste buds! Try the Basil Gimlett or the Flash! Each drink was amazing and so yummy! Plus potent! After two drinks, I was pleasantly numb :) The drink prices are a tad expensive but there are so many ingredients that go into each drink it is well worth it. The inside decor is very classy too.....great for groups and a chill night. Only thing I didn't like was the one bathroom they had in the place. It is for men and women and was always busy! It took forever for me to finally relieve myself LOL
author: Lauren S.

description:
I love the smoking cage. I love the bar tenders. I love how they have a million things to add to your cocktail. I love the crowd. I love that  Ambassador is next door (adding to the bar hop potential).  

I love this place... let's go get a drink there right now!!
author: Rada I.

description:
The decor and ambiance...sexy.  Having blackberry seeds in my teeth after drinking the AMAZINGLY good Black and Blue drink on the cocktail menu... not sexy.  Luckily my friends seemed to appreciate my company, seedy teeth and all.  The bartender took and produced drink orders quickly, but I spent a good 10-15 minutes waiting to close out my tab.  :(

I'd recommend this place.  Not cheap or a place to spend the whole night, but a nice polished stop for strong drinks on your night out and about.  Oh, and a chance to brag that you hung in the "Loin."
author: Marina Maven C.

description:
The voices are split on this one. Is it a cool bar that serves delicious drinks or is it a gross meat market?
The drinks are not cheap but they are good the decor is urban brick and there is some music floating through the air.
I 've been here a couple times mid week and it was very chill but the times I've gone on the weekends I grabbed my friends hand and refused to be left alone with the local wolves.. I'm gonna' call it: you are gay go here because there are sooooo many dudes who are drunk enough to do anything.
author: Kim S.

description:
Some of my pals are obsessed with this place. I can dig it.

The vibe is dark and cool. There's a pool table if you're into that sort of thing. The smoking cage is awesome. 

Two words: Basil Gimlet.
author: Ava S.

description: We dropped by for a few hours for a friends birthday last Friday.  I had the T.L. Spritzer which is one of their lighter drink options as it's mixed with Prosecco.  Outdoor gated  smoking area in front.  Mixed crowd.  90's Mash-ups.  Parking is hard to come by and they only had 3 mixologists on a busy Friday evening.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Q: What's better than a perfectly made 'perfect manhattan' made with Rye? 

A: Nothing.  

This place is elegant with a dive attitude.  I kinda feel like I want to move in.  It works for happy-hour, date spot, a quick drink before a show, or marathon drinking.  Once inside, you won't want to leave because the decor, the employees, and the patrons are all friendly and fun.  

Well done Jon and Greg!!
author: Rafi M.

description:
The interior looks like a darker version of Logan's Run. A movie that I love. The wine set-up is in a cage. I thought, hmmm these wines must be pretty good, right? Stroll over to take a closer look. Wow, good thing they have that Kendall Jackson under lock and key. I mean this a is very special wine. You can't just get it at every corner store in the city. WTF?
This expreince summarizes Rye for me. Over priced drinks- I mean come on 18 bucks for 2 cocktails.
I think on a whole it isn't that bad of a bar. The decor is cool. A bit too cool for me.  Would I go if I lived in the neighborhood? Maybe, at someone elses behest, I might.
Otherwise, I am sticking to my mission bars. I am not missing anything.
author: shannon t.

description:
As soulless as a Starbucks ...

I don't know what I expected, it's trendy "new" bar ... Well I expected something! Some sort of individual touch, a wee sign that the place is owned, staffed or frequented by human beings and not the empty-eyed carrion birds of capital.  This space is more mediated than the new mall.  From the blank walls to the late-night cable shilled alterna-hits of the 90's comp playing in the background Rye is a marketing scheme aimed straight at the wallets of the mid-level, mid-thirties office drone/technocrat.  I don't have a problem with that demographic, being one myself, but this place is contemptible in its transparency. It's a hotel bar sans hotel.

Yet the bartender was nice, and I won't even hold the really heavy vermouth pour in his Manhattan against him --- that being a personal choice.
author: Gustie L.

description:
I'd heard of Rye after reading how Radiohead had wandered into the locale during their last visit to the Bay Area. Easily fascinated by stories of possible rockstar sightings, I happened to find Rye while wandering around the area one Friday night. A few gin and tonics later, we shimmied back to the bar to order another round singing Mickey Avalon and were greeted with free shots from a grinning bartender who also happened to love the eccentric LA glam rapper. I told her to make me anything she wanted and she gave me the most delicious cucumber infused drink called the Amoure. The next time I went in though, the bartender hadn't heard of it but made me a muddled kiwi and cucumber confection that still makes my heart jump. Plus any bar that plays indie rock without being pretenious in a city like San Francisco, gets double points my book.

I also had a company party there and it was open bar so I got to drink and try a million of their muddle magnificence (well it felt like a million the morning after). Everytime I go the bartenders are helpful, cheery, and willing to make you a delicious drink if youre overwhelmed with the marvelous selection of fresh fruits waiting to be muddled. It's fun to just grab a drink, settle into the leather seat next to the brick wall and people watch the cage (the smokers spot) or the door in the Tendernob without dealing without too much B&T crowd or the annoying.
author: Stephanie C.

description: You really cannot go wrong with any drink here. Don't believe me even the water was delicious and refreshing (it had cucumber in it) . I have had the best Old Fashioned EVER complements of Vincent who was running the show behind the bar. Other drinks i would recommend are the Moscow Mule, Manhattan, and the Joy Division. Damn i need to get back soon.
author: Raul R.

description:
Rye is a beautiful bar.  From the cedar entryway to the exposed brick wall to the shiny bar itself.  That still doesn't change the fact that I don't like paying $9 for a shot of Jameson on a Tuesday night bender.

Tough economic times.

The bartender was entertaining; she told me that she came from teaching kindergarten kids and that working at this bar is the most fulfilling job she's had.  I like that kind of honesty.

So the moral of the story is that if you want to go to a really nice place and knock back a cocktail or two, this is your place.

For me, I'll keep drowning my sorrows the Ha Ra club down the street while the bartender shouts humiliating insults to me and the other patrons.
author: Rocco B.

description: Bar for gorgeous, rich hipsters. Definitely sexy. Small. Expensive drinks. I would come back, because when I went I couldn't drink (just accompanied a friend for drinks). Probably would be more fun if I was drinking.
author: Heather D.

description:
I've been to Rye a few times. The drinks are great and made with care ($10 each). The bartenders are not terribly friendly but they are very good. If you engage them in their craft, they open up a bit.  During the week it can be empty and actually great for a low-key drink with a small group. Weekends can get busy -- sometimes too busy. My last visit there were so many people that the whole fancy cocktails that take 5 minutes to make shtick broke down - it took 30 minutes to get a drink. The crowd is usually cool and easy to talk to. 

Don't come here to get a beer - they oddly only have a few beers available none of which are remarkable.

The space is cool though the bar area can get cramped. There's a pool table -- very large interesting paintings on the walls and plants/flowers. Quite large seating area in the second, larger room. Probably a good place to take a date during the week when it's not busy.

Outdoor seating here means a funky caged-in space good for smokers -- a couple of seats though and a cool place to get a breath of fresh air.
author: Dave S.

description:
Rye is destined to be the new hipster joint in the tender nob. This is a great place to grab a drink with friends or play pool. The bar has a really cool vibe and the decor oozes with style despite its somewhat seedy location. 

My main gripe, why play music from the wild 94.9 playlist?
author: Dave S.

description:
Classy spot. Good location for a little bar hopping. Totally different vibe after work versus late night. (After work is chill and small crowd, while late night can get packed). But, for the most part, when I come here it's not too crowded, which I like. 

The drinks are great. The layout is nice- with two main rooms and a little outdoor smoking area.  I typically wind up in the second room to your left, once you enter. I also like the decor- gives that swanky vibe (but not in a standoffish way) for a seedy corner. 

It's the kind of place I'd come with my girlfriends if we just want to be girls and have some cocktails.
author: Nina H.

description:
It's not just the drink menu that's over the top cool here, it's the execution of these exceptionally eccentric yet traditionally tasty cocktails. The decor is great, the pool table is small for sure, but who can argue with the price of free billiards of any kind!  Next time bring me another, and one for my special lady here!

So after plenty of cool conversation it's a 3 yelp night, does it get any better than this on a Monday?
author: P H I L H.

description:
UPDATE: I've gone back to Rye, and it has grown on me. I still find the bathroom location uncomfortable, and it gets REALLY loud [odd acoustics], but it's a nice place to chill on an off night! Plus one star for all those relaxing Wednesdays and Tuesdays!

OLD REVIEW:
Cool space, especially for San Francisco. It feels very metropolitan, which is great, but they had a few massive shortfalls. There are some things that one should never forget:

1. Cheap chairs kill a lounge

2. A non-designed, non-working bathroom kills the experience

3. Do not have the door to the aforementioned unpleasant bathroom right in the middle of the main lounge. It's a great way to dampen atmosphere and make everyone uncomfortable.

4. Any good bar should have Cointreau, which is THE necessary ingredient to make a great Blood Orange.
author: Liza P.

description:
Hey Janice, we must be getting the same bartender! That's all I'm going to say....If there was a choice for 0 stars that is what I would choose to rate them! 

I am pretty laid back so I don't expect people to jump to serve me drinks or anything (however it was pretty dead so maybe a little hop) but man the bartender there was a bi%@**!

There are sooo many other bars around this area. In fact just walk down a block to Lush...that's what I did and the vibe is soo much better and they have the Best specials and an awesome bartender that knows his customer service, his drink mixing skills, and no mean muggin!
author: Maria E.

description:
Love the signature door and the sleek design, surprisingly a sexy place from the moment you walk in! Drink's are a nice proportion and I will be going back to try everything fruity on the menu, and I usually can't stand fruity drinks! TRY the blackberry lime shots - they are divine!

I must admit though I was intrigued with being there - I secretly wanted to go order noodles next door and sneak them back in!
author: Yelper A.

description:
Based on the reviews here on yelp I was hoping to be much more impressed than I actually was by this bar. It was crowded, so you couldn't hear the music over the din of the crowd, which was too bad because it sounded like it was a good mix. I was sitting at the bar with a friend of mine and some douche bag spilled his entire drink down my back. Not the bars fault, granted, but didn't improve my night at all. The guy didn't even apologize. The atmosphere was more dive bar than lounge and attracted the same sort of crowd. That made it really hard to justify $10 well drinks. At least there was no cover and better bars right down the street.

Also - since when is Geary and Leavenworth Nob Hill? Judging by the number of crackheads hanging our on the corner, I'd still call that the TL. Or if you want to push it we can go with the new tween category Tender Nob.
author: Brenda K.

description: Super fancy drinks, just ask the bartender to make you something fancy!
author: Jen E.

description:
It's dark, unassuming, somewhat difficult to find (I passed it by about 6 blocks the first time) I had a great time here, all sorts of adventures ensued at our table of 6 in the corner by the front door. The drinks were good, the "regulars" were entertaining. This one holds a special place in my heart as it's also the setting for my introduction to Yelp! I'm not able to award all 5 stars yet b/c I haven't tried the cocktails yet...but I hear they're amazing.

Update: I was a repeat customer. Tried the cocktails - Basil Gimlet with Vodka (instead of Gin) was delish. Sweeter than I expected but nothing over the top. Hemingway's Daquiri.....wow....not good.  Multitude of other "old fashioned" cocktails looked (and reportedly tasted) divine.   We were the youngest people in the whole place...a little weird....oh and my boyfriend walked in on a little umm...."sexual activity" in the men's ONLY bathroom stall. It was barely 10PM.
author: Angela N.

description:
A great little gem in the brimming selection of possible lounges in the city proper. A class act with out the pretentious wherewithal many others seem to carry.

Nice seating, friendly staff, reasonably priced drinks and a fantastic selection of original cocktails. I recommend the apple bomb. Good stuff. 

Can get a little crowded during peak hours, but it seems to draw a down to earth and friendly crowd so say hello to your neighbor. Smoking "cage" available for those who need it, wish they would make that area smoke free as well and have the smokers just hit the street out front as seating is a bit hard to come by sometimes. A clean air outdoor area would make this place tops, but as it stands it's still pretty fantastic.
author: Geoff W.

description:
Had the basil gimlet at Rye - delicious! They threw in a couple leaves of basil, squeezed in fresh lime juice, tons of gin = yummy with no taste of alcohol!

Rye was quite dark and small, with a pool table tucked in the back. They seem to use a lot of basil in their drink specials; one i saw on the board last night was lime, basil, watermelon and vodka!! inventive and refreshing!
author: Carol L.

description: Fun spot, but unless you really know your drinks, difficult to choose something bc they don't have a menu. Trendy bar with comfy seating and good drinks.
author: Ashley B.

description: this place is just stupid.  it has like 8 seats and then couches that everyone is on a mac on.  I'd rather drink in a bathroom.  ive been trying to come here for sometime and the only reason i can see anyone ever coming here is to be able to smoke since they have a smoking area, otherwise this place is cruddy.  ALSO those pictures taken?? Who the hell photoshopped those??!! it doesnt look anything like that inside with all the candles and crap. Lies...
author: christopher h.

description:
Finally i have gone to Rye!  So many of my friends have spoken great things about it and now I know why. 

First of all the bartenders know what they are doing... i had the best gin fizz there and it was delicious.  If you love an expertly mixed drink then this would be an ideal place.   There is also an outdoor area to catch some fresh air or watch the lovely people walk by.  The decor is modern with some small group seating on one side with some great artwork on the walls (the artist was even there that night having a drink).   

Rye will definitely be added to my list of regular bars to stop in at!  See you soon.
author: Annabel G.

description:
I really need to come back here.  It seems like it would be one of my favorite bars in the city, if only it were about ten-ex more laid back. And that seems like just the scene on a Tuesday night.  It was entirely too much of an ordeal to get a drink -- once you got to the bar, it was cool, the bartenders were *on it* and the drinks were good.  But the getting to the bar was somewhat of a mess.

Then again, for how crowded it was, I never felt claustrophobic, warm, or really uncomfortable at all.  That's impressive.  I was definitely rockin the whole "dammit, why is this place so popular that I have to stand outside for 20 minutes" while I was waiting in line... but I was pretty happy once I got in.  As I said, though, I think the feeling would be entirely different during the week, and entirely better, which is impressive.
author: Jay M.

description:
This is really tough to rank.  When I think of going out in the city -- I like:

1. Fun music
2. Scattered crowd - where I don't have to be the only sucker in the place, but also don't have to get worried about getting the drunken frat party spillage
3. Vibe - good people all around, not jerks, too-good for this place people, not scary look you up and down, no off the wall weirdo's
4.  Memorable drinks/selection - it's always fun to go back to a place that has Chimay on tap or my favorite mixer, whatever.
5.  Not Over the Top - you don't need to prep so hard that you can't go there several times a week and that its not so pricey that you'll only show up once in a while.

So here's the tally:
On criteria 1: 1 of 5 stars - I can't even remember the music - was there music?
On criteria 2: 5 of 5 stars - You have breathing room with the smoking lounge up front, and the pool table in the back.
On critiera 3: 3 of 5 stars - Some weirdos definitely
On critera 4: 5 of 5 stars - the bartender made up a drink for us - which was delicious
On criteria 5: 3 of 5 stars - casual enough to show up to all the time, if only the drinks weren't so high end.  A mixed drink for $9?  We had a tab of 4 drinks that totaled around $40  -- hmm?

Final tabulation
Sum of 1, 5, 3, 5, 3 is 17; divided by 5 is 3.4 -- so a 3, sorry Rye.

I'll try to update if the situation changes.
author: Mandy S.

description:
Since when was Geary the cool spot in town?  

Rye is the quintessential hip bar with the cool industrial space.  The drinks are delicious, there isn't any Marina snottiness, and the space is big!  It has a smoking "cage" area to socialize with my fellow black lungers.  It's cool.  Not necessarily super fun but I love that it's clean, big, and you can get a good drink for the price.
author: Ria D.

description:
I stopped by Rye to treat myself to a drink for my birthday last week. I had something called a Sicilian Mojito. It was really, really tasty, and I enjoyed my time at Rye...but it's not going to be a place I can go to often. Even at Happy Hour I paid $8 for my drink, and since I work for the state, I can't go blowing money like that at every turn.

Good thing it was my birthday! ;-)
author: Amber G.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed this place. Went with a friend pretty early in the evening as a first stop to get the night started.

They have great drinks, although pricey, they were very fresh and really good (+ very strong!). In addition, the servers were really nice and willing to help us figure out what it was that we wanted. When a drink that she recommended  was not good or what I had wanted, she was more than willing to switch it out.

Good drinks! (my fav was 'the flash')

classy place, pretty small but I enjoy that its a bar that has no bottle service or anything necessary. As long as you get there early enough, there are about 6-7 tables to sit and enjoy drinks/convo/company/atmosphere.
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description:
I can see myself liking this place more on a weeknight versus a Friday. Been here twice, and tried their Basil Gimlet.....ehh, maybe it's bc I'm not the biggeset fan of gin, but yeah....didn't do it for me. 

I do like that they make all their drinks fresh and the bartenders do take their work seriously.....except I like my drinks fruitier and there didn't seem to be anything for my fruity palate. 

It's chill, and no cover, and a nice atmosphere.... but what's up with all the dudes? I was like, one of 4 girls here on a Friday night??? Not that I'm complaining, but just thought it'd be informative to put it out there.
author: Peggy W.

description:
I always get this place mixed up with Roe and Rouge, and I always refer to this place as "the bar across the street from Ambassador."  The sole purpose of writing this Yelp is so that I never get them mixed up again.  I had to look up google maps street view to figure out what the name was.  

This place is real small, with a single pool table.  But the drinks are so awesome I gotta say this is one of my favorite places to pick up an assortment of fresh mojitos, well drinks, and martinis.  There's an outdoor smoking area also.  I do think the place gets packed, but I can never recall it being stifling.

Once you're done, you can always swing to Osha for some thai lovin'.  Not the message parlor, but the food.  Silly.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Have you seen Rye's website?  There are no links, no flashy fonts and advertisements.  Just a black & white photograph.  So simple yet says so much.  The place is just the same.  No crazy music, no crazy people, just a good atmosphere and good mixed drinks.  My fav is the FLASH!  A  mix of alcoholic goodness with a dash of cucumber.  So refreshing and thirst quenching!  My kinda place, my kinda drink.
author: Lisa P.

description:
I feel like this place only got 4 stars because our standard for bars is so low in the city. When comparing it to other cities, I feel bar owners put no effort into the upscale decor in SF. Unfortunately Rye is no exception. There is, literally, a metal cage for smokers out front. You have to fight the urge to throw a peanut at them. It looks ridiculous. The side room isn't bad but very poorly lit so the affect, overall, is lost. 
 
I don't know where all these friggin candles came from in the pictures for this place. There were none when I was there. This is symbolic of the times I walk into a fast food joint, see the huge picture of a burger stacked high with meat, then order one only to get two beaten pieces of bread with a strip of mystery meat between it. Very deceiving. 
 
I did, to some extent, see what people meant about the Dbags that visit this place. But I work in law and Dbags are a way of life in my profession. That said, there were an unfortunate number of bonehead, Marina style, frat loving wannabe's in the place. I wouldn't have minded if most of them didn't have the wherewithal of a ham sandwich.
author: Shreya C.

description: Relaxed atmosphere with a pool table in the back.  Very limited seating but all in all, a good experience.
author: Alice Y.

description:
Would you believe me if I told you that the best drink I ever had was at Rye and it didn't even have alcohol in it?

If you want a dry night, try the Fresh Fruit Spritzer - or you can be like my friend Barb and have them add vodka.

Either way, it's just like heaven.
author: Rachel G.

description:
A good place to chill with out being shoulder to shoulder and enjoy a good drink with you friends!  

Had the Hemmingway and Mint Julip. Use caution, drinks are soooo good served in small mini goblets yet dangerous if you have one too many!  Great place if your tired of the usual cran-vodka, redbull-vodka, rum n coke, etc. Take a look at their cocktail menu for sure!!
author: Miss B.

description:
I don't think you can always blame a bar for the crowd it draws.  Rye is a great looking bar with a good looking well trained staff and an affinity for whiskey.  In my book, that gets 5 stars every time.  The crowd changes pretty drastically from night to night.  I've been there when it's like a frat party, I've been when it's a mix of Japanese tourists and construction workers.  By the third drink you won't care who is there.

Just a quick update.  I've been going to Rye for almost 2 years and it's the same same staff.  That's a good sign, especially with this staff.  
Erica is my favorite cocktail waitress in the city.
author: Charlie S.

description: I came here for the basil gimlet, and it was good. They make excellent drinks, and even on a Saturday night it was low key enough for us to snag the pool table.
author: Merrilee T.

description: A dark little bar with a nice vibe and an interesting layout (i like the steps), including a cage. My basil vodka gimlet was super. I recommend it for an expensive martini Tendernob style.
author: Andrew K.

description: kinda depends on what you're looking for I guess. I have no complaints about this place but it's definitely a certain scene. nice decor and fairly comfortable atmosphere but maybe not somewhere I'd frequent because I'm looking for a bit of a different crowd. no dancing and predominantly young professionals aged late twenties-early forties. not particularly cheap but I don't believe there's ever a cover, always a good thing.
author: Georgia W.

description:
Is the server on CRACK? I'm sorry. I know this place seems to have a good rep amongst the users but I really think otherwise. I was there this last friday with 3 of my friends. The server comes to us, asks us what we want and takes our order. 15-20 minutes later, nothing, she comes back to us:
"Would you like anything else?"
"Um... We don't have our first order yet.". 
Server: "OH OOOps!!"
Alright, that's fine mistakes happen. We later on proceed to ask for 3 waters. Another 15 -20 minutes pass by and she returns:
"Did you guys want anything else?" 
"UM YOu DIDn't BRING OUR WATERS!"
Server: "Ooh ooops!"
Dude, the place is not even BUSY~~~

Server: "Oh here's your water, I feel bad, so I took one DOLLAR off your bill." A MEEZLY DOLLAR? please...Um... how about 5?

Oh yeah, and when she gave us our water she was wearing a cracked out pink wig. Hmm Tenderloin appeal I guess....

Only reason this place gets 2 as appose to one is because I actually like the decore and her wig was unique

Annoyed.
author: Bianca L.

description:
Pretty swank.

I can see why people love this place: it's good-looking, low-lit, interesting cocktails, a smoking patio, etc.

But I found it to be a little generic & bland; I prefer dives & this is definitely the opposite.
author: Holly F.

description:
I went to Rye to catch up with a couple friends and had a great time. Maybe it was just because this was right before Christmas, but on a Friday night it wasn't crowded at all, so we were able to get a seat with a table to chat without shouting!

Try the Basil Gimlet with Gin.  Mmm...
author: Corey C.

description:
Why does anyone ever go tthe ambassador when this place is across the street? Rye blows it out fo the water!

First, you don't have to wait in an enormous line to get into Rye and the doorman is friendly and professional - it's as if he's an entirely other species of doorman from the Ambassador/Los Angeles variety. No attitude at all, very chill, and no cover on Saturday. Five stars. 

The music is energetic enough to support the social buzz without being so loud or having such a drivingly fast beat that you can't hold a conversation. The pool table is also a nice addition to the atmosphere. Four stars.

The crowd was a good mix of men and women, with the ratio hovering at about one to one all night. The atmosphere was friendly and social, with small groups and singles mingling freely. Four stars as there was a (quite small) contingent of the North Beach striped-shirt brigade. 

The staff... This is where Rye really ascends into the nightliofe pantheon - the bartender, Jenn, is absolutely the best in San Francisco - PERIOD. This woman successfully knocked Voda off the "best martini in SF throne" with a dirty hendrick's martini that was besically an orgasm in a glass. Add in the "most well-made mojito I've ever had" according to the D, and you're ready to start your night properly. The very cool waitstaff were cracking jokes and having a good time with us without letting it affect their efficiency a bit, and we ended the night throwing back shots at the bar and laughing it up lioke old friends. Combine that with the doorman experience, and you have 5 stars... I wish I could give 6!

Overall, I found Rye to be a fantastic place to go with a small group of friends for great drinks and atmosphere in a place where you can actually get a spot to sit (no packed like sardines in this bar!). I would also suggest it as a place to go for a few drinks with a date after dinner - great drinks, places to sit and chat, not too loud, fun, relaxed atmosphere. It isn't really a pick-up joint, though, from my experience, but that may vary with the night.


EDIT: The absolute rock star of a doorman referenced above is named Quenton - give the man some love, as he keeps cool, calm and very personable despite having a job that can often be thankless.
author: Mani F.

description:
The drinks at Rye were quite tasty - I had the Pearl and the Black and Blue. Watching the process of making the drinks was also quite mesmerizing - when the fresh blackberries went into the pint glass for crushing under the pestle I almost wanted to pick one out to eat - it looked so ripe!  Made for a nice tangy cocktail though.

Rye also has a very thoughtful smoker's cage - it's a nice hospitality so that one can drink one's drink and smoke at the same time, and even give a little wave to the passersby on the other side of the fence. I'm a non-smoker, so this makes it tolerable to accompany a smoking friend for a cig, since we're outside getting fresh air too. 

You might need to be a little patient waiting to get your drinks though, there can be a fair number of people crowded around the bar.
author: Marina K.

description:
The Basil Gimlet IS that good. Fresh, perfectly tangy and not too sweet. 

I very much enjoy the vibe here at Rye. We came here on a Saturday evening, before going to dinner and were able to snag a table. It wasn't overly crowded at all. I love the tall ceilings and especially the artwork by Brian Barneclo on the walls (you'd recognize from NOPA mural).

If you're looking for quality drinks produced by people who know the ingredients and have that special touch, come to Rye.
author: Laura D.

description:
Rye is a swanky bar that's usually crowded with yuppie types during the weekend, which is not my scene. Though after eating dinner at Osha on a Monday, my friends decided we should check it out. One of our friends bartends there, but she wasn't working. 

Cheryl got my first drink to which my only preference was that there be no vodka in it (as I had a bad time with vodka the night prior). The bartender fixed up some crazy drink with ginger beer and at least three different bottles of alcohol (I couldn't see which ones since I wasn't at the bar), a slice of lemon and lime, two mint leaves, and a slice of cucumber. It was really good.

The atmosphere is nice, but the drinks are pricey, or more pricey than I'm used to. But their drink selection is positively unique! They even have mixing contests to which the winner gets their drink on the menu.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Cavernous cement space.  

This is what I have always dreamed of living in.  I can't live in Rye but I can hang here for hours.  Since I am in the middle of the great wagon train of 07 I sampled one of their non-alky concoctions and it was great.  I can image how wonderful it would be with whiskey in it.  MMMmmmmmmm I love whiskey.

I went here on a Thursday so the crowd was manageable but busy enough to feel like you weren't there alone.  I wasn't alone though.  I was with a bunch of hot girls and the hot boys that tag along with them.  It made for a good evening.
author: Ian M.

description:
I frequently come to Rye, and I am torn between whether I really like the place or whether I can't stand it.  Let me explain:

The venue itself is great.  Industrial and sleek; you can kick back in a casual setting without feeling like you are in a dive bar.  

The drinks are excellent - especially the basil gimlet.  They have bartending competitions on Monday nights, and the drinks definitely stand the test of a true gimlet fan.

On weeknights when the place is less crowded, it is a great venue to kick back and catch up with friends over a well mixed drink.  There is a pool table as well as a caged area in the front for those of you smokers out there.  

On weekends, however, the place draws an entirely different crowd, and it becomes so packed that it can be pretty obnoxious -- both the crowd and the door policy (think lines / door policy of NYC hot spots, but not).  

Overall, thumbs up on weeknights, thumbs down on weekends (unless that is your scene, of course).
author: Emily C.

description:
Ever wanted to have a full bar in your brick garage with all your friends there? Rye is sorta like that. Where all your friends can be (if you can all fit inside - gets packed on the weekend) without a cover, without dress codes, no hassle. Good drinks made here, and the bar-keeps are friendly.

The smoking area is like being in a cell behind bars which is cool cuz you get to watch all the action along street, and yet remain obscure.

Wish the bar was bigger tho. All the frills, none of the hassle.
author: benjamin c.

description: Came to Rye at the recommendation of other Yelpers!  It is a small bar with an unassuming facade - we had to scan the street a couple times to find it!  Though small with limited seating, it wasn't over-crowded on a Friday night.  My group of 6 ladies found a table to sit at within 15 minutes.  The drinks I loved.  Delicious and strong - and not the kind of nasty strong that makes me want to wait for the ice to melt to dilute it.  Recommend the Fair Lady and Basil Gimlet.  Minus 1 star for the loud, loud music.  I'm all for groovin' to tunes while having my drinks, but I also want to be able to have a conversation without screaming.  This wasn't a dancing kind of place, so I thought the volume was a bit excessive.
author: Pam S.

description:
I came back here recently on a Friday around happy hour. The prices were better ($28 for 4 specialty drinks).  I had their basil gimlet and HOT DAMN that thing is good!

I love gin and the GF hates it but even she was impressed. These people come up with some weird drinks but they are worth trying (probably not in the same night unless your piggy bank is really full).

One issue I have run into the 2 times I was here is the service. Everyone is very nice but they seem to be understaffed. They work hard and as fast as they can but when some of the drinks require a significant amount of manual labor the drink orders start to stack up.  They seem to put the effort into their drinks, which is awesome, but they need an extra set of hands.

UPDATE:
Went to Rye this week for a birthday party and had a great time. Drinks were as great as ever and the bar didn't seem to suffer from being understaffed (I imagine going on a Tuesday had something to do with it).

I would love to leave my 4 * rating alone for this place but something happened after I left:

I made the incredibly rookie mistake of leaving my credit card at the bar... I know I know but there is a first time for everything I guess. When I went by the next day to pick up the card they were happy to return it to me saying:
 "There is nothing to sign we already closed the card out last night... have a good day." 
Cool! The amount was right: $40 for 4 drinks not cheap but not wallet breaking either.

A few days later I discover that in addition to the drinks they added on their own $6 tip for the night (exactly 15% for you non math majors).

I don't mind that they added a tip and I am totally in favor of tipping bartenders (not an easy job!). But I am pretty pissed they tacked it on without letting me know and then gave no indication that it was done.

It feels like they are trying to put one over on me.  I'm not going to dispute the charges or make a stink in the bar but it leaves a really bad taste in my mouth.
author: Nick E.

description:
We had initially intended to go check out Ambassador, but the line there was looking rather B&T so we decided to hop across the street to this place for a drink instead. 

I wanted to like this place. I really did. But it just didn't "pop" for me. 

There is a smoking section that looks like a monkey cage, which was a great touch considering I dispise smoking. I'm going to go back and try out some specialty cocktails, but I doubt it will affect my review much. 

The drinks were indeed pretty stiff, so that's a nice plus.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
So I've been here twice and both times, I was not impressed. 

First time, I was already buzzed from a party at Swig but I found it crowded and the crowd left me a little wanting (except fro my friends; they're always fantastic) so I left without getting a drink, though that might have been a good idea looking back on that.

Second time, I went to meet up with friends again and it wasn't as crowded. The bouncer was nice but the bartender was kind of rude when I asked if they had a certain scotch. They didn't and they also charge an above average price for Jameson as I remember so I probably won't be going back... especially with Swig across the street and Koko a few blocks away.
author: Megan P.

description: Doug mixes a mean Whiskey punch, Jen makes funny jokes, they keep the smokers in a cage, and there's free pool! The pool equipment looks like it was found somewhere in the Tenderloin, but was advised not to complain about free stuff. I'll express my dissatisfaction by giving Rye 5 stars.
author: Matt K.

description: Real chill spot. Ask the bartender to try the pickled green beans if she has any..
author: Tammy N.

description:
Two words: Basil Gimlet. 

I went to Rye the day after they opened. I asked the bartender (owner, as it turns out), what drink I should get. He suggested the Basil Gimlet. I've never looked back. Since then, the cocktail concoctors have introduced me to many a creative drink. 

The smoking cage is a great place to hang out. Getting a little "fresh" air with a drink is nice.

I usually try to go on the off nights, as the weekend crowd annoys the hell out of me.
author: Peter C.

description:
From UrbanDictionary.com ---

Ghetto Fabulous:
"Referring to the style of nouveau riche people who have grown up in ghetto or urban areas. The combination of bad taste, an urban aesthetic, and desire to wear one's wealth."

Bad taste/aesthetics:  Cold, expensive, hyper-chic design.  Check.
Ghetto area roots:  Meh, close enough to the Tenderloin.  Check.
Desire to wear one's wealth:  Trendy clientele overload.  Check.

Rye even sports a rickety, busted up pool table so you don't forget they're from the block.  Seriously, I've never been inside a weirder bar.

It's the nightlife equivalent of ghetto fabulous.  Nevertheless, it's an interesting place.  Worth checking out.
author: Adam W.

description:
When I  am thoughtful about a particular thing, I begin to compartmentalize what it is into a pocket of time. Like the hours, days, weeks, etcetera. 

Lately things have been a definition according to the season. 

It is winter now. This year has been as good to me as it was bad. I admit the cyclical nature was waning toward the hard this winter. 

Holly helps make me laugh.
We sit at Rye for hours sometimes warming our cheeks by our chattiness, the cocktails.
author: Jenny T.

description:
The only reason I go there is because Jen and the rest of the crew are absolutely and unequivocally the top of their class. They know WHAT they are doing and HOW to do it PERIOD!

As far as the rest, the atmo can be really low key and cool but sometimes you can get massive waves of cheesy-ness.   The smoke area (aka The Cage) is really nice when you want to light up and escape from the stripes. The venue is nicely dark and rustic; and the music is really good (whoever owns that iPod-you know wassup) And the drinks, well, re-read my opening lines.
author: Don C.

description: I liked the space, I liked the bar tender, I liked the drinks. We even got some nice scotch to sample. It had everything I needed though a little more comprehensive beer list would have rounded it out for the group a little better. I know it is a whiskey bar, but when some people aren't liquor drinkers in your party, you need a fair number of options for them.
author: Sean Q.

description: I was hesitant at first to trek to the Tenderloin late at night for my friend's bday party, but was pleasantly suprised to discover a chic and intimate space behind the caged exterior with the easy-to-miss signage. The bar was packed. Luckily the birthday girl had a reserved table with the comfortable leather seats. We turned the aisle into an impromptu dance floor since they played good music. That geared us up for dancing at Ambassador across the street which, unfortunately, wasn't as nice as Rye.
author: Diana B.

description: My FAVORITE neighborhood bar. The drinks are amazing and I can usually ask for "whatever" and they make something up which tastes both surprising and delicious (granted I'm there all the time so they know what I like). The bartenders and great to chat with if you're there early enough. The best time to go is around or before happy hour when it's not so crowded. This is not a "jack and coke" or "vodka redbull" kind of place, although you could get either. Rye is more for those looking to expand their taste pallet.
author: Marianne G.

description:
Elegant without being pretentious and somehow maintains a vaguely "divey" feel. This place walks the line and it does it well. 

I don't come here too often because it's not in my neck of the woods but every time I stop by, I enjoy myself. If I lived in this neighborhood I'd come here all the time.
author: Sol V.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I like Rye and want to give it 4/5 stars, but it's unacceptable to list your Sazerac as containing Rittenhouse Rye and swapping in Wild Turkey instead.  I have a problem paying $9 for a drink made up of Dirty Bird and bitters.  

I'll be back, but I'll be more insistent on the bartenders using the right liquor next time.
author: Lester L.

description: Great drinks, cool bartenders, and friendly patrons. The bar seems minimalistic, and almost bare-bones, but it adds to the chill ambiance of the place.
author: Grotius H.

description:
What I don't like about Rye: the barstools are so modern that there is no where to stick your heels through, it's basically UFO shaped where one usually puts their feet.  

What I DO like about Rye:  Everything else!  I think saying how great their drinks are is redundant, but yes, they are amazing!  I like how there are no curtains anywhere, it's totally sleek.  I like the bartenders... maybe just a little bit more than i like some of my own friends.  I like how one can feel safe from the reaches of crackheads on the street in the cage... it does not cage you in, it cages them out.  I like knowing where the alternative bathroom is.  I like how they  didn't yell at that one Korean chick that was eating the kumquats, even though i would have smacked her hands.  I like the owners, who devote endless hours to their masterpiece.
author: Moi S.

description:
By far my favorite bar in San Francisco.  The bar tenders are amazing--really friendly and extremely talented.  They make the best Sazerac in the city -- which is enough to keep me coming back.  I also love the Basil Gimlet, and the recent Sao Paulo Sin (with Thai chili) is incredible.

The design of the bar is great -- brick/industrial, and the crowd is a great mix (without too much Marina crowd).

Definitely better than the overcrowded and overpriced Burbon &  Branch.
author: Wojtek K.

description:
I used to live two blocks from this place, but never went because it always seemed so pretentious. Now I wish I had, because if you go at the right time it's a great bar with delicious drinks and awesome bartenders.

On Friday, we were looking for a place to grab a nice drink that wouldn't be too crowded or too after-worky or douchey (a tough mission). After reading some reviews, I thought maybe it was time to give this place a try, especially after reading about some of their cocktails.

Both bartenders were great, though we mostly interacted with Jennifer. She was great at making suggestions based on what we liked or had already tried and mixed awesome drink after drink [Rock Candy Rye Manhattan (I think it was): Amazing.). Jennifer was also incredibly gracious and accommodating when she asked us if we'd give up our booth for a party that was coming in that'd reserved it. Seriously above and beyond, since it's not the sort of thing I'd get worked up about anyway.

We ended up spending about 4 hours there, from when it was nearly dead to when you had to squeeze through a phalanx of fratty dudes to get within seven feet of the bar. I'll definitely be back, as long as I can get there in the earlier part of the evening.
author: James K.

description:
Great drinks, cool atmosphere.  One of my new fav drinks in the city has to be the Basil Vodka Gimlet, try it and you will agree.  good tunes, nice staff, and not terribly crowded.  They also have a cool smoking cage that reminded me of Hemlock's, except the clientele had less tattoos and more khakis.

Could have been 5 stars but there was a lot of oldies and lameos in the mix, and the bartender skipped one of my favorite yeah yeah yeahs songs in favor for a lame euro techno song. Maybe I am too picky :)
author: Katie M.

description:
I like this place. People were friendly and down to earth or at least they seem they were ~smile. Bartenders were helpful and friendly. I liked the drinks.

You should check this place out.
author: Amlan S.

description:
This is really a tough one for me. I am giving four stars with the hopes that not every night was like last night at Rye. After all, the drinks are **stellar!!**  and the bar is really gorgeous. 

My friends and I all had the basil gimlet. This drink is up there with my other favorite drinks: Plymouth gin martini at Absinthe, The Spanish Lady (rosemary-spiked, but sadly no longer on the menu) at B&B, and cilantro margarita at Maya. It was so, so good. I think all drinks should have some herbs mixed in.

My problem was the crowd. I am about to be totally superficial, but here goes: I tend not to enjoy hanging out with dudes who wear khaki blazers and jeans when going out drinking in the city on the weekend. Save it for the country club! Not for a bar in the Tenderloin! Same for the ladies: save the pearls for the country club! Not for a bar in the Tenderloin! There, I said it. The end. This place needs a better crowd. I'll do what I can.
author: Sahra H.

description:
Thank the lord! A place that isn't unberable on the weekend? Have I found salvation? I was able to play pool AND sit down at several different tables throughout the night. Parking was pretty easy to find, even on a Saturday night thank god. I should probably try to milk this place before it gets insane.

Drinks were a bit pricy but they were pretty tasty and decently strong. The bartenders serving them were fairly friendly.

The decor and interior made me feel a bit weird. It felt like an old loft / warehouse had been converted. But for a place that was pretty small, it was well laid out and felt roomy.
author: Alex C.

description:
+5 stars for a kick-ass Manhattan.
-2 stars for being so crowded at the narrow bar that 2/5 of this well-crafted cocktail ended up on some bro's shirt sleeve.
= 3 stars for my glass being 3/5 full.
And a A for my effort.
author: Leon R.

description:
I hesitate to even review this place, because it's so bland that I'm not sure I can say anything useful, funny, or cool about it.  I mean, the decor is nice and dark and it seems like a sleek Manhattan bar, but it strangely really has no ambiance.  It's good for like, a second date with that corporate guy that you don't really like that much, but he buys you drinks, and that's what dating is about, right?

It's not the kind of place I would go for a rocking good time, and if I'm trying to have a chi-chi sophisticated evening, I still wouldn't come here.  Especially because the glasses they serve cocktails in are so small that they have to fill them to the top, and you end up spilling half the vodka all over yourself.  Not because you're drunk, but because your name ain't exactly Grace.

Waste of time and money.  Stay only as long as John Q. Suit is sponsoring your alcoholism.  But don't get so drunk that you think it's a good idea to go home with him.  Do you really want to wake up to that in the morning?  No.
author: Coco D.

description:
A perfect spot for a small group of friends or Happy Hour. Delicious drinks made with fresh muddled fruit in a swank layout. Only one pool table, but plenty of standing room in this bar. The lighting is pretty dim and there are fun little couches and seats to cozy up. There's even a small corralled smoking area for those of you who like to light up!
The location is very key when you plan on stumbling over to Ambassador for a quick drink and a to sneak a few scenes of Casablanca that is usually playing on the wall.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Came here as part of a bachelor party after a really bad experience at Bourbon & Branch.

We were able to snag some tables for our group of eight and our server was awesome!

Managed to sample quite a bit of the menu that evening and everything I had was excellent.

I look forward to giving Rye more money in exchange for delicious cocktails.

I think my favorite of the night was the "Added Bonus".  Featuring egg white for foaminess and a basil leaf garnish.
author: Allen K.

description: Swanky vibe, outside smoking cage, free pool and Kumquats! What more is there?
author: Christy Z.

description:
If it were not for their restrooms, this place would have been given zero stars. I have never experienced such rude customer service before. DO NOT be deceived by the ambiance of the place, because the bar manager can turn that ambiance into something undesirable. 

I think the one star might come from the fact that there are no lines for the restrooms, but other than that, I do not see why it would have such good ratings for a place with such service. The bartender was nice, he did his job, but the bar manager seems to not understand what it means to be a decent human being. He can argue that it was done with good intention, which I do have to agree, but there is a limit to how someone treats people, especially customers. 

I came to this bar with a group of friends for a friend's 21st birthday. Without a doubt, the birthday girl is a bit more intoxicated than the rest of us, she got emotional. The bar manager came up to us without asking about anything whatsoever and simply just assumed the situation, told us that we could not place a drink in front of her, because she is beyond her limits. Who is he to tell us that she is beyond her limits, I am pretty sure we know our friend a bit more than he knows her. First, of all, we would not want our friend to be in danger, that would say something about us as friends, and second of all, she knows her limits, because she gets acid reflux when she drinks beyond her limits. So, therefore she will not pass out, in case the bar manager did not know, there is a difference between someone being emotional because they are talking, versus crying due to an over-consumption of alcohol. I did not expect him to understand, so we just took that warning, and we just sat there for a bit, but felt obligated to get another drink since we were taking space at the bar, so another friend went and ordered a shot, but was denied the shot. What type of bar is this?

Not only was she denied the drink, but the bar manager came up to us, and asked us to leave. The sad part was that we did not even attempt to retaliate, we were ready to leave, we (making sure that the birthday girl did not drink it, because that was the concern to the bar manager) just wanted to down the drinks that we have already ordered and paid for, as I was drinking the cocktail, the bar manager just snatched it away from me and said that we had to leave. There is something wrong with this picture, isn't is a violation to consumers' rights? Who does he think he is, or who does he think I am? I am pretty sure I am not 5 years old, since I am at a bar, and even if I were, he does not have the right to do what he did. 

ALSO, they did not check IDs, if any of us were not of age, they would have not done their job properly. SO before you go around trying to evaluate people's alcohol consumption, maybe try checking IDs, that would be a good start. 

Long story short, there is a reason why they had slow business, while The Ambassador across the street had lines.
author: Pandasha Y.

description:
Nice place:  great decor and an open layout that encourages minor exploration.  Good for groups, but not in an everybody-crammed-in-a-booth kinda way:  count on some people standing.  Good drinks and good service.  Swankier than the average bar, but skillfully negotiates its snot potential.  That being said, several pitchers of basil gimlet had been circulated amongst my party and may have dulled my neurosis.

Hot tip:  for a more mellow vibe, go on a weekday.
author: Yen P.

description:
Rye is a place I'd call groovy, if I ever decided to integrate "groovy" into my vocabulary more often.  The darkness here is somehow inviting rather than suspicious, and the cocktails plenty in styles and flavors.  

And the pool table is free!  And a patio for smoking!  A regular meeting spot for me and friends, the location is convenient and the crowd unpretentious.  Definitely one of my favorite places to get shitfaced.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
Let me preface this review with a quick story about the birthday girl who tried to sneak into the side door of Ambassador. Basically, this girl tried to sneak in the door when someone was leaving and the kick-ass bouncer grabbed her and told her (and 3 of her friends that tried to join her) that they couldn't get in.  He even shouted to the other bouncers and those 4 people were flagged for the rest of the night.  Pure awesome.

Came here on a saturday night after we couldn't get into Ambassador due to multiple birthday parties (ie. line too long), even after above birthday girl was kicked out of line.

The line at Rye wasn't all that long, and the bouncer, I believe his name was Quentin, (and his friend) were really friendly.  One of the friends of the aforementioned birthday girl apparently had been at Rye before so got in immediately, but the awesome Quentin told her dudeguy friend that he had to wait in line like every one else, cuz Quentin remembered the girl but knew that dudeguy friend was trying to fool him.  Uh-uh, Quentin's not gonna take that crap.  I was not-so-secretly smiling, mostly because I was next in line and freezing (even with a coat on!)

Anyway, once inside, the place was nice, though crowded near the bar.  We sat down (yeah, there was actually space) in the lower level but it was freakin' cold cuz the door to the outdoor smoking area kept opening.  Naturally, we left after getting tasty drinks that were not very expensive at all ($6 for soco w/ lime) so I was happy. Maybe too happy...

But no dancing, so we left for Le Colonial later on.

Still, the bouncer dude was cool. And I like tasty fruity drinks from Rye (costs around $10+ each)
author: Naoko M.

description:
I just reviewed another bar and said that I only ever get a glass of wine and thus can't talk about the drinks much. Also I usually don't drink too much, so I don't get drunk. 
BUT: here at Rye, this was all not true. The Basil Gimlets just blew me away, in a double sense. They tasted awesome and got me tipsy. And we had fun. This was yet another coworker party and I have since been wanting to go back. Also, this bar's got style.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Mama liked it a little too much.........head still hurts

********* You must try the flash it is fab! A wonderful mix of people in a hip but not stuck up setting. The bartenders are great.  A tip from me*
Have a few fancy drinks here, then go to King Ling across the street and order some yummy Chow main  and take it to the Geary Lounge. You will enjoy cheap food, cheap drink and an eyeful!
author: Douggers M.

description:
So I went here for a friends B.day on a Tuesday night. It wasnt hella busy or anything, BUT a MAJOR plus was the freindly/attractive/cool ass bartender Paul! Love him. Diego, another bartender who works there but was off for the night (I guess, because I never actually asked him) was hella cool too. I would go back just to chill with them. I got a lesson on real alcohol and Paul made a drink for me using egg whites. Sounds disgusting right, but it was made with love, and tasted like a smoothie. My advice is check out RYE + Paul and Diego!! It's a chill place, and they have a pool table and outside seating. 

and remember to tip! =))
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Wow, this place was much different than I expected and not in a good way. Stopped in around midnight I think on a Saturday night and was met by a bar that didn't seem to resemble anything in the pictures. A dirty bar devoid of anything pleasant in a big gray rectangle shaped room. In the back was a heavily stained and dying pool table and to my right a broken bathroom door on it's last legs. 

Beer selection? Pretty non-existent and nothing very good. No taps. When I asked the bartender just opened the fridge door and pointed at it. I ordered and sat down to contemplate my next destination while observing some sketchy people. One fellow was "falling over drunk" and kept using me to balance while he ordered another mixed drink at the bar. The bartender complied. WHY!? When a person is that drunk you don't give them another. Get them out-isn't that what you're paying the doorman for. The bartender looked like he was in college and a bit nervous. 

In summary, perhaps I goofed on the demographic here and type of place I was anticipating (I just turned 30 and I don't think I'd like this place unless I was in college and looking for a bit of grungy lounge in a shady area). I always grade fairly and tend to err on the positive side, but this place got everything wrong.
author: David G.

description:
Rye

Love it!  Like an oasis in the tenderloin!  Great place to grab a drink after work or on the weekends. It's never too crowded (or too quiet). The bartenders are very nice and there is a super cute chick bartender who will make you "a flash" (probably the most refreshing drink ever). It tastes like a spa!  They have a lot of fresh fruit drinks. The bartenders love to have you try their experiments --- never been disappointed. Even my marina loving friends were impressed! There is a pool table in the back and a covered area to smoke enclosed by what looks like a medieval porticullis .
author: All About Town ..

description:
Decor was cute, but a little bit sloppy.   Ditto the service: cute, but a little bit sloppy.

I habitually drink rye (straight, or maybe a little water), and was disappointed to find that Rye didn't have a visible whiskey list.  Plus, the bar staff seemed surprised to find me asking what ryes they had.

The reason:  this is a mixed-drink place.  I had a special creation rye sour with marmalade and egg white.  Nuanced, a little frothy, and not at all glue-like in my mouth.  Don't fear the egg white.

Nicely balanced sazerac, too.
author: Ethan M.

description: Maybe not a bad stop if you're trapped in the Tenderloin at 7pm on a weeknight, in need of a $15 cocktail. But otherwise a pretty banal experience. The bar interior says "chic" in a very straightforward way. The specialty drinks are each just a touch too elaborate and, based on the six cocktails my friend and I put away, prone to imbalance. (Not to mention pricey as hell, and none too strong.) On the positive side, our bartender was prompt, friendly, and skillful. The crowd early-evening was casual with a gratifying touch of hipster. But as mid-evening gave way to midnight, the crowd became decidedly younger and more awkwardly self-conscious. A formulaic sea of plunging necklines and tight black sweaters flooded the space. Hip-hop-inspired pop started thumpin' and the vibe settled into girls-just-wanna-have-fun vs. guys-just-wanna-get-laid. That's fine, whatever, but I found these people to be annoyingly aggressive at the bar.
author: Deano M.

description:
Came here to try the basil gimlet (#98 on the Big Eat list) and had the option of getting it with either gin or vodka. I opted for vodka since I cannot drink gin anymore (tooo many gin and tonics when I was in Scotland.. but that's another story). It was really intense with the basil flavor and wayyyyy overly sweet  that I just couldn't finish it. 

Other than that, it's a pretty nice space to chill with nice bartenders.
author: Sandy K.

description:
This place gets five stars because they always make my manhattan the same way.  I'm kinda picky.  I like it on the rocks, stirred, dry with rye or wheat whiskey and an orange twist instead of a cherry. Orange bitters and fancy vermouth is always nice but not required.  CONSISTANCY, folks, is fine whether it be by degree or kind. I've been to other much loved watering holes time and time again, first time they make it right, next time they shake the shit out of it, then a week later they serve it up with lemon, or stir so furiously with the spoon that it almost makes a Manhattan snow cone, and then dump four brandied cherries in it, or try to make it 'perfect,' or put maricino cherry juice instead of vermouth and forget the bitters.

The only place in the city that comes close is Absinthe, but the cool thing with Rye is each bartender will stir that cocktail so lovingly it sends goosebumps down my spine.  And they're not pretentious either.  They won't give you attitude if you correct them once the whiskey hits the shaker tin, cause they don't use the shaker tin and they don't have uh, attitude.... And I um, am being uh, redundant.

Go there.
author: Ashby U.

description: Highland Flip (see photo of menu) was killer. High-balls filled with swedish fish and m&ms make me happy. Great ambiance for catching up with friends over delicious ("Okay now try mine") cocktails.
author: Jen N.

description:
Here I was walking down on Geary when I saw Rye across the street. It was faily early, and my wife and I decided to cross the street and check it out. I immediately noticed "the cage" for the smokers and chuckled as we entered the bar. We sat at the bar and were promptly served by our bartender for the night, Paul. I apologize for forgetting what I had, but I can remember was how smooth it went down. Excellent attentive bartenders that engage you and ask your opinion on drinks, I love this place already. The sense of a small neighborhood lounge really came to play as the local started handing out chocolate and shared some with us. That is when I forgot I was still California. I would definetly recommend this spot as a stop over point on any crawl. Lounge area, coupled with a pool table, with downtempo music playing in the background, how can you go wrong. 

-cheers
author: Tewodros M.

description: Cut little place to hang in Noberloin. The bartenders are cool and you can expect a mixed crowd of people of all types...hopefully the next time I go back there they will have installed purse hooks at the bar...
author: Mimi T.

description: Stopped in last night for the first time last night and thoroughly enjoyed it.  Loved the space, which reminded me a lot of Seattle, so I felt at home.  Tried 4 drinks, 3 with rye and 1 with gin.  Really liked the Dogpatch and Sazerac.  The Pearl was fun, with sugar "pearls" in the glass.  Had one more drink with rye, but the Dogpatch was my favorite.  On a weekend night I am sure this place fills up.  But on a Wednesday evening, it was nice and quiet, and a good place to pass the hours with some of the best cocktails in town.
author: Peter L.

description:
I've always wanted to go have drinks at this place when they first opened up    with my ex but alas we never found the time to go after having a huge dinner... 

i was finally able to go tonight!!  I really enjoyed this lounge, good music, not too packed, nice people and good drinks.

I would come back to this place for sure!
author: monica s.

description: They've got whiskey, nice bartenders, and forward-thinking design sense. And it's more or less on my way home. This is all I really ask for in a bar. And there's an enclosed smoking patio. If I were a smoker I'd probably ask for that too.
author: matthew r.

description:
Stopped in for a quick drink with a friend before heading out dancing for the nite.  I could say that the low rating comes from the fact that I like places where u can dance more...but that's really not the case.

I actually used to live a couple blocks away from Rye and long wondered what the heck it was...finally going in I had somewhat high hopes for the places...it's got a pretty dope interior and a cool look to it...but that's about all I can say on the positive front.

Ordered a couple of drinks (vodka soda for me, gin & tonic for my homeboy) and both were pretty horrendous.  I was honestly surprised a vodka soda could be so bad.  The crowd was OK, the music was louder than it needed to be (um...what's up with lounges playing music so loud when people are trying to talk?)...and at the end of the day the venue is just a little off in a way I can't describe.
author: Looey P.

description:
This weekend was the second time I've been to Rye and finally decided to write a review.

Like the first time the place had an excellent atmosphere and was just awesome all around. The bar tenders are really nice and at least a few of them were quite knowledgeable. 

This place specializes in Whiskies and Scotches and carry a good amount of both.

The only reason this place isn't get 5 stars is because I ordered a Rye Whiskey "Neat" and the girl made it wrong :-\. She mixed my whiskey with ice then drained the ice out... So i got watered down whiskey which made me sad but it was still good... Just would have been better if it had been neat (no ice, water etc just straight whiskey/scotch).
author: Lauren V.

description: One of my favorite places to end a night!  The cocktails are fresh and amazing(!!!), the bartenders friendly, the music loud enough to bust a small move...
author: Heidi K.

description:
Rye is the home of my new favorite cocktail -- the black and blue, which includes muddled boysenberries and blackberries with vodka and lemonade. tasty!  The basil gimlet was also a super way to enjoy a hot San Francisco night.

Tip the bartenders well, those drinks are labor intensive and aren't easy to make!
author: Heather C.

description:
Close to 4 1/2 stars.  I'll make my review quick since there are so many great reviews.

I ordered the Rye Manhattan- it was excellent.
The bartender was fun and friendly.
The crowd was laid back and cool.
The space was comfortable and the atomsphere was pitch perfect.

I went on a Wednesday early evening.  I hear it gets crowded on the weekends which would I think would def take away some of the atomsphere.  I can't imagine enjoying this place as much if I didn't have a seat.
author: Peter H.

description:
Oh Quince, please don't hate me....maybe I came here on an "off" night....but really? 

Atmosphere
Dark, sort of tavern feeling with a cage wall....yes, a cage....Rather small and crowded with the potential for a neighborhood gem. Pool table, lounge area, top 40 music....

The Service
Normally I don't rate service unless it is very bad, or very good....To begin with, the cocktail waitress took our drink orders, took 45 min to bring back "our" drinks, all of them were wrong, and all of them had sadly spilled out on her tray to a level that was less than half full, and the bill was for six drinks, when we had in fact, ordered three. 
Upset by the service, I decided to get my next drink from the bar, which I waited at for another 45 min.... having three bartenders see me, ignore me, and then tell me I was in the way. 
The ONLY saving grace of Rye is the bouncer Quince.... thank you for making me laugh, remembering my name, and being the saving grace of Rye.

***Note*** because everyone else seems to love this place, and I live in the neighborhood, I may give it a second chance....however, I really hope I was there on an "off" night, because if not...wow
author: Bianca L.

description:
BASIL GIMLET=AMAZING

nice decor, high ceilings, good looking crowd, decent music, very interesting drinks that the bartenders are skilled in making.  the rockin' rye is also delicious.
author: asia c.

description: Love their Cucumber mix! I have 5 one nite and it was memorable. Drinks are a little expensive ($10 per drink) but it's worth it if u have extra $$$ to spare.
author: Do L.

description:
The good: 1. Pool table. 2. The plucky bartender, Jennifer. She's attentive and has got drinkie-making skillz. And teasing me for my villainous laugh is pretty damned cool. I instructed her and my crew: "The key is to put your fists on your hips and tilt your head back and reach deep into your belly and expel." "BWAAAHAHAHA!!" we bellowed in unison.

I want to like this place, and have swung by several times now. However, other than the cool staff, the place doesn't really set itself apart from other SF bars. You would think that the different niches in Rye would make the place inviting: the pool table, the bar, the booth by the entrance, the lounge a few steps down from the bar, the outdoor cage. But I've never felt compelled to take a seat and drop anchor for the night, the musty dark colors make the confines feel empty and cold rather than welcoming. I consider this is a layover spot for other Nob locales.
author: dave y.

description:
Wow, very slick.  I am a bourbon drinker, and my drink is a Manhattan, and Rye makes a very good Manhattan.  A large group of us came here for deaf happy hour - we're a circle of friends that are all deaf and we have Happy Hours at a new bar every month.
