beautiful bar with nothing else going for it. limited seating, clueless bartendress. would be great for a pre-theater drink, but they weren't open that early. if you want to stand around wondering why you aren't at the other bar that you like so much better, this is the place.

by the way, just cuz i'm feeling bitchy: rosewood is pathetic and romolo is like a month's supply of ambien so these guys are zero for three.
author: Stinky M.

description: I came here once a while back and had that basil martini (?) or gimlet (?).  I don't remember, it had basil in it though.  It was pretty good, but I have to say I enjoy mojitos better.  We were a huge party and they had great/quick service.  I had a great time and would definitely go back again.
author: F K.

description: I've been debating creating a Yelp account to write reviews but last night's outing to Rye did it for me.  Some might consider me somewhat alcoholic so how the hell have I never been here!?!?  After reading multiple reviews about how great the drinks at Rye are a couple friends and I decided to try it out for ourselves.  The place is definately on the smaller side and both the crowd and the music are decent but the bartenders are super sweet and the drinks are awesome.  I had the basil gimlet, blackberry lemon drop, and multiple drinks with strawberry and elderflower ...all of which were AMAZING...I even told the guy standing next to me at the bar that he was missing out by sipping on a Stella!  The drinks were so great I don't even remember my meal next door at Osha... Rye, you did me good and I'll  definately be back for more!
author: laura q.

description: I love this new hip bar in "the Tender Nob"!  Pool table and sheek ambience, perfect for me to stumble home from.
author: Gemma P.

description: Have been here a few times and finally writing a review. This again is another place where they take care in making their cocktails. Nice menu of drinks and they also have wait service which is kinda nice since the place gets so packed its hard to move around. They have an enclosed caged smoking patio that faces out into the street for the smokers. Kinda funny since there are tables out there so some people just plant themselves out there.
author: Hyung L.

description: This place has really picked up! A few months back it was usually no more than 5 people at the bar.  The drinks are great, the staff is great and the crowd is pretty damn cool.  It's also a good location if your looking to rent out space for a private party.
author: Vanessa A.

description: why werent these bars in nob hill when i lived there? oh well anyway i have say its a pretty cool place people can be both down to earth and trendy but the place is set up kinda cool and drinks were pretty good and avg priced. The company i had with me noticed that the floor was on the ceiling :) ceiling is a really beautiful hard wood panel and the floor is cement with a drain...interesting. :)
author: Farrah S.

description:
This bar/lounge is definitely one of the cooler places in SF.  If you're someone that appreciates a well crafted cocktail with super fresh ingredients - go to Rye Bar!  My first time there was around midnight on a Friday for a friend's birthday.  I was pretty bummed when we got  there because there was a line and I abhor super packed bars.   But I was pleasantly surprised that the line moved pretty fast and it wasn't too packed inside (I hate when bars fill the place so that you can't move).  I had a dirty martini and my boyfriend got an old fashioned, both were awesome. 

I went again last weekend on a Saturday night around 10 pm.  The place only had a handful of people in it and we were able to enjoy cocktails and play pool in the back.  I had a mint julep - so yummy!  Watching the bartenders make drinks is very cool.  The place isn't cheap, but it's not NYC prices.  

Also, it's true that the the bar is a few blocks from some of the seedier parts of SF, but both times I went I was able to hail a cab quite quickly from right outside the bar. (This is a rare feat in SF).
author: Katie S.

description: Ditto what everyone's said. Absolutely loooove all the Barneclo paintings--very Shag-ish. And the vodka Gimlets--yum. Sugary and sour, purrfect.
author: Genevieve R.

description: Modern and warm and inviting.  Small and intimate.  Tables to sit at and space to stand in.  Good strong drinks.  Nothing about the place sets it apart from anywhere else yet at the same time, I liked it enough to want to keep on coming back.  Free pool, outdoor smoking area if you smoke...... bar staff that knows how to make drinks and they know how to make you feel comfortable.  Good enough for me.
author: Denise B.

description: Great bar in the Nob Hill/Tenderloin area. Made a good scotch recommendation. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Joshua S.

description: Stooped by for a drink the other day as i waited for my take out order to be prepared next door @ OSHA. Nice place. i was intrigued by the cage surrounding the smoking area. The drinks were prepared pretty well and at a okay price. I can see how this place can get packed being that its so small. The pool table for some reason seemed smaller than a regulation sized table. Bartenders were nice and attentive. I would recommend this place to start off a night. I don't know if i would make a night out of it due to size.
author: Alfredo N.

description: You have to love the Tender Nob!  I keeps the out of town people away to a certain extent.  This place is not even a year old I think.  I always meet cool people when I come here.  It is a good place for a last drink or a first, not really a destination.   My first time here was on a pub crawl with Amanda H :)
author: rachel c.

description: A crackhead stole my $1k Flat Head Japanese baseball jacket here.  Never again.
author: Kiya B.

description:
Review by non-expert, not-easily-impressed, non-bargoer (viz., me):
Rye the other Wednesday was perfect.  I don't go out for drinks.  I don't stop for a drink after work.  Invited there by beloved work colleagues, I  still shuddered at the ridiculous names of cocktails being ordered.   The very alert, calm, friendly bartender-owner John asked me what I'd like.  "Not your problem but I'm not much for mixed drinks...a lightweight on top of that.  I guess I'd normally order some European aperitif."  "OK," he said calmly, "let me give that some thought."  Before long I had a beautiful, fragrant, decent-colored cocktail.  "It's a Negroni."
Well, of course.  He had sized me up perfectly.  "How did you know I'd lived in Italy for 5 yrs in the 1980's?"   John is the best, the place is without drama, calm, edgy-civilized, unpretentious.  I'd go again and even order something unpronounceable or something sounding like a Harry Potter sequel, knowing I'm in safe hands.
author: Mark S.

description: I usually wander over here for drinks when the crowd at Redwood Room is not to my liking.  Unfortunately, I wished this happen more often since a couple of cocktails at the RR makes me lose my senses.  That's what keeps my life interesting though.  However, everytime I stumble into Rye, I wonder why I don't come back here more often since I really like the bar.  The entrance is a bit obscure and the gated front patio has a touch of gritiness and blends in well with its neighborhood.  I love the drink menu, and their espresso based martini is one of my favorites in the city.
author: Amy Z.

description: Rye is a pretty solid bar, especially if you are into whisky and/or designer cocktails.  I'm a fan of their old school bourbon old fashioned.  There is a good amount of seating in the place, and the smoking cage in the front is a unique feature.  I guess it keeps patrons safe from the random loonies in the tenderloin, but isn't that half the fun of drinking in the area?
author: Scott K.

description: OK, I have to give Greg props for listening to his customers, I put up a review where I said it was very cold and bare inside, and since then the place has gotten way better.  They have put up paintings and heating, the music is kept at a good level, and the general environment is cool.  I hope Rye does great!
author: Cassio P.

description:
I love a bar with good lighting.
Not so bright as to lose the mood, yet not so dark you could end up french kissing a vampire.
This place has good - dare I say great? - lighting.
I was there last night for a friends "I quit my job and they can go f**k themselves" get together. The crowd was attractive and well dressed. Good mix of men and women (does that mean anything to me?) and the bartenders were really friendly. I was ordering drinks and mulling over what to order my non-alcohol drinking friend other than soda. The bartender made some great suggestions, made him a drink that looked like a cocktail but wasn't and made the him feel like one of the crowd. I found the fact that she took the time to make suggestions and be very friendly about it, even though the bar was packed, to be a nice change from the brusque attitude you usually get from bartenders in that situation. If you sit in one of the booths, there is a cocktail waitress and for you smokers (cough cough hack weez) the smoking area is kind of cool. Drinks are excellent. The bartender made us some crazy shots with pomegranate juice and pomegranate liqueur and something else. Crack, maybe, since they tasted so good.
Check this place out.
author: Jamie M.

description:
I was sitting outside the bar in the smoking den.  it's not as much a den as it is just a steel cage on the sidewalk of the tenderloin. Tom, the original Tom Green, was talking about what a great married living situation it would be for him right there on the street, in a cage.  

     he said, "yeah.. I could live out here and she could live in there." 

     we laughed, all knowing that it may actually be a great spot for him, this cage. 

     he said, "I'll shit over there in the corner and just spray it off with a hose." 

     Eric asked, "what would you use to hose it off, Tom?" 

     Tom replied, "hell, I'll shit over there in that corner!" 

     Eric interrupted Tom's scowled expression as Tom sat hunched over and pointing with an index finger at the corner and said, "you could fling your shit, Tom.  you could fling it across the street" and again, we all laughed.

     Tom continued, "yeah, hell man, you could put a tire swing out here" and as he was saying this, looking up languorously, an effortless vision arose in all of us featuring Tom swaying back and forth hanging onto a braided rope, hanging on with one hand, his feet resting atop a beat up BF Goodrich knobby tread tire.  we were envisioning him swinging around like a great ape, flinging shit out onto Geary street.  

     Eric was smoking a cigarette and I was watching Tom sway back and forth with a dark and stormy in my hand.  I had on a hoodie.  it was one of those nights when everyone recognizes you and says things like, "so, you're Ben's Dad!  I know Ben from when his company was sued by some other big company, something about trade secrets."  it was one of those nights when the bartender kisses you right on the mouth and mountains move and the particles creating blank space try to hold strong together, swimming around the room. 

     I guess it was about 1:30 when we managed to leave the bar.  I walked courageously, laughingly stumbling all the while, out into oncoming traffic to summon a cab.  we got into the cab and while being attacked by the rubber lining of the door I said, "hey man, your car is falling apart".  Tom leaned over childishly and whispered, "ma'am - not man".  

     I looked up and I saw one eyeball, her right eyeball, and a pair of cherry red lips glancing back at me with indifference from the rear-view mirror.  I named the cross-streets and she drove off.  we went an interesting and new direction, one that I may have refuted at 1:30 PM with a clear head but at that moment, we did not give a fuck.  we laughed at nothing (nothing, being things like direction or red lights or a man with a boom box and a headband strolling up McAllister).  

     it didn't matter to us. we were on the cusp of this night.  we were riding it the way we've always known to ride it, not forgetting where we came from.  that is exactly the thing that got us here.  that got us out here to California, and it was never an easy ride.  leaving is never easy.  poking your head through some doorway, looking to both sides before entering not knowing if something is coming at you or not is never easy.  but there we were, exiting the cab toward the curb so we didn't get run over in the middle of the street.  the crazies were out.  we were them.  we were tough and knew it, and therefore did not go looking for it.  we were hungry but not tired.  we were full of what it is to be jazz.  we were proud, and we were back. there is no changing that.  not tonight or any other night.  we were swept away by a blood lust haze of fog gathered in the street lights of the lower haight.  

     and so we were granted entrance into the night, the true night as it were, by that little brick encrusted bar at geary and leavenworth.  without the spiral, there wouldn't be a ride and soon, without fail, I will be right there at the gate of that steal lined wooden door to get my ticket from a man named Q wearing a stocking cap and a smile.  I will order strong beverages from the beautiful people behind the bar and I'll be at the helm once again, knowing what it is to float above normalcy.
author: Benjamin G.

description: Basil gimlet?  Spot on, actually.  It's not hard to find a drink in SF with this kind of creativity, but I've rarely pursued a second.  Or third.  Is it hot in here?  I digress... Rye's candlelit hues personalize its modern space, which atones for tight pushthrough corridors and raspy-voice-next-morning loud music.  But basil, yes, you had me at basil... as long as my wallet stays heavy, at least.
author: MScott S.

description: Although I've only been here once, my first impression was a great one, and I will be going back soon. The scene was quality for a Wednesday evening, with speedy service at the bar and delicious drinks to accompany it. The interior itself was very classy and modern, and the size was intimate with plenty of elbow room. This place is definitely 5 star potential - I'll just need to go back once more to confirm my thoughts..
author: Melanie K.

description: I was debating about 3 or 4 stars. On the one hand, awesome cocktail's I consider myself a connoisseur.  Get their cocktails especially  from Jen the best bartender ever. Besides me of course jk. It was always a good fall back place on slow nights in the city. Haven't been there in awhile until recently. I always forgot all the douches drinking tecates around me. Leave it up to a yup to drink a beer when the place has some of the most interesting and tasting cocktails all around. But seriously it is  a really cool place to talk and sip cocktails if you are inclined not to party like Eddie Murphy's girl.
author: Chris L.

description: What a well designed space...cozy lounging area, bar and decor...Martinis- well made, neat and icy cold- could have used a bigger glass- but hey- Im not complaining...Luv the vintage music videos on the exposed brick wall...after the second one i was singing to Journey's "Don't stop believin' "...great place to start your evening...
author: Arissa C.

description: A nice chills spot.  Friendly waitress.  Clean restroom.  Didn't get too crowded.  If I smoked I would've loved that patio.. its spacious.  I liked that they showed Goonies on the brick wall.  But I got sleepy since there isn't any dancing.. but its nice to chill with friends.  The music just wasn't my taste.
author: Marcia D.

description: Rye is a great, chill cocktail lounge.  They have an excellent selection of creative house drinks and a couple of daily specials that run 10$ a pop.  They're maybe a little too excited about egg whites - after three drinks, I'd felt like I'd eaten breakfast - but everything we had was delicious.  It can get pretty full on the weekends, but Thursdays are perfect.
author: Stephen D.

description: This was the best bar full of amateurs I have ever been to. Also Irene the chick that got slapped in Real World from Seattle was there, sadly I did not get to slap her.
author: Allan R.

description: I actually do like Rye and have been there multiple times. But you just cannot make somebody wait 20 min for a drink. What's the whole purpose of a bar then? This weekend it happened again for the second time. I might just give it one more try though. And that is only for the fun I somehow end up having there.
author: Doro P.

description:
Holy crap. It 's bad when you get free drinks at this place. You won't remember much the next morning except ordering about two dozen basil gimlits. In fact, I honestly have no idea what this bar looks like except that there is a pool table in the back, and that's only because I spilled my third drink all over it. 

I don't know what the hell they put in those basil gimlits, but I do remember the bartender spending a hella lot of time making each one. And they tasted pretty damn good and got me so plastered that I sorta regret even going here. Still, you have to give a place credit when it turns preparing drinks into an art form.
author: Hmmm W.

description: Great place to stop by when you're bar-hopping in the Tenderknob.  Can get crowded during the weekends, but what place isn't?  Cool crowd.
author: Mike K.

description: After figuring out that the gigantic mirror wasn't another room, I was able to really enjoy my "peach of my yelp" drink.  Good stuff.  I like the lay-out of this place...the walls on the lower level (as in five stairs lower) lined with low tables and chairs, booth seats on the upper level.  The bar is long and the bartenders are efficient and friendly.  Not only did the giant mirror dazzle me for awhile, but so did the wall-of-wine.  Of course sharing my first Rye experience with the Yelp crowd helped!  I'll be back though...It's dangerously close to my home.
author: ellyk E.

description: From what I remember of my Saturday night here, I really enjoyed this place.  We went for a friend's birthday and I really appreciate that she was able to reserve a table and only needed to purchase 1 bottle (and not a $300 bottle of vodka).  Nice decor and good service too.  I ordered a glass of wine that came after everyone else's drinks and they gave it to me without charging for it because they said the bottle wasn't chilled enough...and I don't even remember waiting that long.  PLUS, the glass was probably more like 2 1/2-3 glasses of wine and THAT, my friends, is probably why I don't remember the rest of my night......
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Because it was my birthday I will go ahead and be a bit more generous with my experience at Rye.  I think my expectations were just overly inflated and from the exterior it seemed pretty awesome.  Upon entering my inflated balloon quickly started to deflate.  Dirty tables and general lack of ambiance.  I must say the brick exposed walls helped warm up the space (strange I know), and certain corners seemed cozier than others.
But on to the drinks.  Basil Gimlet is where its at!  Well...I have had better at the Alembic ;) but this one was pretty darn tasty.  I ended up ordering the special of the week next, which was some kind of habanero/tequila concoction....good, but not nearly as spice licking as I wanted it to be....I have had habanero infused drinks before and they have left my lips tingling as they should!
All in all....Rye....you are a decent bedfellow, while the serious bf is away, but other than that....its a no go.
author: Sheila Y.

description: Basil gimlet and blackberry lemon drops were very close to my chick-drink loving heart. The bar itself is very cool- lovely leather booths with flickering candles, bird cage-esque smoking area, nice wine display. My only complaint is that they don't take credit cards and the closest ATM is in a liquor store across the street. When the drinks cost $8 a pop, taking credit cards or having an ATM inside is necessary. UPDATE- Credit card machine is going in ASAP so good for my blackberry loving self, bad for my liver.
author: Noelle Q.

description:
Great hip yet chill vibe - tall dark space with a pool table in back, and a passable amount of seating, with the bar on display in the middle, with a big rack of the top shelf booze the clear focus of attention.  Then entrance is terrifically understatedly swank - just a solid sheet of wood that slides off to the side of the door, with 'rye' in subtle metal lettering on its surface.  There's also a reasonably sized "smoker's cage" that's separated from the bar by a big glass wall and door, and quite literally caged off from the sidewalk, but it's under cover so those who need to light up won't get rained on.  Nice touch.
Drinks are fantastic and truly expertly made.  The sazerac is utterly delicious - but don't let them serve it on the rocks; the ice cuts the pleasant rich sweetness and leaves it tasting bitter.  Straight up, it's whiskey paradise in a glass.  And while the drinks aren't exactly cheap, they're also not as supremely overpriced as those across the street at the Ambassador.
Highly recommended.
author: Don H.

description: When my friends and I want to go out but don't want to go far where we live, so this place is our first list.  The drinks are good and the bartenders are friendly.
author: Sasitorn O.

description: they played the best music tonight! did i hear the smiths? Jenn and lorie- laurie-lorrie-=sweet as ever
author: Noel J.

description: I was introduced to Greg and John over my bar, a little over a year ago, from the infamous Owen Dunn, Where is Mr. Dunn can anyone spread a little know all?  I miss the Ramones Shirt and his quirky bar shananagan's.  Back to the review...meeting these two cats I got a particular vibe from these two gentleman.  Poised and polite, and to themselves the way I always try to be when I am out on the town.  I never really frequented their other two venues, do to my work schedule, but now that Rye's now a stones throw away from my drink-slinging establishment, This is officially my checkpoint toll on my way home from work, Great job gentleman, on the this soon to be popular joint.
author: jonathan b.

description: Was it the lights?  The music?  The super fun combo of old friends and new friends?   Whatver it was, I had the best time.  Happy hour until eight.  Best part, meeting fellow yelpers Kancha and Patti!  This bar is a hit!
author: Amme P.

description: Cute bar. Good ambience.  Everyone seems to know everyone here.  I felt alittle underdressed. I figured we were going to a bar on a Wednesday night, staying in work clothes would be okay but it looks like everyone went home and got dolled up.  It was still poppin' at 130am on a Wednesday Night... Why was I even there at 130am on a wed nite when i live 45 minutes away and have work in 6 hours!!  I would come back again.
author: Kymberli C.

description: This isn't really my scene, but I came here with a bunch of dudes who like whiskey and scotch. Having said that, I could not pass up the opportunity to go to a place called "rye." In any case, I was impressed with their array of scotches and whiskeys, but preferred to stick with a Jim Beam and ginger after downing a couple scotches too fast. The music was alright; actually I was pleasantly surprised that they played things like Goldfrapp, Ladytron and The Knife. The crowd....very Marina-esque. No thanks. That that was my major dislike and probably why I wouldn't come back...on a weekend night, at least.
author: Veronica W.

description: My friends were raving about the drinks, but I had wine as hard alcohol and I are no longer friends, their wine and beer selections were ok-but I guess this more of a bourbon bar. I though it was a little too hip for it's own good. It's a cool space, but there was only one person tending bar, and no one tending to the tables of people. It's a place I would go back to, but if I don't...oh well.
author: Leesa P.

description: Cool place to check out in the tendernob....It seemed out of place from the street, but it has a really nice and relaxed ambience. I enjoyed my $9 mixed drink and the eye candy that was there
author: Shaun O.

description: It began to get crowded around ten on a Saturday night and there were not a lot of places to sit or stand comfortably, but the cocktails are phenomenal.
author: Helena K.

description: What a cool and pleasantly-designed bar to hang out at. Not just that but the place was filled with beautiful yet unpretentious people. Maybe I got lucky that night since it was for a friend's birthday but honestly, this place doesn't seem to carry any attitude. Even all the bartenders worked their asses off to get everyone served as quickly as possible... and it was PACKED when I was there. I would've loved it even more if I was still a smoker and got to enjoy the outside smoking area. I would come hang out here any day of the week.
author: James C.

description: It's a bit tony, but I love this place.  Their cocktails are really inventive (try the Basil Gimlet for example), and the ambience is great (love the wood).
author: Buzz A.

description:
i joke with my friends that rye bar is where you wait while your other friends are holding your spot in line at ambassador.
but really great bar, nice outside smoking are, good drinks, nice bartenders, and reasonable drinks. wish it was a little bigger place though. the square footage kinda sucks.
author: Ryan B.

description: I love this bar. Great drinks, awesome bar tenders. A must-stop if you are in the "trendyloin." I definitely recommend this spot for a chill drink and cool atmosphere. Much better than Ambassador across the street.
author: eric h.

description: We walked in, and turned around and walked out. The bouncer looked more interesting than all the boring people inside.
author: Katherine B.

description: The sexiest guys you'll find in the universe hang here....I'm going back!
author: JO Y.

description: the basil gin gimlet is hands down one of the best drinks i have had! So good, when you sip it tastes sweet then is washed down with the taste and aroma of the fresh basil completing your sip so perfectly. I can not wait to go back to try their other drinks, watching the bar tender sold me on how talented a bartender can be. I really enjoyed the bar itself to, great vibe and really friendly people working. If only it were closer to my apt i would come here all of the time.
author: Barbara C.

description: Adding a star to my original review because I had the basil gimlet (stop #4 on my Bon Voyage, San Francisco tour) and I wouldn't say that I'm a huge basil fan but I'll be damned if that cocktail didn't make me wish for some tomatoes and mozzarella to go with it.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: We headed here on my birthday after dinner at Brick and I thought it made a good dinner/drinks combination for an evening.  I thought the crowd was nice and the owners were really accommodating for our group.  But the decor was a little more industrial than I was expecting.  I liked it here, but I'm not sure there's anything super special to push it to 4 stars.  Maybe three and a half.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Definitely a neighborhood gem. There's plenty of seating in the modern interior and also a patio/cage-like outdoor seating. I've been on a Monday (don't ask), Wednesday and Friday, and every time the place was buzzin'. I hate mojitos, but Rye whips up a really good one! It's worth the wait, trust me.
author: Natalie T.

description: They nailed it. What a gem in the T.L/Nob. Pool table/smoking area/lounge and very modern decor. What more can you ask for. The drinks are priced right and the fresh fruit and garnish is a good addition to the drink menu.
author: Teddy d.

description: Went here on a Monday night, and was IM...PRESSED! The feel of this place is fantastic, and it was packed with a variety of attractive but mellow, generally chill patrons who filtered in and out throughout the night. A free, chilled out mini pool table in the back, amazing basil gimlets...ummm, what more could you want on a Monday night? Agree with Julianne, the bartender was super nice, completely non-arrogant...very unexpected for such a stylish place!!
author: Ryan B.

description: Wow. Talk about excellent cocktails made from fresh and  unique ingredients. Went last Wed. for the BF's midweek birthday and, as a bartender of sorts himself, he was impressed! Not to mention, the bartender, Jennifer (I believe) was so personable and fun to talk to.  Its nice to go somewhere were bartenders take their cocktail-making seriously.
author: Dee I.

description: Plainly, I like the drinks, people, and interior, while I don't like the neighborhood or the smoking cage. It's also an easy escape from the Ambassador if you find yourself in that unfortunate situation.
author: Kim S.

description: This placed seemed like a see and be seen bar - well lit. No memorable music. Outside area for smoking. I guess if you live in the neighborhood it might be a good place to hang and stumble home from. Otherwise, seemed a little ho-hum to me. Kinda cool tho that Osha Thai is right next door for the after drinking, late night food craving!
author: Kimi N.

description: You can't really hate anything about this place. It's hip, charming, cool. Great cocktail list. Great ambiance. I'm thinking this might be a great venue to celebrate a birthday in a chillax way.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Awesome bar - excellent drinks and cool courteous staff.  Best crowd I've seen in SF so far. Great to mingle and talk with friends, not much of a dancing place. Freshest mojitos outside of Havana.
author: Julio V.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet..I love this bar, I come here all the time, love the cool feel of the space, the pool table, and Greg is an amazing bartender/cocktail chef always using fresh ingredients to create unique cocktails..I love ordering a drink and being surprised with something he whips up...oh yeah, and I love Brian's artwork on the walls too.
author: Brenda D.

description: Very architectural in ambiance, and great for an early drink when you still want to talk with your friends.
author: Laurel B.

description: Omg.  Basil gimlet.  I hate gin-- no really, I HATE gin.  But Erica talked Colleen into getting a basil g, and next thing you know...well let's just say the night got started.  Bonus pts for playing AC/DC AND Snoop in the same set.  Sweet!
author: Sheila W.

description: Nice little place, very crowded, loud music and alcohol... what else could you ask for from a bar?  Well good drinks are usually a plus.  Hubby was crazy over the Basil Gimlets and since then can't stop talking about them.  On the other hand I was not so impressed with them, somehow they seemed a little sweet for me.  What the hell is wrong with me?  I think I am loosing my sweet tooth... HELP, I must seek help now!
author: Agnes K.

description: Here's a bar that thinks it's too cool for you. I just moved about a block away and always heard it was cool from my bartender friends, but I've doubt anyone's been in there lately. It may "look" cool, but it ain't. $8 for a happy hour well drink? Am I in a f*cking hotel bar? I guess so, they gave me a paper receipt. Thanks for wasting paper, jerk-offs. But, I guess their main clientele are visiting gudgers from other cities with expense accounts and the hipster-Goorin-hatted-gudger bartenders (who likely refer to themselves as mixologists) got tired of printing out individual receipts, so they give them to everyone. As I sat there "enjoying" my $8 drink, I heard them talking about the bad Yelp reviews of this place. I'm not surprised. This is not a friendly bar. They suck. A terrible happy hour. There are so many choices within a few blocks that are cooler/hipper/more affordable/etc. Go elsewhere. Unless you're a gudger who loves to impress people with how much you spend on "faux-artisinal" drinks. Enjoy!
author: Jason G.

description: Great space, the lower area feels like a library and the smokers cage makes you feel like you may be on the street, and hell who does love interacting with the upstanding street folk of the TL ?
author: Eagan I.

description: Visited after seeing some of their drinks profiled in the Chronicle. Was a good experience. Welcoming atmosphere. Creative cocktails. Had the Basil Gimlet that was featured in the newspaper. Was very pleased with it.  Also enjoyed the free pool table.
author: Tim G.

description: This place always seem to be a meeting place for me and my friends,  Its chill and everyone seems cool.  My favorite part of this bar is the little smoking area, I love a bar where I can still hold my drink and have a cigg.  And if your not from San Francisco, try not to venture below Geary
author: Rossi C.

description: The bartenders here are really nice, the drinks are reasonably priced, and the atmosphere is unpretentious. In my mind, that makes for the perfect bar.
author: Georgia R.

description:
A group of girlfriends and I gathered here a few weeks ago for a night of wine and good conversation -- Rye was perfect for both.  If you get there around 9, which I realize only old people like me do, you can grab one of the nice tables and have a server tend to you all night.  The atmosphere is nice, with mellow light and decent music.  The crowd started out mellow as well, but became a little obnoxious as the evening progressed.  No worries though, it filtered out again after about 11.  Prices are on the high side for SF, but for what it is, they are reasonable.  Certainly a nice addition to the area.

Bottom Line: cool space, cool drinks, cool bar -- especially if you come early (or very late).
author: L G.

description: This is a awesome place! The drinks are creative and taste great. The staff is friendly and funny.  This place has it all!
author: Mari M.

description:
We went in and ordered gin and tonics and ended up sampling 5 concoctions that one of the bartenders was working on for a competition that ends tonight.  They were going down smooth with no mixers.  Woohoo!  
Now I have the hiccups probably cause I just wolfed down the cannoli from Angel Cafe across the street.
author: Ryan K.

description:
...with an emphasis on big flavors and fresh seasonal ingredients...

It sounds like a restaurant, no? Well, heads-up foodies, this is your bar.

10 years ago, bars that served mojitos with fresh, muddled mint were rare delights. It can be had almost everywhere now.

Well, Rye has one-upped everyone with a mise en place that probably confuses their supplier.

My first friend had a recipe that included muddled strawberries, rosemary simple syrup and egg whites. It was served to him, giggling, in a champagne flute. He was almost annoyed at first, until he tried it. He finished it fast, but not because he was embarrassed.

I had a "Thai me up" with thai basil and peach puree. It was less tasty, but no less interesting - I ate too much of the chile pepper that was supplied as a garnish.

I had another buddy order his standard, a "plain-ole" manhattan which he quickly declared one of the best he'd had.

The staff is amazingly friendly. With the wealth of knowledge they so easily display, it would be such an easy misstep into snobbery. No way. They'll explain each and every drink they make, but If you just want some whiskey on the rocks, it's served with a smile.

I asked a different barkeep if the dark syrup he was using was made with turbinado sugar and he quietly spoke to me at length about how he liked the flavor but he found it muddied some other drinks.

I wish I could remember everything he said, but all of a sudden, I was tipsy. It sneaks up on you at Rye. Everything tastes so good, there's no nausea to warn you of your impending liquor limit.

Another example of their uncomprising search for flavor - they won't stock popular drinks for popularity's sake. I heard one customer ask for a Corona - he was handed a can of Tecate instead with assurances it was better. I asked for a Red Stripe and was given a Sessions with the same guarantee. Risky? Not if you know what you're doing like Rye does.

Don't go if: you just want to get your drink on at peak hours. These cocktail masterpieces take time to make and the two-man bar is often backed up three levels deep.

Extra-Something. I'ts right next to Osha, some of the best Thai food in the city. A great one-two punch.
author: Asdf A.

description: I might be the last yelper to hit this place, but I'd still love to add my 2 cents. Went on The New Friday (aka Tuesday) when seats were plentiful, but I could see the place more slammin towards the end of the week. I have to give props to the Dark & Stormy which revealed I have a current penchant for anything ginger. Mango Crush was refreshing but not enough alcohol for my saturated taste buds. I think it would be smart to steer clear of the "creative" cocktails and go with the "classics" here if your purpose is to truly drink - and honestly what else is there to do to celebrate The New Friday?!
author: Ferol G.

description: Two words...BASIL GIMLET! Nothing compares, really nothing at all!
author: Rose K.

description:
wow, wow, and wow.  i haven't had a drink-gasm like this in ... a long long time.  i think part of why i loved this place is because we went on a sunday night when it was mellow and not crowded.  we got a chance to sit at the bar and chat with the lovely lauri (lori?) - we also met erica, who eventhough she wasn't working, was still hanging out there. i think that says a lot right there.

so atmosphere aside-the drinks were great.  i came in and told lauri i wanted something coffe-esque. she suggested the drink that won their last mixing competition.  not sure what it's called, but there's a reason it won! it's got starbucks liquer, chocolate, horchata, tequila, and a bunch o'other yummalicious goodness.  AND the guy who designed the drink came in later, and when lauri made it for him, he was pleased.  yes, i'd haveta say the bartenders know their stuff.  

it was soooo good i (who loves to try anything new) actually ordered it again - but by then they were out of chocolate syrup =(.  so i was forced to have some sort of honeydew, melony thing.  don't worry, it was divine too.
author: Alexis W.

description: I came here on a saturday night, and was feeling it at first. The exposed brick, the double level, nice lighting, decent music, outside smoking area. Then it got crowded...really f'ing crowded at the bar. The service is slow...bartenders need to pick up the pace cuz it'll take you 30 min to get a drink. ...you'll lose your buzz just waiting.
author: Loe B.

description: I checked this place out with a group of girlfriends, and I must say... this place has everything you need. Fun bartenders, cozy decor, enuf seating, and great location.  However, I question the condiments that are in cups that are flushed with the bar... I wonder if they ever get contaminated?
author: Michelle L.

description: I've been twice, and I've had a great time x 2!  The only thing I would suggest is turning the music up a bit...just for those nights when a dance floor is just necessary.  Otherwise, it's great.  Inventive cocktails (I loved the cranberry crush for a little something different), casual atmosphere, large enough to gather with a crew...perfect!  Dinner at Cortez + cocktail at Rye = my dream.
author: Sarah D.

description: Another great downtown hang out. The music is okay and the bar gets crowded. It's a good alternative if you can't get into the other bars in the area. They are known for their cucumber mojitos and martini with cucumber and kiwi. If you like to mingle, the crowd is nice and friendly and local.
author: Jess D.

description: This is a great place to go when you don't feel like dealing with the pretentious crowds over at the other nice bars. I'm usually one of those people who loves the mainstream "seen and be seen" places. I had been to Rye once before, but was so plastered that I didn't remember how nice it was! Forget waiting in line, forget the asshole bouncers, forget dress codes....Rye is GREAT! Nice atmosphere, chill people, fantastic bartenders (one of them recommended Hanger One Lime with Half Soda and Half Sprite- try it...although you will probably sound like the most picky person at the bar, its so yummy its worth it!), and they also carry two of my favorite vodkas- Pear Grey Goose and Hanger One Lime. What could be better?
author: lauren j.

description: Not a bad place considering it's my first time experiencing SF nightlife.  Coming from L.A. and hearing how awful and boring I should expect the Bay Area to be, I couldn't be more satisfied with Rye.  It's a nice place to have good, decently priced drinks and a wonderful place to socialize.  Crowd is a good mix.  I wouldn't mind coming back here in the future.
author: JC F.

description: Fresh fruit and good spirits make me a happy girl! I've been here a couple of times, and they always have a fun drink special that is delish and fresh and lovely. Since I am ghetto and live fairly nearby (don't judge me!), the location is pretty convenient, even if you do have to step over some crack hoes to get there. They also do a good job of making fruity drinks that aren't too sweet, and if you get there early in the evening you can ask the bartender about said sweetness or lack thereof and get an actual answer.
author: Jeani H.

description: Cool place, great drinks.  Tried the basil gimlet.  It was pretty good.  I was impressed.   Really hard to get a drink after 11 but if you get a table u get a cocktail girl who can fetch em for ya.
author: Shawn L.

description: Not totally sold on this place - I came on a Saturday night and found the narrow lay-out of the bar to be a bit annoying; I felt like any group of more than a couple people is forced to stand single file.  But the crowd was filled with attractive ladies, and there's something to be said for a bar that attracts a gaggle of cute girls.  I think I need to go back.
author: Anthony D.

description: Yummy drinks! I tried the blackberry cooler and also had some sort of lemon drop with a request for strawberry stoli instead of citron- if you like strawberry lemonade you should try that! Yum! Went home fairly drunk- had a hangover all day Sunday...I guess I'm leaving off a star because of the guy from LA who hit on me (who let him in?!) and a lack of much of a crowd for me to attempt to flirt with in my giddy drunken state...oh, and dig on the jawbreakers that were left by Daily Candy- double yum! I am always down for some extra sugar...
author: Diane S.

description: Nice small/medium-sized bar to meet with a few friends.  The mix of pop music with 70s-90s hits is certainly entertaining.  The cocktails are quite tasty, and they mostly go for $9.  Table service is extremely slow--this was the only bad quality.  Other than that, it's a sweet spot with a pool table.  It was quite empty for a Saturday night, but it was easier to chat with friends.  The crowd was also mixed...some hipsters, some dressed up...  The smoking cage is hilarious--an actual cage, but somehow it manages to be tasteful.
author: Lily C.

description: One of my new favorites in the city. They have really excellent cocktails made with fresh fruit and the lounge is a great place to chat it up with some friends. Also a great spot for meeting people. My only complaint is that I went last Saturday night and it was so crowded it was difficult to get drinks. However, I've before on the weekend and found it to be quite comfortable.
author: Jenine L.

description: This place bores me.  I've been here once before, didn't like it.  Was forced to come back here again this past weekend - and didn't like it.  The crowd is full of yuppies, it's a really uninteresting, unapproachable crowd, not my type of scene.  There's a great drink list, but the bartenders take forever making the drinks.  There was one girl working there who would rudely move people aside without even saying a simple "excuse me", and the lady bartender had a total mean mug.  Drinks are good, but unfriendly service and uninteresting crowd made me want to leave, leave, leave and never come back... pass!
author: Christine Y.

description: Fantastic drinks and a mellow atmosphere. Unfortunately, it often gets invaded for corporate after parties. They've got pool table in the back, but you'll keep coming back for the drinks. The principle bartender is well known and liked for her great creations.
author: Mike V.

description: Rye is a down to earth bar with fantastic fresh fruit drinks. This is a great date place as it is never overly crowded.
author: Sonia W.

description: I have never had a Vodka Gimlet with basil before.  I liked it very much.  This "Rye" on the loin surprised me.  I'll be back.
author: Jere C.

description: One my of favorite new loungy bars in the city.  Good place to start off the night.  Cocktail prices are very reasonable and are quite strong.  Very stylish interior as well.
author: Cameron M.

description: Got a little loud here after 11p; could  barely hear people talking...energectic vibe though
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Ended up stopping by Rye this week for a meet up for an ecommerce related event.  It was somewhat tough to find, vary small door, no name outside and I think the street numbers were hard to find. I liked the brick motif and the pool table. Reminded me of a sport's stadium to a degree. The drinks were what you would expect, and served up quickly even with a crowd.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Vodka Basil Gimlet and Sazerac are all I need in this place. Chill bartenders are adventurous and knowledgeable.

Look for Mrs. Robinson Society members early in the evening. These classy women are great conversationalists, if you can keep up.
author: Elias R.

description: Meh, it's an all right place to go with friends, but it is ridiculously crowded and not quite worth the long wait you might have to get in. Service is incredibly slow.
author: Mark A.

description:
I am going to revise my earlier abuse of this poor bar.  I received a very kind note from someone claiming to be one of the owners of Rye who seemed genuinely concerned that I had such a negative experience.  Or maybe concerned about the one star rating mitigating the overall glowing reviews.  Either way, it was a nice touch.  Point taken- on weekends this whole neighborhood is overrun with all kinds of weirdos- crowding around every watering hole with their Drakkar smarminess.  Nothing the nightlife can do about that.  So I am going to up my rating a bit from one to three to try and be a bit more even-handed.  It does go to show you that ratings on these sites are 100% subjective and usually based on a single brief experience.  Maybe, much as a restaurant critic does, to be less biased I will have to return a second or third time.  This time, as this mysterious co-owner suggested, for hand-crafted whiskey cocktails on a Tuesday.  Then again, us proletariat are not professional critics, are we?  I must admit that the inside of the bar is quite beautiful- from what I could see as I weasled my way to the bar.  Yes, and the bartenders were gamely facing the onslaught, doing a good job handling the crowd four-deep at the bar.  Also I felt welcome even though I was not exactly "dressed to impress," not that I would know how to do that anyway.  I suppose most of my complaints are directed at the insane volume of people squozen into that place.  Can't fault a business for being successful, or can you?
Mea culpa.

My original reaction after a night at Rye runs below: 

ugh.  my god.  ugh.  

If there's an award for most douchtastic bar, this one is a frontrunner.  I'ver never seen so many guys with striped button-down shirts, unbuttoned to there, paired with flip-flops.  Chicks tend to be of the flat-ironed hair,floofy maternity strapless shirt variety.  Drinks are pricey.  From what I remember, the people were packed like spaghetti into the space.  On a cold SF night I was sweating like a whore in church from the crowd.  And the poor smokers were in an actual cage- finally someone has found a way to imprison them.  Mostly I feel sorry for the suckers that flock to this pretentious sweatlodge looking for flat-ironed poon.  They are sure to be disappointed.  Me- I'll be at one of the sad-sack bars on Polk.
author: Mags P.

description:
On the advice of fellow yelpster, Brad L., I visited Rye - the holiest shrine I have yet encountered on my pilgrimage to the Holy Land of Brown Liquor (Scotland?).  I visited at 4PM on a Thursday, which is probably the best time to visit any bar.  (Their A-Team is on duty, but the crowds are generally non-existent.)

The 411:  It's a hipster bar full of web designers, rockabilly girls, and other socially ambitious types.  It's gray, brutal architecture seems oddly well matched to a place devoted to the consumption of real drinks.  And the drinks... and the bartenders... are worth the trip.  

Ask for Carlos.  Ask for a Blue Blazer.  Get the story.  You will be AMPLY rewarded.  (Cocktail: A-, Production A+++++++)  Frankly, Rye makes me embarrassed for all of the other places with the stones to claim the word "Bar."

PS.  Two blocks too far from Rye is crack-addict central, SF.  Just F your I.
author: jeremy t.

description: We visited Rye last night for the first time last night to enjoy cocktails before our anniversary dinner at Fleur de Lys.  The cocktails were awesome!  Fresh ingredients, creative combinations.  We will surely visit there again.
author: Elaine G.

description: Two words: Monkey Cage. We met up with friends at this place over the weekend. A little hard to spot. But I get it...no sign = hip, cool place. It's so new that they haven't yet equipped themselves with a credit card machine. It was a good time. We spent the entire night monopolizing the outdoor spot enclosed with a cage-like door (aka the Monkey Cage). It makes for perfect people watching...Similar vibe to Rosewood (which makes sense that they're owned by the same people). Definitely a welcome addition to the Tender Nob neighborhood. Plus, the location allows you to top off the evening with some grub from Osha next door.
author: Marie M.

description: Concrete floors, brick walls, beautiful wood sweeping up the high ceilings, bi-level, small outdoor (smoking) patio sectioned off with glass. Refined grunge, baby.
author: Melanie C.

description:
ok, i feel a little like a one trick pony, but here we go:

good whiskey selection?  CHECK
friendly bartenders? CHECK
nice outside smoking area? CHECK
sexy decor?  CHECK

sounds like 4 stars to me
author: Steve S.

description: Beautiful space.  Great drinks.  Totally dead on a Tuesday night...  I'll have to check it out on a busier night.  I may be inclined to bump it up to 5 stars...
author: sarah k.

description: Finally checked this place out last night. Really like the vibe and they made great drinks. If you're in the area highly recommend checking it out.
author: Sarah R.

description:
basil gimlets are as lindsay would say, "yummy." 
a wide array of scrumptious drinks. i went and didn't take one shot of something boring. tests the bartenders there. they love making actually drinks not just chilled shots of ketel.  
hey maya, just remember, "chatreause is not for rookies!"
author: aron w.

description: We were just strolling in the neighborhood and decided to walk in. Great interior and nice feel to it....good crowd and we had a nice time. Kudos!
author: Yan M.

description:
If you've just moved from LA and you totally miss going somewhere crowded with overpriced drinks and pretty people judging you then look no further! Rye is the place for you! 
Came here on a Friday night and it was packed. I do have to say that the bouncer was very nice and friendly, I have a thing about that and it's always nice when the first person you meet in a place is friendly and gives you a nice smile. However it was pretty much the last bit of friendliness I experienced that night at Rye. It's packed and you have to wait forever to order your drink. It's full of people who are there to be cool and frankly just about the only good thing about getting older is that you no longer feel the need to be part of that scene so I was very much over Rye in about five minutes. I am going to give them an extra star because the place is very nice looking, the staff was friendly and the pool table was free. I have a feeling this place might better on other nights of the week but on a Friday night it sucked.
author: Cathy T.

description: I kinda want to give 2 stars, but I think maybe I was just being overly picky last night, so I will give 3. Beautiful space! If I had a bar I wouldn't mind having this one. Cool outside area, and for a Friday night, it wasn't jam packed. That being said... it still took 30 minutes to get a drink. The bartenders have no sense of urgency which sucks when the place isn't even half full. I really wanted to be impressed with the cocktails also, but I just wasn't. The Dogpatch was good, but the tequila drink with cucumber and jalapeno syrup was FLABBY. Could have been sooooo much better. Add some spice or smoke to that thing and you've got a winner. Had some other eggy thing that was also boring. I'd like to come back and give it another try. I really wish the bartenders seemed like they cared about what they do.
author: Kris K.

description: Pretty nice lounge. I took a friend here on a tuesday night and had too much to drink.   I enjoyed the ambience here.  I like the dim light and dark colors.  The Belvedere martinis will knock you on your arse though.
author: James B.

description:
The atmosphere is laid back and the design has a spartan feel. They've got a pool table in the back and a step down lounge to the side along with a "cage" on the street for smoking (a nice feature).

Rye, has some of the most creative and tastiest cocktails in the city.  The Basil Gimlet (with Gin) is on 7x7's "100 to try before you die" SF list. It is Delicious!

I prefer to go on a weeknight when the place is a little slower. Most of their drinks are labor intensive and are best when the bar tender is not rushed.  

The place gets very crowded on weekends, the small bar get swamped and service backs up resulting in irritated barmaids and irritated customers.
author: Frank S.

description: Strong and high quality vodka drinks. Great dj. Good scene. One of the nicer bars that I've been to in the Tenderloin.
author: Wes F.

description: sexy lounge with swinging jazz? I think not! this place is one of SF's biggest disappointments- due to one lady who is single handedly sabotaging the joint. From the moment I walked in her eyes averted any new customers as she continued to drag her limp body from one end to the other.. A sad sight when you have a full bar of customers thirsty for their next 7 and 7! The only goal of her shift is to run the place into the ground, which at this point is her only success. Fortunately I carry a flask, which saved me for the 17 mins I waited for her coworker (who looks like a man on crack in comparison to her) graciously serve me after running circles around her tired soul. RYE GET REAL AND SAVE THE BAR BEFORE SHE TAKES THE WHEEL AND DRIVES IT OFF A CLIFF!!!!!!
author: Kyle B.

description: Mellow bar with a nice urban professional scene. People were pretty friendly and not uptight. Interesting drinks (i.e. the use of a raw egg), but one star off for serving Tecate (in a can!) instead of serving Coronas.
author: Kat F.

description:
good on weeknights
not on weekends.
the marina is the other way....
sometimes drinks take a while when guys order cosmos and shit. but the bartenders are good and friendly and they have good taste in music. had the misfits on last time i was in there.
author: Tim B.

description: This place is kind of classy for the tenderloin. I did meet some people from New York here. I was a little disappointed that when I ordered a drink from todays specials the bartender did not know how to make it. Bizarre. Anyway she did adapt and made me something..like almonds and rum. I do prefer dirty places though just too clean and a little pretentious.
author: Jason W.

description: Rye actually gets 4.5 stars in my book. I love a good dive bar as much as the next guy, but lets be honest, I am a chick. Every once in a while you want to get a little bit dressed up and go somewhere kinda swanky where they serve something other than Pabst on tap and the lighting is dim so you look way hotter. The basil gimlet is delish--I probably had one or five too many by the way judging by the way I feel today, but it was totally worth the hangover and I'd do it all over again. The only reason Rye doesn't get a full 5 stars is because the bouncer let in that relentless bitch at the pool table who was so not cool the whole night. Gotta weed out the riff raff Rye...there are plenty of bars in the city for WT fat chicks to hang and shoot pool. Other than that, great place...I'll be back.
author: Kristin B.

description: If you like going to a sausage party and over priced drinks, this is the place for you. On a Friday night, it was a 4 to1, dude to chick ratio.   I could only say two semi-positive things about this place: 1) smoking section: although you feel like your in jail because of the metal bars, its keeps the homeless from asking you for smokes.  B) its close to other better bars in the neighborhood.
author: Sang K.

description: Rye is a weekday Paradise.  The bartenders are amazing, Amanda is great and makes a mean Manhattan.  It is just a very chill place that you can chat with your friends and make new friends quite easy.  The only problem is on the weekends.  It's relatively a small place but man they cram everyone in and it changes my whole vibe.  So I highly recommend on an off night looking to drink with your buddies, but the weekend is tough because people come from everywhere to experience the beautiful wonders of the LOIN.
author: Evan L.

description:
beautiful bar, great staff, nice space and tasty drinks....

but a not so great button down crowd! the videos playing on the wall made up for it though.
author: David F.

description:
One of my favorite SF bars (the other is Rickhouse).

Rye is a laid-back place with a pool table in the corner but the whole interior has a mellow upscale feel.  The space is small but with lots of standing room, and I've never had to push to get to the bar.  I also appreciate how I don't have to shout just to have a conversation with the person next to me.

Drinks are strong and unexpected, but very tasty.  The quality (and price, unfortunately) reminds me of the drinks served at Bourbon & Branch.  I'm not a huge fan of the basil gimlet but I've liked every fruity cocktail I've had here, and they use fresh fruits.  The bartenders work pretty fast considering everything they have to do to make just one concoction, so be patient!
author: S L.

description: I would highly recommend Rye if you are looking for a low key place to drink and chat. I went on a Friday and it was not overly busy. There was a ton of fresh produce behind the bar. My friend asked for a muddled cucumber and clementine cocktail that was quite refreshing. I don't think it had a name but it was sooo good! The decor and atmosphere are nice but really the drink sold me on this place!
author: Lindsay B.

description: basil gimlet. loved the crowd and atmosphere. we sat at the bar aka best seats in the house (if you can grab one!).
author: Sarang Y.

description: What a beautiful little place tucked away in the TL! This place has great ambience.. dimly lit, simple furniture, brick wall, no dancing (yeah, that's right, I usually don't like to hang out at dance clubs). However, the music was just way too loud for the atmosphere... we were yelling to have a conversation. The smoking cage is kind of amusing, especially from the outside. Overall, I'd come here again.
author: J. L.

description: I like the decor and the finishings, but HELLO, how small can their glasses be? Seriously, they had the smallest martini glasses I've ever seen. I didn't pay for my drink so I have no idea if they charged $10 or $5 for it, but come on now, anything more than $5 would've made it totally not worth it. The bar also has a weirdish set-up. You walk in and the main room has the bar with a booth and seats, but the side room is kinda isolated...I dunno. I was bored so I left and went to Harlot.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place on a Sunday night was perfect for my friend and I to have a drink while chatting.  I love the dark yet chic atmosphere and the seating in the back.  I've also been here on a crowded Sat. night and the scene was a little Marina but tolerable.  The bartender is competent (never underestimate the power of a bartender who can actually do his/her job!) and drinks came pretty fast.  One of my favorite bars in the city.
author: Nene K.

description: Cool looking bar, yummy drinks, great ownership. The crowd is well...eclectic. Never sure who you might run into there but you'll definitely run into people you know. Try the Basil Vodka Martinis, they are delish. Worth a visit, especially since the Ambassador across the street is always too crowded on the weekend with some ridiculous "list" that you must be on to gain entrance.
author: Heather L.

description: I've been here a handful of times.  I really enjoyed their basil gimlet.
author: Nicole C.

description: Went here for a pre-dinner drink, to check out this new place. I haven't been to Rosewood or Romolo so I have nothing to base my expectations on. The place was very quiet and the owner was bartending, who was extremely kind and easy going. Based on the music and art alone, I liked the bar. Based on the delicious fresh crushed blackberry-lemon drop, this bar is fantastic.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Small venue, great ambiance, decent alcohol and old school hip hop that's being played from a CD.  They only had one bartender who was pretty quick with his drink service.  The crowd was cool but this venue is located in the TL.  Just be careful who's hiding in the dark corners.  If you're going alone, take a cab.
author: Manton R.

description:
I frequent this bar as I live about a block away. The drinks here are really good and the atmosphere is about what I look for in a bar, especially for casual drinks. I give 3 stars b/c I cant give 3.5 and : 

-The bartenders never seem to be very happy. The ones who work on slower days are more upbeat, which is nice. I appreciate someone taking their job seriously, but grumpy bartenders suck. The drinks are labor intensive here-- it can take a long time, but, come on...take a shot.

-Its Bro-ed out in here a lot of the time. A couple Wednesday nights ago we saw a stretch hummer limo pull up and 20 sorority girls spilled out. Guys with gelled hair, jeans, button ups and black leather Sketchers frequent this place, especially on weekends. 

- I wish they had a DJ here, maybe even a dance area, instead of taking up all that space with a free pool table.
author: Roger W.

description: Literally waited over 20 minutes to get a drink here tonight (a thursday). Granted, the drink tasted great, but the crowd was kind of pretentious, and the choice of music was mediocre. The people who work here are quite nice though. I half expected the security dude to tell me I couldn't come in because I was wearing sneakers (wasn't the case, but its that type of crowd).
author: ben k.

description: I knew I'd be back here the first time I walked in here. The place definitely adds the perfect touch of class to the tenderknob. The brick walls and couches by the fireplaces give this place a really classy feel. It seems like a great low key place to hang out and have drinks with close friends. I didn't get to drink too much since I went in tthe night before my 28th birthday party, and was saving myself for absolute debaucery the next nite.
author: Srinivas R.

description: The basil gimlet is pure genius.  Also, magically, there's always somehow at least one empty corner where you can enjoy your drink in relative solitude.
author: shoba d.

description: I've only been on what could be called an off night, but this definitely struck me as my kinda space. Nice staff, clever (and tasty) house drinks (savory gimlet... yum!), gorgeous and open space. A little soundproofing might help with the echo factor, but hey, it's a bar. A very classy and swelligant bar for the TL. What's not to like?
author: Aaron L.

description: Pretty crowded for some private party that we managed to get into, and ran into some friends we knew, and met up with some others. A good place to go for a drink before heading down to the Nile Cafe hookah lounge down the street.
author: Antara B.

description: I love this bar!  Every specailty cocktail is so tasty.  I love the basil gimlet, and sometimes i substitute the basil with mint, just to switch it up, and my boyfriend loves getting a hanger lime gimlet there!  I have tried so many of the specialty drinks, but i always go back to the gimlet...its because they use all fresh ingredients...i just love finding bars that have the yummiest cocktails, it is so much better sitting down with friends, sipping on great drinks, instead of a cluster fuck bar with shitty vodka redbulls...so over that!
author: Lyndsey H.

description:
After a scintillating Chinese New Year dinner in China town, at a restaurant that was quite tasty and didn't make my innards bubble, (we cabbed it over to Rye) we rolled like the Donald in Kat's Green Safety Machine to Rye (appolgies to my beautiful Katrina how could I forget the Green Volvo and the money parking) to continue the nights festivities.
We arrived a little early so the place wasn't very crowded, but the girl sitting in the front booth was talking like it was packed. Her screeching shrieking voice was literally penetrating the lining of my eardrums ahhhh bad start@!
So I swiftly more out of earshot from that cackling hen and ordered a round of Glenfiddich Rocks. OUCH 15 flicks to the nuts!!! So, the drinks are costly, whatever I've been flicked in the nuts before. It's really not that bad.
After a couple more flicks to the nuts I get outside for a smoke in the "Cage"  and have a nice conversations with a couple friends that I don't get to see regularly. The nippy weather is getting to us so we mosey back in to see that the crowd has tripled and gotten like 2 feet taller.  I think it was GIANT night at the bar. I'm not the shortest dude in the world, but come on. I think the Warriors practice squad must've been there.
The women are pretty and they wear the cute little tops that show off their sexy little shoulders and gym sculpted backs, the drinks are stiff, but there is not much room at the front and middle of the bar.  Definitely a place to meet a hot chick spend lots of money on her drinks and hope that she didn't just reaffirm that you really are a sucker. Usually along with these girls and LV bag and the 7 Jeans (Are those even still "in"?) come that bitchy pretentiousness that make me want to shit my pants so everyone can say "What is that smell?"
All in all the place is somewhere to burn holes in your pockets and get drunk. I'm more of a dive bar kind of guy, but none of my friends are so I have to go to places like Rye. BTW if we hadn't swooped and when i say swooped I really mean "Mutha Fuckin SWOOOPED!!!!!" on the front booth for the whole freakin night, my rating probably would've dropped to 1star. It's amazing what good company will do for a boring place. 
I've heard happy hour is cool here tho?!?! maybe?
author: Michael S.

description: Beautifully designed little space, delicious cocktails made with real fruit, and bonus for being across the street from my apt. not so fun when its packed on saturday night, but makes up for itself the week over.
author: tulipa L.

description: Nice bar to have drinks at with a few friends.  It's located in the lower Nob Hill/west of Union Square area which means parking sucks, but sometimes you can get lucky.  It's pretty roomy inside, but I wish they had more places to sit.  The bar is very dark and the pool table in the back seems really out of place to me.  Rye specializes in fancy cocktails made with all sorts of fresh fruits and ingredients.  I had something called the Flash (I think) which had kiwi and cucumber in it.  It was a bit sour, but was well made.  My second second cocktail was some of cranberry flavor with whole blueberries floating around in it.  It was great!  Prices are pretty reasonable - about $9-$10 a drink.
author: Karen K.

description: Sweet little bar tucked into a wall.  I can't remember how many times I walked by without even realizing it would soon contribute as a piece to my puzzle of alcoholic bliss.  The brick wall/wine rack/candle-lit/cage-for-smokers/cellar vibe is very dig-able.
author: Andrew P.

description: Fantastic drinks, great decor, good crowd.  Highly recommend.
author: Alyssa W.

description: No complaints here on Rye. Drinks are always solid, crowd is decent (especially if you're a girl). It's nice that they have the lounge area to the side but frankly I always forget it's there and would feel somewhat removed from the action. Maybe if they had a DJ (as Jeremy S. suggests), they could make some room down there for booty-shaking. Regardless, two very enthusiastic thumbs up for Rye!
author: Susan L.

description: I really like this place. The decor, the ambiance, the music, the bartenders, and the drinks. Very well crafted drinks. I learned a new favorite in the gin fizz I got here. Definitely I place I want to explore some more. Not the coolest overall crowd the day I went, but the staff and place made up for it in my mind. Go here with people, not to meet people.
author: Jon N.

description: Love the chill vibe here. Had an Orchard Cocktail and another called The Flash (like super cucumber water + kiwi and more). Both had egg whites (interesting). I don't get the people who come here to exclusively swig Tecates and Anchor Steams (neither on tap, none here). It's called Rye, after all. Well, the vibe is pretty cool I guess. And the bartenders are cute chicks...
author: Maximillian M.

description: Cute nice bartender, good drinks and relaxed atmosphere in a trendy looking place. I love it!
author: Karen T.

description: This is a nicely done space,  it reminds me of an upscale version of hemlock tavern with an outdoor smoking deck and house music instead of punk.  Its nice decor and wood paneled ceiling give it a trendy feel,  but getting a drink can take some time, but there is a nice sitting area to relax and wait in.
author: Doug D.

description: I know what Rye's trying to do with the modern furniture and stark setting; it just missed the mark by a hair.  The space just seemed too overwhelmed and cold.  And maybe I was there on the wrong night (was there on a Saturday), but the crowd seemed a bit too bridge and tunnel for my liking.
author: Helen C.

description: Good spot, incredible drinks.  Probably a good idea to go on a weeknight, because weekends are KA-RAZY.  Overall friendly staff.  Love the outdoor area.  I don't smoke, but it's a nice spot to sit in before all the smokers get out there.
author: Kate C.

description: Eh...not as intimate or interesting as B&B around the corner, but good enough for a bar in the tendernob...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Other reviews are pretty spot on. Went here on Friday night after Thxgvg to do a laid back 25th birthday (mine) celebration. We had a few tables in the lower area of the bar off the main entrance. Was a good spot to hang out with friends and catch up. Music was pretty eclectic from what I remember but the drinks were pretty awesome. Although I was being fed Herradura shots (good tequila is still...tequila), the Basil Gimlet was very solid and the best Old Fashioned I've ever had really grabbed my attention. Can't comment too much on the people since the group I was with took over a good portion of the bar. Last note is the smoking cage is awesome since you can enjoy multiple forms of poison (alcohol & nicotine) at once. Great times.
author: Ahsan M.

description: Cool place to hang out and we were lucky to get a booth.  It was modern and sleek with a pool table in the back.  Pretty good size place to hang out.  Unfortunately, I didn't get a drink since I was driving, but I will go back since everyone there was really nice, the servers and the random people there.
author: vanessa c.

description:
pretty friendly bartenders, and usually a good selection of stuff (i usually drink hangar 1 and different scotches).

best part- it's only a few blocks from my pad.
author: Alan N.

description: Attentive bartenders, good smoking area if you smoke, pool table, but not a lot of seating space, so we ended up leaving after one drink.  since no one was playing pool, they might be better  off adding some more tables.
author: Marina F.

description:
nice setup and peeps at the door were extremely friendly (welcoming you by name after taking your id...a long lost art).

great drinks and use of the space (bar area w/ pooltbl, separate room with a good number of 4 seaters, and then a smoking lounge).

downside - it's really loud.
if you only expect to hear half of a conversation, you'll be aight.

I'll be back.
author: Dpb T.

description: Great place! It was pretty empty around 7 PM, which was fine by me and my friends...unlimited pool and the bartender made some great drinks - may i suggest Thai Me Up...unique and delicious. The dark, modern decor was something to talk about as well. The smoking cage really amused me, but i assume it's fun to people watch from there or be look at by the public passing by.
author: Anita C.

description: Amazing, fresh drinks- but go here on a week night or with someone you'd rather stare at than talk too because the music is way too loud!
author: laura a.

description:
My pub crawl made a stop here.  Nice space, but it got too crowded with the 100+ people in our posse.  

The reason for the two stars is that our organizer got pissed at the bartender, as he refused to honor the drink specials that had been negotiated beforehand.  Ended up offering us a drink special after I had already bought a round of the $9 cocktails.
author: Catherine Y.

description: I had heard about this place and had it on my list of places to check out.  I somehow randomly ended up here on Saturday night, not even knowing it was Rye at first.  My friends and I had planned on going to Ambassador, but when we got there we were overwhelmed with the massive crowds standing in front and waiting in line (I'm not a fan of super crowded places).  Therefore, we decided to check out the bar across the street with the funky looking cage.  I gotta say...you really can't judge a place in SF by its cover.  I was pleasantly surprised by the good crowd, decent drinks, and chic ambiance.  I also liked the setup in the second room (the wine wall-rack thing is a nice touch).  All in all, a good place to check out!
author: E M.

description: maybe it was offnight, but my drink was too sour!  Bartenders were really cute and nice though.  I just wish my fancy drink tasted better. Cantina is better for the funky drinks thought.
author: Nima K.

description: This place is really small... I stopped by long enough to take two photos with my friends and then left. Maybe Thursday is an off night? because there was no one around...
author: Leily P.

description: Rye has unique drinks and a funky decor. The crowd is chill, and the space is intimate. Very fun for happy hour!
author: Jamie C.

description: Liked it, didn't love it.  We came at 10 and had to wait in line despite the fact that the place was half-empty when we actually got in - hate that.  It was nice that the place didn't get super packed and it was relatively easy to get a drink.  The crowd was fairly Marina-esque.  Decent music playing but unfortunately no dance floor (boo!).  Chill vibe, a good amount of seating.
author: Melinda C.

description: Great decor and atmosphere + great drinks. The raw-egg whiskey sour was incredible... and you thought whiskey sours were the same everywhere?
author: Roman N.

description: Walked into this place while exploring the area. It was lively for a Thursday night. The bar was decent with a good selection of whiskey. I ordered a "Pisco Sour" which did not disappoint. I'd definitely go again.
author: Erik F.

description:
this is a good spot for enjoying a cocktail for the taste and the space. 

they have nice classic and some unique/original cocktails.  basil gimlet and the ginger special were delicious.

go early to avoid crowds and enjoy a fine drink ( or two). lots of inexpensive good food nearby to balance out the spendy bevvies
author: Christine B.

description: I went tonight after Osha Thai Noodle. i think its a beautiful space, and on a monday night it was nice and mellow, just how i like it. i will definately be back.
author: sarah C.

description: Nice decor, okay crowd, and one killer drink that you must try: The Basil Gimlet. It's on the menu next to, like, the 'Golden Rye Fizz' and other more impressive-sounding concoctions, but don't let that fool you. The Basil Gimlet actually seems cheap at $9 -- it is really, really good.
author: robin s.

description: Great Geary St. hang with a decidedly un-Union Square feel. Think minimalist design carried out in woods, with a metal fence on the perimeter to give it a rather urban "fire escape" feel. Great music, drinks, bartenders, atmosphere, and times. Hopefully the vibe can be maintained in the forseeable future.
author: Jay D.

description: Yup, this place really is that cool.  Great bartenders, great service.  Super great crowd.  We came here for a birthday party last night and had a really good time.  Everything is sleek and fun.  They have some yummy looking specialty cocktails - and I think my new quest is to make it back to try them all -- and that fruit and cheese plate, that looked fantastic.  Too bad I was already full from my farmerbrown dinner to indulge on some fruit and cheese.
author: Katie P.

description:
you can go here to get a good drink in a nice place without the noise, crowds, cover, bad music and bullshit. 

the pool table is free, there are TWO bathrooms, and they put the smokers in a cage like the animals they are. kidding.

UPDATE: i lied! i think the other times i went were flukes - this place can get crowded as hell on friday nights, and it's a dog eat table/seat world in there.
author: Lisa M.

description:
OK, Rye.  I get it.  You're hip and lounge-y and everybody seems to want a piece these days.  But does that really mean you need to advertise yourself with such garish flare?  Your billboard of a sign is a freakin' eyesore.  A blight on the Geary Street horizon.  Extraterrestrial beings are shuttering their windows to block out your look-at-me lights.

Joking aside (Rye's sign is scripted in 8pt typeface), Rye is hip and lounge-y, and everybody does seem to want a piece of the action.  I've been twice in the past two weeks, and the bar has been packed to the gills.  My first night, the bouncer imposed the one-in, one-out rule when I stepped out for a minute, leaving me in the cold for 15 minutes (Test of Patience No. 1).
