And despite the fact that there have been a veritable fleet of bartenders on when I've been in, the service isn't fast--probably because they specialize in fancy, time-consuming cocktails (Test of Patience No. 2).   But having passed both tests with a certain degree of pride, I can say that the wait(s) has been worth it.
author: Hannah J.

description: I'm being more and more surprised at the amount of lounges that Tenderloin has.  Rye is cool and Trendy, my favorite part is their patio.  Prices are at least 6 07 per drink.  Overall a good find.
author: Dishar R.

description: So I went here with my friends one night early in the week, it was a quiet night but that was ok. The bartenders were fab especially the female one( I'm sorry but I don't remember her name), any way she served me the BEST amaretto sour I have ever had! It was amazing and I will be going back.
author: Morgan B.

description: Small place.  Nice modern look.  The wine rack/wall is a nice touch.  Video projected onto the wall is kinda cool.  Although I agree with some reviewers that the portion of the joint that looks onto the street looks like a stinking cage for monkeys.  I think what I liked most was the fact that this place wasn't annoyingly packed on a Saturday night.  It was busy, but we were able to grab a table at 10:15.  The bartenders are friendly and know their stuff and we got a couple of free drinks that night which is Gold in my book!  In terms of the crowd, I wouldn't know... I was too busy drinking and hanging out with my friends!
author: Tim L.

description: My brother and I visited this establishment a week ago and we had the good fortune to meet John, the owner.  A personable guy who has managed to create a great bar, John introduced us to the wonders of the basil gimlet.  This bar would fit comfortably in New York, but with a more laid back SF vibe.  Only downside is the shortage of bathroom facilities but that can be forgiven.
author: David G.

description: i love this place!  I love making it my last drink and smoke of the night.  I usually end there after having visited vessel, the redwood room and ambassador.  Awesome to do all four in one night.
author: Romea M.

description: this place was sweet! Thanks John for accommodating a bunch of crazy women and their entourage of men. My new favorite waitress Erica kept the drinks coming even though she had to climb over a sea of people to get to us. The music was a good blend of hip hop but sometimes too faint for me to sing along too which might have been a good idea. And A+ for all the good looking people that made my girlfriends salivate. If you can get a seat reserved in the front near the bar... EASY ACCESS... to the bar that is
author: flo t.

description: Neat bar - I love the wood on the ceilings...it's a very clean and spacious bar.  I don't care much for the pool table though - it seems a little out of place for the look they are going for, but people were playing all night.  The music was good.  The drinks were strong.  It was a little pricey though for vodka / cran (and they didn't get their shipment on Saturday so they were out of Kettle One and Grey Goose, which I realize isn't their fault but worth mentioning because they still charged a little much for the lower end vodka I received).  It is on the north end of the TL; on the weekend there are so many people out and it doesn't feel like you are in that bad of an area.  Anyway, it's a cool bar and I will go back soon.
author: Rise G.

description: Mostly, I just really love the design and layout of this place.  I'm not a big cocktail guy, but these ones are excellent.  Easy to run up a big tab if you're throwing them back because they're not very big.
author: Adam Z.

description:
this is a great bar that i've only just gone to this past weekend.  i would give it 3.5 stars, but my opinion is the same as everyone else's reviews - the drinks are on the smaller side.

great vibe and feel of the place, the place wasn't that crowded on thursday night, and ultimately, deserves a go-back.  i can see this place being a regular stop through.
author: Jason J.

description: Superb bartenders. Knowledgeable and super personable. Awesome drinks. Cool modern relaxed space.
author: sanjee w.

description: Hand-crafted (unfortunately slightly slow-crafted) drinks in a spacious converted loft makes this a good place to have a good drink and chill with friends.
author: Andy K.

description: Jon and Greg strike again! One block from my house! Hooray!
author: David M.

description:
great space, but hot as hell inside. get some ac, we're sweaty in here!

to note, lots of collared shirts in here.
author: eve l.

description: one of my favorite spots in the city ~ and I am a great lover of this city. Greg L. has done a fantastic job with Rye. The fresh fruit cocktails are bold, creative, yummy and original (a curry-inspired drink with naan garnish!) and the staff is friendly and accessible. I threw a party here and it was the perfect space. it hits that perfect balance of crispness and warmth. love it.
author: Sheridan P.

description: Great cocktails. Sounds simple, yet very few bars in this city seem to get it  right. The ambiance is mellow and cool, but I really don't give a sh*t about the aesthetic...just an added bonus. I just really appreciate a well-crafted cocktail.
author: Pete D.

description: This is a great place. The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable. Drinks are made with fresh ingredients and they have an excellent selection of whiskey. They make an amazing Manhattan. There's also a pool table towards the back which is free. I recommend happy hour, mid-week.
author: Justin C.

description:
"What do you do with a drunken sailor, what do you do with a drunken sailor, what do you do with a drunken sailor, early in the mornin'?" 
I wake up with this song stuck in my head EACH AND EVERY MORNING.  No lie.  And it all started at Rye.  
I've been drunk many-a-time in my life.  More than I should admit.  Although I've been to Rye many times, there's one night in particular that makes Rye so beautiful.  I got there before Sloppers and fairy-Matty, and feeling adventurous I decided to order a Maker's Manhattan.  Uh-oh.  It was so f'ing delicious that it was down my gullet in a minute.  Second Maker's Manhattan even better than the first.  Fairy-Matty shows up, 3rd drink.  And on and on.
To summarize a long night:  I lost count of how many drinks I had.  At one point I tried to light a smoke from the wrong end.  At one point I called one of my managers on the phone trying to get in her panties.  At one point my left eye closed because it too was way overly drunk.  

Great place...except on weekends.  I like the quietness and space of this place during the week.
author: Zev K.

description: Go there on slow nights. My first time there was a weeknight and the bartender, a cool funny girl dressed like Kermit the Frog (could I make this up?), made super drinks and I loved the place. The second night was very recently, as part of a pub crawl. Size does matter, apparently. Our ever-growing group seemed to overwhelm the staff (but they knew we were coming, so there's no good excuse) and I have to say that our waitress was kind of a jerk, and the drinks much more expensive than I was counting on. So, my take on this is that Rye is awesome when they're slow, sucks when they get too busy.
author: Josh K.

description:
went to kim thanh for dinner and walked across the street to this hole-in-the-wallsish bar/lounge.  the bartenders knew what they were doing and it didn't get overly crowded.  their martini list is creative and something to envy.  i will be going back.

p.s. nob hill?  i thought this was still in the tenderestloin.
author: Adela K.

description: The drinks are well poured by awesome bartenders,especially Amanda. Its decently priced and they have a really good vibe going for this place. The bouncer is even a cool guy. the staff is just all around nice and the music is good,not to mention the free pool.
author: Jason B.

description: Mellow bar, nice place to come with friends and chill.  I had a mixed drink that was pretty darn tasty.  They have a cool little smoking patio too.  We came here when Ambassador gave us the run around.  Decent music, but it's more of a lounge bar.  Plus, Osha Thai is right next door if you get the hungries.
author: Sarah F.

description: Rye is a fantastic place to go for a happy hour libation.  Happy hour deal was $2 off their cocktail menu,  making drinks $8.   Get here early....the deals end at 7.....wait a couple more hours and then the douchebags really start showing up.   If I was single,  and wasn't there with a large group of friends,  I would have been bored........very high guy:girl ratios (ie, not good for the single guy) and expensive (FIDI priced) drinks bring this place down from 4 to 3 stars for the previously mentioned reasons,  PLUS,  their drink-making is very inconsistent.  We ordered sazeracs from both of the male bartenders that night,  and they tasted like two completely different drinks.  That shouldn't happen.
author: Pete D.

description: I really enjoyed going to Rye. I went the other night on my 21st birthday and it was really fun. It was pretty empty, one because it was a Tuesday and two because we went pretty late before it closed. The bartender Paul made me a special shot for my birthday (which tasted like chocolate) and also gave my friend and I a lesson in bar tending 101. Diego, another guy who works there was also very nice. The only drawback was that at closing time the bartenders were a little pushy in getting everyone out, the next time I go I'll try to go a bit earlier in the night.
author: Starr R.

description: I like going to Rye, it's close to home and I love the feel of it.  I go there when I'm looking for a lounge type place to have a nice drink with a friend.  Their drinks are delicious and unique.  I love the Cucumber Gimlet, yummy!  I also like the fact that the facade isn't overly flashy, in fact it's pretty easy to miss it if you aren't sure where it is located.  The look of the inside is great and I like that they have a smoking cage attached to the building.  The bartenders have always been super friendly and attentive.  All in all a fun place to go occasionally, but the crowd can be somewhat lame on occasion.
author: Rachel S.

description: Rye is a great bar to go to.  I stress bar because from what I remember, there isnt much else besides that.  That being said, they defintiely have make some great drinks here and it is extremely laid back.
author: Charles C.

description: This is my friend's favorite place. First time there for me. I liked it. Very good crowd and good drinks. Music was good and there was plenty of space, despite there being a lot of people there. Good atmosphere as well. Would definitely go back.
author: Mike C.

description: Nice modern look with a young crowd which fit my niche.  The Gimlet is worth the price just to try the unique taste.  Free pool is a nice touch and doesn't get too crowed to stop play.  Went on a Friday night got packed and thinned out all in an hour span from about 11:30 to 12:30.
author: Justin K.

description: All rigth so every one and there grandmother have written a review on this place, but with good reaso.  It is a respectable bar that has good cocktails and an attentive staff.  After a terrible experince at Bourbon and Branch we decided to try out this hip happening place, the bar was three deep and we still got our drinks and shots with in moments.  they were tasty and well balanced and the tequila was delicious.
author: brian m.

description: Since I am a fairly regular user of Yelp, sometimes I feel compelled to contribute. I wouldn't mind just reading reviews but it's a give and take situation so here is my opinion of Rye. Despite the crowd and usual Friday night chaos in the city, still a cool place. Rye was especially good after spending 15 minutes at Swig. Why is that place so crowded?  I have to go back again to appreciate the design, but the main point here is I remember thinking there is something to appreciate.  Of course, I am biased towards any bar that takes drinks so seriously. The feeling of walking into a human bird cage to smoke was an additional bonus.
author: polina S.

description: The bar counter is fairly small, but lots of seating areas and there is an  outside smoking section. Free pool table is available too!
author: Jelly G.

description: Fun place with really yummy drinks. They seem to have taken the ones with fresh crushed berries off the menu but will still make them if you ask. Still, expect them to be pricey. I don't mind paying more for a specialty drink but paying 9 or $10 for just a plain stoli vodka and soda is a rip-off.
author: SL N.

description: Great drinks. Nice vibe. Cool peeps at the bar to chat with. Nice little patio to smoke on. I liked it... have been back a few times. I say go for it. Have the bartenders mix you up something then kick back and check out all the beautiful people in our amazing city. And bring some ones for the walk out on the street to take care of the locals. :)
author: Robert A.

description: From the outside, this bar seems great. A little gem. Then you introduce yourself to the bartender, Jen. You realize the martini's don't have enough gin, and the bum's stare with a grin. The bouncer, who's name is Jim, says hey there buddy, I'm living in sin. Soon you'll realize the crowds diversity is thin, hipster's, Goth's, and a  girl named Tim. And you'd rather have stayed home with Rum, Vodka, or maybe less. Either way, it can't be this bad, can it?
author: J R.

description: Love the design of the place and the people that venture here.  It's all handsome and pretty.
author: Jay A.

description: One time I waited a good 20 minutes for a stand-in bartender to make me a drink. It was delicious.
author: Angelica M.

description:
Some of the best drinks I've ever had.

That said, small and no beers on tap.

But, they do have a pool table (yes, only 1), so that can be fun.

Be warned: every time I've been here it's been incredibly busy (getting a drink will take a while) and it's not really a pick-up bar. It is, however, an awesome place to get a few really yummy drinks (and you can blow the money you saved eating next door at Osha)
author: C V.

description: Love the exposed brick walls and overall interiors.  I like places with nice spaces, and I count this as one. Best thing about this place though? It's next to Osha Thai.
author: Helen K.

description:
I like the vibe in here. The drinks are really phenomenal. The bartender's word for it was "savage...we serve savage drinks here." 
And it was true. I stumbled out of Rye and into a cab, and made way into my apartment to hit my bed. Rye did me well. 

So yes...if you like Rosewood and 15 Rommolo, you will like Rye!

PS: Ladies...if you're looking for love, this may be a good place to start...or at least um, for lust.
author: Nicole R.

description: Groovy, swank, hip, and nifty are adjectives I won't use to describe rye. I'd rather see 'dandy' start making a come-back.
author: John G.

description:
Wow, what can I say?  This place was so unbelievably pretentious that I was shocked.  I watched my friends be completely overlooked in favor of a bunch of yuppie douchebags who I am assuming they think are better tippers?  Not being anyone to play the race card ever, especially since I was the only white girl in the bunch, but when all my asian friends asked me to get the drinks after waiting for so long...there's a problem.  Not really sure what's going on there but coming from someone who waited tables for eight years, not cool. 

  Aside from that, the place is great. The atmosphere is really nice and there is a caged in smoking area for those of you who like to have a little tobacco moment.  I hate to be a hater, because aside from the jerky bartenders I could be so into hanging out here.
author: Nicole L.

description: I could have walked to another bar, ordered a drink, finished said drink, walked back, balanced my checkbook, straightened my hair and redesinged my apartment in less time that it took to get a drink here on Friday night.  If you want a Marina bar, but can't be bothered to get over that pesky hill, Rye is the place for you.  But not for me.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Jen is truly  an amazing bartender- love her!!  

Great attitude; a really a beautiful person all around. 

Jen is insightful in the way she concocts her drinks .

Every drink  made by Jen is "well balanced" &  ohhh so yummy!
author: Erika M.

description: Pretty decent bar, easy to get into, good drinks, better atmosphere than the wanna-bes who think they're somebody at Ambassador. Definitely a recommend.
author: Mike T.

description: I LOVE this place!!!  The fresh fruit in the drinks is fab, and the atmosphere is easy!
author: Lacey G.

description: I've only been four times, but every time my drink was LOVELY, and the bartender was gracious and charming. I also have to commend them for the design of their storefront -- it's really hip and clean but at the same time really appropriate for that area on Geary - "Lower Nob Hill" aka North Tenderloin.
author: nora v.

description: Nice laid back ambiance if you want to chill with a tasty drink.  Would have given it 4 stars, except for the terrible music.  Music selection jumped all over the board from nintendo soundtrack-like tunes to hard rock.  This place could really improve the vibe by just picking some better music.
author: Hilary C.

description: It's a good  place, but I'm not sure if I need to return. Rye is the kind of joint that has all the ingredients of greatness but something is missing. Maybe its the crowd I don't know, but I found the two times that I went there both disappointing for different reasons. The first time the Jalisco heat cocktail was screaming good, the second time, not so much. The first time the bar wasn't too terribly packed with annoying people, except for the sorority girls discussing like "oh my god they use such fresh ingredients, what's a sazerac?!" Oh my god I thought to myself, like any good watering hole should and if you don't know go back to TGI Fridays! Oh man I sound like a booz snob, I'm not I promise, i was wheened on Smirnoff and other horrible swills... but seriously, it's a good place, its just not consistent from visit to visit. I see a lot of eye balling of cocktails at this joint. The jiggers don't come out regularly, funny enough, the Jalisco heat which was great the first time was measured, the 2nd time, it was a Friday night, it wasn't measured and didn't exactly jive, rather the flavors of the various ingredients didn't jive the way they did the first time around. So go ahead, go check out the bar, i'd suggest a week day vs. a weekend, too nutty then... go early try their good rye cocktails and judge for yourself...
author: Len S.

description: nice looking bar, cool vibe, stiff drinks and good location
author: Spencer G.

description: Hmmm not sure about this place.  I went there on Friday night for my friend's birthday party to spend most of my precious party time outside in a "line" which is a big no-no for me and had it not been my friend's b-day, I would have cut out in a heartbeat.  We finally had to take a tone with the bouncer as he was letting people in that didn't even have to wait in line and when he finally decided to let us in but not the one guy we were with, that created yet another problem....so lame.  The place wasn't even at capacity so as far as creating a bogus, unneccessary line was definitely uncalled for.  Oh, and don't get me started on the bartender (the male bartender).  What a complete asshole who obviously was unable to work hard under pressure as it appeared as though they were short staffed....Quite frankly, I don't care.  I've been to several crowded bars that can work it out behind the bar regardless....Get it together!
author: Danielle V.

description: I am so glad that Rye is in my neighborhood. This place makes drinks on par with Nopa, and I don't even have to worry about waiting for the N. This ultra hip lounge is located in the Tendernob on Geary between Leavenworth and Jones. As you enter you'll find the bar but if you continue down a few steps there is an additional room with tables and comfy chairs with walls lined with wine bottles on one side, and white bricks on the other where they project their light show magic. We sat at one of the tables- at around 9 the place is not terribly crowded- and are served by a very nice waitress who is patient as we deliberate over the oh so many mouthwatering cocktail choices. After careful consideration, my drink of choice consisted of gin with pummeled kiwi, cane sugar, cucumber, and lemon. In fact it came with a sliced cucumber floating inside and I made a comment, perhaps inappropriately so, to the waitress that it looked like spa water (ie that water they serve with cucumbers and fruits). Maybe she didn't know what I meant, since she looked appalled, but I quickly informed her that it was only a compliment, since I do indeed love spa water! I only tried one drink here, since next stop was Toronado, and I had the Bay to Breakers to run early the next morning, but I will indeed be back, and plan to sample a specimen closely related to the kiwi-cucumber variety, but instead with basil. The kumquat creations looked tasty too...so many choices it almost stresses me out (but somehow I'll get over it).
author: Kate A.

description: I use to live in SF and moved away about two years ago. there are so many things i miss about the city, great food, people and always a great conversation you can start or join in at the local watering holes. I would have to say the thing i miss the most is Rye! The bartenders and owners have always made me feel like i have their undivided attention, even when they are super busy they may not be able to sit and chat but they never ignore you and i always return with a beautiful drink and and amazing smile. I'm not sure what their secret is but I'm guessing it has to do with the fact that everyone who works there seems to enjoy what they do. Every bar i happen to go to from now on will be judged by this place and most places don't even come close. If you have time, stop by and say hi to Jen and the rest of the gang. I try to get there a little early so i beat the rush, I would recommend a basil gimlet or even ask the bartender what they recommend. After you grab your drink and head to the outside smoking area and strike up a conversation with one of the many amazing people standing around. I was celebrating my 30th birthday on Sunday and Monday in the city and ended up stopping by there both days. I believe every first Monday of the month they have a cocktail competition for local mixologists, something i highly recommend checking out. Talking to some of the other patrons there that night i learned the history of Guinness beer and even got talking to a chef that i cant wait to go check out his restaurant.
author: Eugene S.

description: Fun, chic place with fresh mixology behind the bar.  Love the caged in patio.
author: Lisa L.

description: definitely another good bar like rosewood and 15 romolo (same owners) with great drinks.  i had several (and i do mean several) delicious blackberry coolers, and i also heard a lot of people excited about the basil gimlet.  not a gimlet girl myself though.  the music was good, although the crowd could have been better and more... it wasnt that busy for a saturday night.  but i had fun and would definitely go back!
author: Carolyn B.

description: I went to Rye two nights ago  with a friend to meet her friend at his birthday celebration. When we got there her friend was well on his way to wasted ; but I bought him a shot of patron for the birthday boy and one for myself and 2 rum and cokes. That came to thirty bucks...not bad but not cheap either. The rum and coke was nice and strong(plus). There was a nice mix of people; no cheap and slinky shirt girls and ghetto boys. No dance floor but you could dance if you wanted and the music was great!(plus). Since it's a bit on the small side my friend and I were standing near the bathroom and there was no line and it appeared clean (huge plus). Fast forward about an hour and a half later and we rejoin the b-day boy and his crowd. This fool is trashed!! And he turned 25 so I was thinking he should be over that s*** ; but he was definitely all over and inside the sloppy drunk M.O. Then real subtle-like he turns his head and spews all over the floor next to the booth he's sitting in.SICK!! So I ask the bartender for a stack of paper towels and attempt to sop it up a bit. Everyone around me was all disgusted and his buddies were embarrassed and avoiding each other's gazes. The more paper towels I spread onto the mess the more comical it became...like sprinkling petals in a wedding or something. Someone came by with a can of Folger's coffee to sprinkle on the mess and it was swept up. Ingenious!! They left, or more accurately, they were helped out by the bouncers. After that it was smooth sailing. The bartenders were all really nice and when I closed my tab after the first and only round they took off part of the tab because of the whole vomit fiasco. Awesome!! I am definitely coming back sans barfo to enjoy the chill atmosphere with no cover, fabulous staff and interesting crowd.
author: JoAnna S.

description: very hip bar in a seemingly pretty hip part of town. they have speciality drinks that will make you wanna hurry and finish the one you ordered so you can try another, very friendly bartenders (who even gave my gf a taste of their new, up and coming whiskey), modern paintings, art and furniture, and a small jail-like outdoor area. a little trendy and shi shi for my general taste, but a very nice place to take your friends who enjoy more of that scene.
author: Eva L.

description: everytime i walk by this place i yell at the people in the smoking room "youre in a prison!"
author: Victor B.

description: i dropped over 200 bucks in this place and i tip 2 bucks per drink EVERY TIME. thats how i roll....and not once did a bartender offer me a drink on the house. call me a crazy white person from the east coast but to me thats just bad buisness. cool spot though( i gotta keep it real)*****i'm not going back**********
author: Dave L.

description: great bar! classy people and the bartenders put a lot of love in their cocktails.
author: Casey N.

description: Rye is a nice upscale bar that smokers love.  We tried to go to the Ambassador for drinks last night but they had a private party so we crossed to Rye.  From the outside it was packed.  The "cage" of smokers was full.  Which was hilarious since once we got inside there was plenty of room for the most part.  So when I say cage, they have an artsy installation that separates the outside patio to the inside lounge via glass.  There was only one bartender there last night and we had to wait a bit for our drinks, but the space is nice, there is a pool table with girls that randomly dance around it (at least last night there was).  There are comfy booths are bar seating.  For a Tuesday night, busy enough, and comfortable enough.  There was a large bowl of oranges and limes in front of me that I was itching to poach, but held back.  I've been there for happy hour as well and I have to say it was packed.  There was a special on the board, but Todd went with Blood and Sand and I asked for a Beautiful for old times sake, but they didn't have Courvoisier (umm hello you are a lounge!!) so I differed to my current go to, Fernet.  Tuesday night at 10pm is comfy.
author: Diana L.

description: great bar, great owner, great staff, great drinks, great smoking area.  nuff said.
author: Pickle R.

description: the honey basil gimlet is fabulous, free pool, good vibe, nice space.  went on a monday, decent crowd.  friendly bartenders
author: kiki b.

description:
disregard my previous ranting; merely the product of a lapse into immaturity.

all i can honestly say is this bar is not my type of place. it happens to be a favored place for certain groups of people who i do not roll with.

i am not a fan of said people coming into my neighborhood and talking down of it, but so it goes. of course, no bar chooses its clientle, but it does market and design itself after the preferences of someone.

2 stars for giving me my drink after a decent wait.
author: Saikat P.

description: Recently revisited and now my new favorite cocktail bar in SF. John, one of the co-owners, is awesome and a super nice guy. He has some good stories to tell about the place. Doug, one of the bartenders, is super into cocktail, spirits, and gastronomy and will tell you all about the amazing world of avante-garde cocktails. And he makes a wonderful libation involving Carpano Antica.
author: Ben M.

description:
best mojito ever!

both stalls in the women's bathroom had broken locks.
author: Aiko L.

description: i suppose san francisco is popping out hip, industrial and swanky lounges at a faster rate than hollywood pops babies. as with both, i don't really care. however, i have to admit that my girlfriend and i had a nice time here. although rye is more sterile and sleek than i would have preferred, the drinks were pretty good and the vibe was surprisingly mellow. heck, even the contemporary sofa was comfortable. it was indeed a comforting way to start the saturday night before our late dinner at canteen...
author: frisco j.

description: Nice casual bar scene (very crowded); i think it must have been "tall people" night last night, as I felt like a Lillipeutian, and I stand 5"7". Average bar service. Nice alfresco area. But, man, it was hot in there. Somebody PLEASE figure out some kind of cooling mechanism!
author: Michelle P.

description: My boyfriend and I went to this bar a few weekends ago. We were really happy to have stumbled upon it because the decor was lovely and there was no cover charge. I went to the bar to order a drink, and I waited a long time. The bartender served drinks to many people who came up to the bar after me. I finally said, politely, "I've been here a while", and she explained that she would help me after she had gone down the row of people standing at the bar. I told her that I was there before any of those people, and the people before them. She ignored me. Poor etiquette. We left.
author: Amanda R.

description:
i had read a bunch of reviews about this place so i kind of knew what to expect... a slick looking space and a bunch of yuppies. when i walked in, i instantly noticed how large the place seemed with its huge vaulted ceilings. i also liked the exposed brick in the wall. but after being there a bit, the place just seemed *too* empty. maybe they needed some couches or something, but i just felt like i was in an empty warehouse or something. too much dead space. also, there weren't that many people there either, so that made it seem even more dead. the bar itself was fairly small and i just kept having the feeling like some people had set up a makeshift counter in an empty building. ok, ok, obviously the place wasn't just "thrown together", but i just wasn't feelin' it. the drinks were pretty damn good though. i had a basil gimlet which although a bit of an odd combo, worked pretty well i thought.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com )
author: vlad k.

description: good cocktails.  i went during yelp drinks week, and i enjoyed it thoroughly.
author: Benjamin C.

description: i don't know why i like this place. the clientele is kind of douchie and the drinks aren't cheap. but they do have that smokers' cage, which is where i usually end up for the night, even though i'm not a smoker. so, love the cage...LOVE IT.
author: alina p.

description: Great bar.  Has the same feel as Rosewood but a little nicer and without the dance floor.  I had a birthday party here that worked out very well.  Greg even let me give him my iPod and choose all the music for the night, which was awesome.
author: Nate B.

description: Good drinks, good atmosphere, great company. Order yourself a basil gimlet, unless you don't like basil. Delicious. One more down on the 7x7 list.
author: Jeannette L.

description:
wow 600 some reviews? will anyone care to read mine? can i just write some jibberish and get "cool" and "funny" marks? if you are actually reading this... eat me!

anyways, this place is to small, unless you are fortunate to score some seats... nonetheless a very happening and hip place... the waitress recommended me a beer... in a can! is that wierd?
author: Ed M.

description: Very cool bartenders who are into the art of making a fine cocktail. Industry night is a fun one here. Amazing cocktails, I have stolen some recipes to make at home.
author: Kelly J.

description:
they make some seriously nice drinks here. so nice that you almost don't mind paying nine dollars for them. almost. you've got to go during the week, or on the weekend before 11. after that it gets way too crowded and there are way too many people who look like they need go on that show what not to wear. also there was some seriously underage looking girls in this place. now, i am all for fake IDs. i got mine my first year in the city when i was living in the USF dorms and there was an address getting passed around that was somewhere in middle america where you could send $20 and a photo and you'd get back a pretty good ID that said you were from south dakota. i got mine, and you know where i went? i went to the marina. because that's where you go when you are 18. not the loin. aw, the kids these days, they grow up so fast. but i'm going to have to say get the fuck out. these kids do not belong in the loin or the mission or downtown or anywhere else where 30 year olds prefer to drink. i have fucking done my time in this city and i refuse to have to drink with the college kids. and these little girls could not have even been in college. 

ok, enuf of that tirade. back to the drinks. my favorite is the basil gimlet. be smart and get it on the rocks. it feels like you get more than if you get it in a martini glass. and when your cocktail is $9 you better get as much as you can out of it. i think i licked the inside of my glass.
author: rachel p.

description: good gimlets and a drink called the flash w/ kiwi, lime, and cucumber...i felt like i was at a spa.  yum!  pretty chil place w/ a patio for smokers.
author: Helen T.

description: Unique infused Spirits, exceptionally creative cocktails and an opportunity and for scholarly conversation about premium spirits with friendly bartenders.
author: Brett C.

description: Wow I can't believe I've never been here before. The atmosphere & architecture here is beautiful. The music was great and I'll definitely be back.
author: Cbr A.

description: a good option for the area. the owners/workers are pretty cool and they play surprisingly good music - as one might expect to hear techno or top 40 shite at a place with nice decor and a sometimes douchie crowd. they got a smoking cage too - however, expect to get harrassed by crazy street people. it's kinda funny how we're the ones in the cage ...
author: James J.

description: i hate that this kind of place is on the block. high tide is 10 times better. why would you pay an asshole bartender in a wanna-be upscale bar 10 bucks for a drink. the people drinking and working there don't live or care for the neighborhood and i wish they would leave. this is the type of place that ruins a neighborhood.
author: Chizzy T.

description: if you appreciate the industrial aesthetic, you will like rye immediately.  even when the place fills up, you don't feel crammed in, because there are seating areas for up to 4 people at each.  the bartenders are on their business and serve it up quickly without attitude.  a bit on the pricey side, but at least you can have a conversation without having to scream. much.
author: regina k.

description: great vibe, smoking patio (though you kind  of feel like a caged animal), pool table, a few couches/ottomans to sit at.  but really...the reason it's great is because their cocktails are awesome.  don't order your standard gin and tonic here...well at least venture beyond that at least once.
author: Terence M.

description: terrible on the weekends if you're actually looking to try their cocktails, as the bar staff are working too fast to make them well. will try it again during the week.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: during the week this place is pretty chillll. a perfect place to go on a date and sip on a cocktail on the leather couch-thingies. the bartenders are really nice and have decent taste in music to boot. but on fridays this place gets pretty crowded, probably thanks to the fact that the ambassador is busy not letting people in across the street. stick to this place on sunday-thurs and you really can't go wrong. the class of the tenderloin. or the tendernob. whatever.
author: Nathan S.

description: Wow.  I totally agree with the yelpers - Rye is *definitely* a cool place to be.  The true test - the bartenders VOLUNTARILY recommended drinks that required muddling and fresh herbs saying that "it keeps it fun."  That's just a good bartender.  Plus the bloody mary on sunday has a naan and tomato garnish.  I love that!
author: Anjali K.

description: This place was okay...The drinks were good but the vibe was strange.  If you're a smoker there is a little indoor/outdoor smoking area which can be nice for those who partake.  The bartender seemed annoyed at everyone which was annoying.  And you can't hear a thing, the music is so loud my ears were ringing hours later.
author: L M K M.

description: modern, sleek and inviting with the wood and fireplace. good crowd. great selection of alcohol and i have to say i am especially impressed with the bar and its fresh garnishes. they use FRESH lemon juice and syrup instead of ready-made sweet and sour mix-- that majorly differentiates the yummy drinks.
author: eriin w.

description: is this really in nob hill? i thought it was in the 'loin fo sho. best drinks i've ever had in my life. and they are always changing! they use only fresh ingredients- fruits, veggies, and herbs, yummy! chill loungy feel. plus, they have a smoking cage where you can watch bums and trannies out on the street!
author: Sarah C.

description: A caveat: I have only been to this place during happy hour time so I haven't seen the crowd but the space is bad ass.  The brick walls w/ high ceilings and the outside cage is awesome.  Unfortunately, no beers on tap.  You should definitely check this place out!
author: Brooks O.

description: great place to start of a night.  decor is brick, concrete, wood, metal.  they have a pool table, friendly service, comfy seats, a big mirror, projected film, music you'll recognize, but might not have heard in a while.  one wall is a wine cellar.  nice for a rainy saturday night place to chill or to hang out and talk with friends.
author: Smilingspiders C.

description: My favorite place to hang out in San Francisco.  The crowd is pretty chill, not too "bridge and tunnel" but not extreme TL.  The staff is super friendly, the ambiance is clean, industrial/modern, and the basil gimlets are worth the trip.  Never a cover, and not overly crowded on a Saturday night.
author: Bert D.

description: Good bar, solid drinks, nice atmosphere. I went on a weekday and it was SUPER chill and almost empy. But I see why everyone likes this place so much.
author: foodbot c.

description: Not the best place for the weekends if at all, at least there were some better places whithin walking distance like Swig and Element Lounge so our trip to this side of market was not a total waste.
author: sarie r.
